Douay Rheims - Latin Vulgate Parallel Bible

Table of Contents

Previous Book ---- Next Book

THE BOOK OF PSALMS

The psalms are called by the Hebrews TEHILLIM, that is, Hymns of Praise. The author, of a great part of them at least, was king David: but many are of opinion that some of them were made by Asaph, and others whose names are prefixed in the titles.

Chapter 1

Beatus vir. The happiness of the just and the evil state of the wicked.

1 Blessed is the man who hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the chair of pestilence: 1 beatus vir qui non abiit in consilio impiorum et in via peccatorum non stetit in cathedra derisorum non sedit
2 But his will is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he shall meditate day and night. 2 sed in lege Domini voluntas eius et in lege eius meditabitur die ac nocte
3 And he shall be like a tree which is planted near the running waters, which shall bring forth its fruit, in due season. And his leaf shall not fall off: and all whatsoever he shall do shall prosper. 3 et erit tamquam lignum transplantatum iuxta rivulos aquarum quod fructum suum dabit in tempore suo et folium eius non defluet et omne quod fecerit prosperabitur
4 Not so the wicked, not so: but like the dust, which the wind driveth from the face of the earth. 4 non sic impii sed tamquam pulvis quem proicit ventus
5 Therefore the wicked shall not rise again in judgment: nor sinners in the council of the just. 5 propterea non resurgent impii in iudicio neque peccatores in congregatione iustorum
6 For the Lord knoweth the way of the just: and the way of the wicked shall perish. 6 quoniam novit Dominus viam iustorum et iter impiorum peribit

Chapter 2

Quare fremuerunt. The vain efforts of persecutors against Christ and his church.

1 Why have the Gentiles raged, and the people devised vain things? 1 quare turbabuntur gentes et tribus meditabuntur inania
2 The kings of the earth stood up, and the princes met together, against the Lord, and against his Christ. 2 consurgent reges terrae et principes tractabunt pariter adversum Dominum et adversum christum eius
3 Let us break their bonds asunder: and let us cast away their yoke from us. 3 disrumpamus vincula eorum et proiciamus a nobis laqueos eorum
4 He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them: and the Lord shall deride them. 4 habitator caeli ridebit Dominus subsannabit eos
5 Then shall he speak to them in his anger, and trouble them in his rage. 5 tunc loquetur ad eos in ira sua et in furore suo conturbabit eos
6 But I am appointed king by him over Sion, his holy mountain, preaching his commandment. 6 ego autem orditus sum regem meum super Sion montem sanctum suum adnuntiabo Dei praeceptum
7 The Lord hath said to me: Thou art my son, this day have I begotten thee. 7 Dominus dixit ad me filius meus es tu ego hodie genui te
8 Ask of me, and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance, and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession. 8 postula a me et dabo tibi gentes hereditatem tuam et possessionem tuam terminos terrae
9 Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron, and shalt break them in pieces like a potter's vessel. 9 pasces eos in virga ferrea ut vas figuli conteres eos
10 And now, O ye kings, understand: receive instruction, you that judge the earth. 10 nunc ergo reges intellegite erudimini iudices terrae
11 Serve ye the Lord with fear: and rejoice unto him with trembling. 11 servite Domino in timore et exultate in tremore
12 Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord be angry, and you perish from the just way. 12 adorate pure ne forte irascatur et pereatis de via
13 When his wrath shall be kindled in a short time, blessed are all they that trust in him. 13 cum exarserit post paululum furor eius beati omnes qui sperant in eum

Chapter 3

Domine, quid multiplicati. The prophet's danger and delivery from his son Absalom: mystically, the passion and resurrection of Christ.

1 The psalm of David when he fled from the face of his son Absalom. 1 canticum David cum fugeret a facie Abessalon filii sui
2 Many say to my soul: There is no salvation for him in his God. 2 Domine quare multiplicati sunt hostes mei multi consurgunt adversus me
3 3 . 3 multi dicunt animae meae non est salus huic in Deo semper
4 But thou, O Lord, art my protector, my glory, and the lifter up of my head. 4 tu autem Domine clipeus circa me gloria mea et exaltans caput meum
5 I have cried to the Lord with my voice: and he hath heard me from his holy hill. 5 voce mea ad Dominum clamabo et exaudiet me de monte sancto suo semper
6 I have slept and have taken my rest: and I have risen up, because the Lord hath protected me. 6 ego dormivi et soporatus sum evigilavi quia Dominus sustentavit me
7 I will not fear thousands of the people surrounding me: arise, O Lord; save me, O my God. 7 non timebo milia populi quae circumdederunt me surge Domine salvum me fac Deus meus
8 For thou hast struck all them who are my adversaries without cause: thou hast broken the teeth of sinners. 8 quia percussisti omnium inimicorum meorum maxillam dentes impiorum confregisti
9 Salvation is of the Lord: and thy blessing is upon thy people. 9 Domini est salus super populum tuum benedictio tua semper

Chapter 4

Cum invocarem. The prophet teacheth us to flee to God in tribulation, with confidence in him.

1 Unto the end, in verses. A psalm for David. 1 victori in psalmis canticum David
2 When I called upon him, the God of my justice heard me: when I was in distress, thou hast enlarged me. Have mercy on me: and hear my prayer. 2 invocante me exaudi me Deus iustitiae meae in tribulatione dilatasti mihi miserere mei et exaudi orationem meam
3 O ye sons of men, how long will you be dull of heart? why do you love vanity, and seek after lying? 3 filii viri usquequo incliti mei ignominiose diligitis vanitatem quaerentes mendacium semper
4 Know ye also that the Lord hath made his holy one wonderful: the Lord will hear me when I shall cry unto him. 4 et cognoscite quoniam mirabilem reddidit Dominus sanctum suum Dominus exaudiet cum clamavero ad eum
5 Be ye angry, and sin not: the things you say in your hearts, be sorry for them upon your beds. 5 irascimini et nolite peccare loquimini in cordibus vestris super cubilia vestra et tacete semper
6 Offer up the sacrifice of justice, and trust in the Lord: many say, Who sheweth us good things? 6 sacrificate sacrificium iustitiae et fidite in Domino multi dicunt quis ostendit nobis bonum
7 The light of thy countenance, O Lord, is signed upon us: thou hast given gladness in my heart. 7 leva super nos lucem vultus tui Domine dedisti laetitiam in corde meo
8 By the fruit of their corn, their wine, and oil, they rest: 8 in tempore frumentum et vinum eorum multiplicata sunt
9 In peace in the self same I will sleep, and I will rest: 9 in pace simul requiescam et dormiam
10 For thou, O Lord, singularly hast settled me in hope. 10 quia tu Domine specialiter securum habitare fecisti me

Chapter 5

Verba mea auribul. A prayer to God against the iniquities of men.

1 Unto the end, for her that obtaineth the inheritance. A psalm for David. 1 victori pro hereditatibus canticum David
2 Give ear, O Lord, to my words, understand my cry. 2 verba mea audi Domine intellege murmur meum
3 Hearken to the voice of my prayer, O my King and my God. 3 rex meus et Deus meus
4 For to thee will I pray: O Lord, in the morning thou shalt hear my voice. 4 quia te deprecor Domine mane audies vocem meam
5 In the morning I will stand before thee, and I will see: because thou art not a God that willest iniquity. 5 mane praeparabor ad te et contemplabor quoniam non es deus volens iniquitatem tu
6 Neither shall the wicked dwell near thee: nor shall the unjust abide before thy eyes. 6 nec habitabit iuxta te malignus non stabunt iniqui in conspectu oculorum tuorum
7 Thou hatest all the workers of iniquity: thou wilt destroy all that speak a lie. The bloody and the deceitful man the Lord will abhor. 7 odisti omnes operantes iniquitatem perdes loquentes mendacium virum sanguinum et dolosum abominabitur Dominus
8 But as for me in the multitude of thy mercy, I will come into thy house; I will worship towards thy holy temple, in thy fear. 8 ego autem in multitudine misericordiae tuae introibo in domum tuam adorabo in templo sancto tuo in timore tuo
9 Conduct me, O Lord, in thy justice: because of my enemies, direct my way in thy sight. 9 Domine deduc me in iustitia tua propter insidiatores meos dirige ante faciem meam viam tuam
10 For there is no truth in their mouth: their heart is vain. 10 non est enim in ore eorum rectum interiora eorum insidiae
11 Their throat is an open sepulchre: they dealt deceitfully with their tongues: judge them, O God. Let them fall from their devices: according to the multitude of their wickednesses cast them out: for they have provoked thee, O Lord. 11 sepulchrum patens guttur eorum linguam suam levificant condemna eos Deus decidant a consiliis suis iuxta multitudinem scelerum eorum expelle eos quoniam provocaverunt te
12 But let all them be glad that hope in thee: they shall rejoice for ever, and thou shalt dwell in them. And all they that love thy name shall glory in thee. 12 et laetentur omnes qui sperant in te in perpetuum laudabunt et proteges eos et laetabuntur in te qui diligunt nomen tuum
13 For thou wilt bless the just. O Lord, thou hast crowned us, as with a shield of thy good will. 13 quia tu benedices iusto Domine ut scuto placabilitatis coronabis eum

Chapter 6

Domine, ne in furore. A prayer of a penitent sinner, under the scourge of God. The first penitential psalm.

1 Unto the end, in verses, a psalm for David, for the octave. 1 victori in psalmis super octava canticum David
2 O Lord, rebuke me not in thy indignation, nor chastise me in thy wrath. 2 Domine ne in furore tuo arguas me neque in ira tua corripias me
3 Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am weak: heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled. 3 miserere mei Domine quoniam infirmus sum sana me Domine quoniam conturbata sunt ossa mea
4 And my soul is troubled exceedingly: but thou, O Lord, how long? 4 et anima mea turbata est valde et tu Domine usquequo
5 Turn to me, O Lord, and deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercy's sake. 5 revertere Domine erue animam meam salva me propter misericordiam tuam
6 For there is no one in death, that is mindful of thee: and who shall confess to thee in hell? 6 quoniam non est in morte recordatio tui in inferno quis confitebitur tibi
7 I have laboured in my groanings, every night I will wash my bed: I will water my couch with my tears. 7 laboravi in gemitu meo natare faciam tota nocte lectulum meum lacrimis meis stratum meum rigabo
8 My eye is troubled through indignation: I have grown old amongst all my enemies. 8 caligavit prae amaritudine oculus meus consumptus sum ab universis hostibus meis
9 Depart from em, all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping. 9 recedite a me omnes qui operamini iniquitatem quia audivit Dominus vocem fletus mei
10 The Lord hath heard my supplication: the Lord hath received my prayer. 10 audivit Dominus deprecationem meam Dominus orationem meam suscipiet
11 Let all my enemies be ashamed, and be very much troubled: let them be turned back, and be ashamed very speedily. 11 confundantur et conturbentur vehementer omnes inimici mei revertantur et confundantur subito

Chapter 7

Domine, Deus meus. David, trusting in the justice of his cause, prayeth for God's help against his enemies.

1 The psalm of David, which he sung to the Lord, for the words of Chusi, the son of Jemini. 1 pro ignoratione David quod cecinit Domino super verbis Aethiopis filii Iemini
2 O Lord, my God, in thee have I put my trust; same me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me. 2 Domine Deus meus in te speravi salva me ab omnibus persequentibus me et libera me
3 Lest at any time he seize upon my soul like a lion, while there is no one to redeem me, nor to save. 3 ne forte capiat ut leo animam meam laceret et non sit qui eruat
4 O Lord, my God, if I have done this thing, if there be iniquity in my hands: 4 Domine Deus meus si feci istud si est iniquitas in manibus meis
5 If I have rendered to them that repaid me evils, let me deservedly fall empty before my enemies. 5 si reddidi retribuentibus mihi malum et dimisi hostes meos vacuos
6 Let the enemy pursue my soul, and take it, and tread down my life, on the earth, and bring down my glory to the dust. 6 persequatur inimicus animam meam et adprehendat et conculcet in terra vitam meam et gloriam meam in pulverem conlocet semper
7 Rise up, O Lord, in thy anger: and be thou exalted in the borders of my enemies. And arise, O Lord, my God, in the precept which thou hast commanded: 7 surge Domine in furore tuo elevare indignans super hostes meos et consurge ad me iudicio quod mandasti
8 And a congregation of people shall surround thee. And for their sakes return thou on high. 8 et congregatio tribuum circumdet te et pro hac in altum revertere
9 The Lord judgeth the people. Judge me, O Lord, according to my justice, and according to my innocence in me. 9 Dominus iudicabit populos iudica me Domine secundum iustitiam meam et secundum simplicitatem meam quae est in me
10 The wickedness of sinners shall be brought to nought; and thou shalt direct the just: the searcher of hearts and reins is God. Just 10 consumatur malum iniquorum et confirmetur iustitia probator cordis et renum Deus iustus
11 Is my help from the Lord; who saveth the upright of heart. 11 clipeus meus in Deo qui salvat rectos corde
12 God is a just judge, strong and patient: is he angry every day? 12 Deus iudex iustus et fortis comminans tota die
13 Except you will be converted, he will brandish his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready. 13 non convertenti gladium suum acuet arcum suum tetendit et paravit illum
14 And in it he hath prepared to instruments of death, he hath made ready his arrows for them that burn. 14 et in ipso praeparavit vasa mortis sagittas suas ad conburendum operatus est
15 Behold he hath been in labour with injustice: he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth iniquity. 15 ecce parturit iniquitatem et concepto dolore peperit mendacium
16 He hath opened a pit and dug it: and he is fallen into the hole he made. 16 lacum aperuit et effodit eum et incidet in interitum quem operatus est
17 His sorrow shall be turned on his own head: and his iniquity shall come down upon his crown. 17 revertetur dolor suus in caput eius et super verticem eius iniquitas sua descendet
18 I will give glory to the Lord according to his justice: and will sing to the name of the Lord the most high. 18 confitebor Domino secundum iustitiam eius et cantabo nomini Domini altissimi

Chapter 8

Domine, Dominus noster. God is wonderful in his works; especially in mankind, singularly exalted by the incarnation of Christ.

1 Unto the end, for the presses: a psalm for David. 1 victori pro torcularibus canticum David
2 O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! For thy magnificence is elevated above the heavens. 2 Domine Dominator noster quam grande est nomen tuum in universa terra qui posuisti gloriam tuam super caelos
3 Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise, because of thy enemies, that thou mayst destroy the enemy and the avenger. 3 ex ore infantium et lactantium perfecisti laudem propter adversarios meos ut quiescat inimicus et ultor
4 For I will behold thy heavens, the works of thy fingers: the moon and the stars which thou hast founded. 4 videbo enim caelos tuos opera digitorum tuorum lunam et stellas quae fundasti
5 What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him? 5 quid est homo quoniam recordaris eius vel filius hominis quoniam visitas eum
6 Thou hast made him a little less than the angels, thou hast crowned him with glory and honour: 6 minues eum paulo minus a Deo gloria et decore coronabis eum
7 And hast set him over the works of thy hands. 7 dabis ei potestatem super opera manuum tuarum
8 Thou hast subjected all things under his feet, all sheep and oxen: moreover, the beasts also of the fields. 8 cuncta posuisti sub pedibus eius oves et armenta omnia insuper et animalia agri
9 The birds of the air, and the fishes of the sea, that pass through the paths of the sea. 9 aves caeli et pisces maris qui pertranseunt semitas ponti
10 O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! 10 Domine Dominator noster quam grande est nomen tuum in universa terra

Chapter 9

Confitebor tibi, Domine. The church praiseth God for his protection against her enemies.

1 Unto the end, for the hidden things of the Son. A psalm for David. 1 victori pro morte filii canticum David
2 I will give praise to thee, O Lord, with my whole heart: I will relate all thy wonders. 2 confitebor Domino in toto corde meo narrabo omnia mirabilia tua
3 I will be glad, and rejoice in thee: I will sing to thy name, O thou most high. 3 laetabor et gaudebo in te canam nomini tuo Altissimi
4 When my enemy shall be turned back: they shall be weakened, and perish before thy face. 4 cum ceciderint inimici mei retrorsum et corruerint et perierint a facie tua
5 For thou hast maintained my judgment and my cause: thou hast sat on the throne, who judgest justice. 5 fecisti enim iudicium meum et causam meam sedisti super solium iudex iustitiae
6 Thou hast rebuked the Gentiles, and the wicked one hath perished; thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever. 6 increpuisti gentes periit impius nomen eorum delisti in sempiternum et iugiter
7 The swords of the enemy have failed unto the end: and their cities thou hast destroyed. Their memory hath perished with a noise: 7 conpletae sunt solitudines in finem et civitates subvertisti periit memoria eorum cum ipsis
8 But the Lord remaineth for ever. He hath prepared his throne in judgment: 8 Dominus autem in sempiternum sedebit stabilivit ad iudicandum solium suum
9 And he shall judge the world in equity, he shall judge the people in justice. 9 et ipse iudicat orbem in iustitia iudicat populos in aequitatibus
10 And the Lord is become a refuge for the poor: a helper in due time in tribulation. 10 et erit Dominus elevatio oppresso elevatio oportuna in angustia
11 And let them trust in thee who know thy name: for thou hast not forsaken them that seek thee, O Lord. 11 et confident in te qui noverunt nomen tuum quoniam non dereliquisti quaerentes te Domine
12 Sing ye to the Lord, who dwelleth in Sion: declare his ways among the Gentiles: 12 cantate Domino habitatori Sion adnuntiate in populis commutationes eius
13 For requiring their blood, he hath remembered them: he hath not forgotten the cry of the poor. 13 quoniam quaerens sanguinem eorum recordatus est nec oblitus est clamoris pauperum
14 Have mercy on me, O Lord: see my humiliation which I suffer from my enemies. 14 misertus est mei Dominus vidit adflictionem meam ex inimicis meis
15 Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death, that I may declare all thy praises in the gates of the daughter of Sion. 15 qui exaltat me de portis mortis ut narrem omnes laudes tuas in portis filiae Sion
16 I will rejoice in thy salvation: the Gentiles have stuck fast in the destruction which they prepared. Their foot hath been taken in the very snare which they hid. 16 exultabo in salutari tuo demersae sunt gentes in interitu quem fecerunt in rete quod absconderant captus est pes eorum
17 The Lord shall be known when he executeth judgments: the sinner hath been caught in the works of his own hands. 17 agnitus est Dominus iudicium faciens in opere manuum suarum corruit impius sonitu sempiterno
18 The wicked shall be turned into hell, all the nations that forget God. 18 convertantur impii in infernum omnes gentes quae oblitae sunt Deum
19 For the poor man shall not be forgotten to the end: the patience of the poor shall not perish for ever. 19 quoniam non in aeternum oblivioni erit pauper expectatio pauperum non peribit in perpetuum
20 Arise, O Lord, let not man be strengthened: let the Gentiles be judged in thy sight. 20 surge Domine non confortetur homo iudicentur gentes ante faciem tuam
21 Appoint, O Lord, a lawgiver over them: that the Gentiles may know themselves to be but men. 21 pone Domine terrorem eis sciant gentes homines se esse semper
9a:1. a:1. Why, O Lord, hast thou retired afar off? why dost thou slight us in our wants, in the time of trouble? 22 quare Domine stas a longe dispicis in temporibus angustiae
9a:2. a:2. Whilst the wicked man is proud, the poor is set on fire: they are caught in the counsels which they devise. 23 in superbia impii ardet pauper capiantur in sceleribus quae cogitaverunt
9a:3. a:3. For the sinner is praised in the desires of his soul: and the unjust man is blessed. 24 quia laudavit impius desiderium animae suae et avarus adplaudens sibi
9a:4. a:4. The sinner hath provoked the Lord, according to the multitude of his wrath, he will not seek him: 25 blasphemavit Dominum impius secundum altitudinem furoris sui non requiret
9a:5. a:5. God is not before his eyes: his ways are filthy at all times. Thy judgments are removed form his sight: he shall rule over all his enemies. 26 nec est Deus in omnibus cogitationibus eius parturiunt viae eius in omni tempore longe sunt iudicia tua a facie eius omnes inimicos suos dispicit
9a:6. a:6. For he hath said in his heart: I shall not be moved from generation to generation, and shall be without evil. 27 loquitur in corde suo non movebor in generatione et generatione ero sine malo
9a:7. a:7. His mouth is full of cursing, and of bitterness, and of deceit: under his tongue are labour and sorrow. 28 maledictione os eius plenum est et dolis et avaritia sub lingua eius dolor et iniquitas
9a:8. a:8. He sitteth in ambush with the rich, in private places, that he may kill the innocent. 29 sedet insidians iuxta vestibula in absconditis ut interficiat innocentem
9a:9. a:9. His eyes are upon the poor man: he lieth in wait, in secret, like a lion in his den. He lieth in ambush, that he may catch the poor man: so catch the poor, whilst he draweth him to him. 30 oculi eius robustos tuos circumspiciunt insidiatur in abscondito quasi leo in cubili insidiatur ut rapiat pauperem rapiet pauperem cum adtraxerit eum ad rete suum
9a:10. a:10. In his net he will bring him down, he will crouch and fall, when he shall have power over the poor. 31 et confractum subiciet et inruet viribus suis valenter
9a:11. a:11. For he hath said in his heart: God hath forgotten, he hath turned away his face, not to see to the end. 32 dixit in corde suo oblitus est Deus abscondit faciem suam non respiciet in perpetuum
9a:12. a:12. Arise, O Lord God, let thy hand be exalted: forget not the poor. 33 surge Domine Deus leva manum tuam noli oblivisci pauperum
9a:13. a:13. Wherefore hath the wicked provoked God? for he hath said in his heart: He will not require it. 34 quare blasphemat impius Deum dicens in corde suo quod non requirat
9a:14. a:14. Thou seest it, for thou considerest labour and sorrow: that thou mayst deliver them into thy hands. To thee is the poor man left: thou wilt be a helper to the orphan. 35 vides quia tu laborem et furorem respicis ut detur in manu tua tibi relinquuntur fortes tui pupillo tu es factus adiutor
9a:15. a:15. Break thou the arm of the sinner and of the malignant: his sin shall be sought, and shall not be found. 36 contere brachium impii et maligni quaeres impietatem eius et non invenies
9a:16. a:16. The Lord shall reign to eternity, yea, for ever and ever: ye Gentiles shall perish from his land. 37 Dominus rex saeculi et aeternitatis perierunt gentes de terra eius
9a:17. a:17. The Lord hath heard the desire of the poor: thy ear hath heard the preparation of their heart. 38 desiderium pauperum audit Dominus praeparasti ut cor eorum audiat auris tua
9a:18. a:18. To judge for the fatherless and for the humble, that man may no more presume to magnify himself upon earth. 39 ut iudices pupillum et oppressum et nequaquam ultra superbiat homo de terra

Chapter 10

In Domino confido. The just man's confidence in God in the midst of persecutions.

1 Unto the end. A psalm to David. 1 victori David
2 In the Lord I put my trust: how then do you say to my soul: Get thee away from hence to the mountain, like a sparrow. 2 in Domino speravi quomodo dicitis animae meae transvola in montem ut avis
3 For, lo, the wicked have bent their bow: they have prepared their arrows in the quiver, to shoot in the dark the upright of heart. 3 quia ecce impii tetenderunt arcum posuerunt sagittam suam super nervum ut sagittent in abscondito rectos corde
4 For they have destroyed the things which thou hast made: but what has the just man done? 4 quia leges dissipatae sunt iustus quid operatus est
5 The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord's throne is in heaven. His eyes look on the poor man: his eyelids examine the sons of men. 5 Dominus in templo sancto suo Dominus in caelo thronus eius oculi eius vident palpebrae eius probant filios hominum
6 The Lord trieth the just and the wicked: but he that loveth iniquity, hateth his own soul. 6 Dominus iustum probat impium autem et diligentem iniquitatem odit anima eius
7 He shall rain snares upon sinners: fire and brimstone, and storms of winds, shall be the portion of their cup. 7 pluet super peccatores laqueos ignis et sulphur et spiritus tempestatum pars calicis eorum
8 For the Lord is just, and hath loved justice: his countenance hath beheld righteousness. 8 quoniam iustus Dominus iustitias dilexit rectum videbunt facies eorum

Chapter 11

Salvum me fac. The prophet calls for God's help against the wicked.

1 Unto the end: for the octave, a psalm for David. 1 victori pro octava canticum David
2 Save me, O Lord, for there is now no saint: truths are decayed from among the children of men. 2 salva Domine quoniam defecit sanctus quoniam inminuti sunt fideles a filiis hominum
3 They have spoken vain things, every one to his neighbour: with deceitful lips, and with a double heart have they spoken. 3 frustra loquuntur unusquisque proximo suo labium subdolum in corde et corde locuti sunt
4 May the Lord destroy all deceitful lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things. 4 disperdat Dominus omnia labia dolosa linguam magniloquam
5 Who have said: We will magnify our tongue: our lips are our own: who is Lord over us? 5 qui dixerunt linguam nostram roboremus labia nostra nobiscum sunt quis dominus noster est
6 By reason of the misery of the needy, and the groans of the poor, now will I arise, saith the Lord. I will set him in safety: I will deal confidently in his regard. 6 propter vastitatem inopum et gemitum pauperum nunc consurgam dicit Dominus ponam in salutari auxilium eorum
7 The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried by the fire, purged from the earth, refined seven times. 7 eloquia Domini eloquia munda argentum igne probatum separatum a terra colatum septuplum
8 Thou, O Lord, wilt preserve us: and keep us from this generation for ever. 8 tu Domine custodies ea servabis nos a generatione hac in aeternum
9 The wicked walk round about: according to thy highness, thou hast multiplied the children of men. 9 in circuitu impii ambulabunt cum exaltati fuerint vilissimi filiorum hominum

Chapter 12

Usquequo, Domine. A prayer in tribulation.

1 Unto the end, a psalm for David. How long, O Lord, wilt thou forget me unto the end? how long dost thou turn away thy face from me? 1 victori canticum David usquequo Domine oblivisceris mei penitus usquequo abscondes faciem tuam a me
2 How long shall I take counsels in my soul, sorrow in my heart all the day? 2 usquequo ponam consilia in anima mea dolorem in corde meo per diem
3 How long shall my enemy be exalted over Me? 3 usquequo exaltabitur inimicus meus super me
4 Consider, and hear me, O Lord, my God. Enlighten my eyes, that I never sleep in death: 4 convertere exaudi me Domine Deus meus inlumina oculos meos ne umquam obdormiam in mortem
5 Lest at any time my enemy say: I have prevailed against him. They that trouble me, will rejoice when I am moved: 5 nequando dicat inimicus meus praevalui adversus eum hostes mei exultabunt cum motus fuero
6 But I have trusted in thy mercy. My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation: I will sing to the Lord, who giveth me good things: yea, I will sing to the name of the Lord, the most high. 6 ego autem in misericordia tua confido exultabit cor meum in salutari tuo cantabo Domino quia reddidit mihi

Chapter 13

Dixit insipiens. The general corruption of man before our redemption by Christ.

1 Unto the end, a psalm for David. The fool hath said in his heart: There is no God. They are corrupt, and are become abominable in their ways: there is none that doth good, no not one. 1 victori David dixit stultus in corde suo non est Deus corrupti sunt et abominabiles facti sunt studiose non est qui faciat bonum
2 The Lord hath looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there be any that understand and seek God. 2 Dominus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum ut videret si esset intellegens requirens Deum
3 They are all gone aside, they are become unprofitable together: there is none that doth good: no not one. Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they acted deceitfully: the poison of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness; their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and unhappiness in their ways; and the way of peace they have not known: there is no fear of God before their eyes. 3 omnes recesserunt simul conglutinati sunt non est qui faciat bonum non est usque ad unum
4 Shall not all they know that work iniquity, who devour my people as they eat bread? 4 nonne cognoscent omnes qui operantur iniquitatem qui devorant populum meum ut cibum panis
5 They have not called upon the Lord: there have they trembled for fear, where there was no fear. 5 Dominum non invocaverunt ibi timebunt formidine
6 For the Lord is in the just generation: you have confounded the counsel of the poor man; but the Lord is his hope. 6 quoniam Deus in generatione iusta est consilium pauperum confudistis quoniam Dominus spes eius est
7 Who shall give out of Sion the salvation of Israel? when the Lord shall have turned away the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad. 7 quis dabit de Sion salutem Israhel quando reduxerit Dominus captivitatem populi sui exultabit Iacob et laetabitur Israhel

Chapter 14

Domine, quis habitabit. What kind of men shall dwell in the heavenly Sion.

1 A psalm for David. Lord, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle? or who shall rest in thy holy hill? 1 canticum David Domine quis peregrinabitur in tentorio tuo et quis habitabit in monte sancto tuo
2 He that walketh without blemish, and worketh justice: 2 qui ingreditur sine macula et operatur iustitiam
3 He that speaketh truth in his heart, who hath not used deceit in his tongue: Nor hath done evil to his neighbour: nor taken up a reproach against his neighbours. 3 loquiturque veritatem in corde suo qui non est facilis in lingua sua neque fecit amico suo malum et obprobrium non sustinuit super vicino suo
4 In his sight the malignant is brought to nothing: but he glorifieth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his neighbour, and deceiveth not; 4 dispicitur oculis eius inprobus timentes autem Dominum glorificat iurat ut se adfligat et non mutat
5 He that hath not put out his money to usury, nortaken bribes against the innocent: He that doth these things, shall not be moved for ever. 5 pecuniam suam non dedit ad usuram et munera adversum innoxium non accepit qui facit haec non movebitur in aeternum

Chapter 15

Conserva me, Domine. Christ's future victory and triumph over the world and death.

1 The inscription of a title to David himself. Preserve me, O Lord, for I have put my trust in thee. 1 humilis et simplicis David custodi me Deus quoniam speravi in te
2 I have said to the Lord, thou art my God, for thou hast no need of my goods. 2 dicens Deo Dominus meus es tu bene mihi non est sine te
3 To the saints, who are in his land, he hath made wonderful all my desires in them. 3 sanctis qui in terra sunt et magnificis omnis voluntas mea in eis
4 Their infirmities were multiplied: afterwards they made haste. I will not gather together their meetings for bloodofferings: nor will I be mindful of their names by my lips. 4 multiplicabuntur idola eorum post tergum sequentium non litabo libamina eorum de sanguine neque adsumam nomina eorum in labiis meis
5 The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup: it is thou that wilt restore my inheritance to me. 5 Dominus pars hereditatis meae et calicis mei tu possessor sortis meae
6 The lines are fallen unto me in goodly places: for my inheritance is goodly to me. 6 lineae ceciderunt mihi in pulcherrimis et hereditas speciosissima mea est
7 I will bless the Lord, who hath given me understanding: moreover, my reins also have corrected me even till night. 7 benedicam Domino qui dedit consilium mihi insuper et noctibus erudierunt me renes mei
8 I set the Lord always in my sight: for he is at my right hand, that I be not moved. 8 proponebam in conspectu meo semper quia a dextris meis est ne commovear
9 Therefore my heart hath been glad, and my tongue hath rejoiced: moreover, my flesh also shall rest in hope. 9 propterea laetatum est cor meum et exultavit gloria mea et caro mea habitavit confidenter
10 Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; nor wilt thou give thy holy one to see corruption. 10 non enim derelinques animam meam in inferno nec dabis sanctum tuum videre corruptionem ostendes mihi semitam vitae plenitudinem laetitiarum ante vultum tuum decores in dextera tua aeternos
11 Thou hast made known to me the ways of life, thou shalt fill me with joy with thy countenance: at thy right hand are delights even to the end. .

Chapter 16

Exaudi, Domine, justitiam. A just man's prayer in tribulation against the malice of his enemy.

1 The prayer of David. Hear, O Lord, my justice: attend to my supplication. Give ear unto my prayer, which proceedeth not from deceitful lips. 1 oratio David audi Deus iustum intende deprecationem meam auribus percipe orationem meam absque labiis mendacii
2 Let my judgment come forth from thy countenance: let thy eyes behold the things that are equitable. 2 de vultu tuo iudicium meum prodeat oculi tui videant aequitates
3 Thou hast proved my heart, and visited it by night, thou hast tried me by fire: and iniquity hath not been found in me. 3 probasti cor meum visitasti nocte conflasti me et non invenisti
4 That my mouth may not speak the works of men: for the sake of the words of thy lips, I have kept hard ways. 4 cogitationes meas transire os meum in opere hominum propter verbum labiorum tuorum ego observavi vias latronis
5 Perfect thou my goings in thy paths: that my footsteps be not moved. 5 sustenta gressus meos in callibus tuis et non labentur vestigia mea
6 I have cried to thee, for thou, O God, hast heard me: O incline thy ear unto me, and hear my words. 6 ego invocavi te quia exaudies me Deus inclina aurem tuam mihi audi eloquium meum
7 Shew forth thy wonderful mercies; thou who savest them that trust in thee. 7 mirabilem fac misericordiam tuam salvator sperantium
8 From them that resist thy right hand keep me, as the apple of thy eye. Protect me under the shadow of thy wings. 8 a resistentibus dexterae tuae custodi me quasi pupillam intus in oculo in umbra alarum tuarum protege me
9 From the face of the wicked who have afflicted me. My enemies have surrounded my soul: 9 a facie impiorum vastantium me inimici mei animam meam circumdederunt
10 They have shut up their fat: their mouth hath spoken proudly. 10 adipe suo concluserunt et ore locuti sunt superbe
11 They have cast me forth, and now they have surrounded me: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth. 11 incedentes adversum me nunc circumdederunt me oculos suos posuerunt declinare in terram
12 They have taken me, as a lion prepared for the prey; and as a young lion dwelling in secret places. 12 similitudo eius quasi leonis desiderantis praedam et quasi catuli leonis sedentis in absconditis
13 Arise, O Lord, disappoint him and supplant him; deliver my soul from the wicked one; thy sword 13 surge Domine praeveni faciem eius incurva eum salva animam meam ab impio qui est gladius tuus
14 From the enemies of thy hand. O Lord, divide them from the few of the earth in their life: their belly is filled from thy hidden stores. They are full of children: and they have left to their little ones the rest of their substance. 14 a viris manus tuae Domine qui mortui sunt in profundo quorum pars in vita et quorum de absconditis tuis replesti ventrem qui satiabuntur filiis et dimittent reliquias suas parvulis eorum
15 But as for me, I will appear before thy sight in justice: I shall be satisfied when thy glory shall appear. 15 ego in iustitia videbo faciem tuam implebor cum evigilavero similitudine tua

Chapter 17

Diligam te, Domine. David's thanks to God for his delivery from all his enemies.

1 Unto the end, for David, the servant of the Lord, who spoke to the Lord the words of this canticle, in the day that the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul: and he said: 1 victori servo Domini David quae locutus est Domino verba cantici huius in die qua liberavit eum Dominus de manu omnium inimicorum suorum et de manu Saul et ait
2 I will love thee, O Lord, my strength: 2 diligam te Domine fortitudo mea
3 The Lord is my firmament, my refuge, and my deliverer. My God is my helper, and in him will I put my trust. My protector, and the horn of my salvation, and my support. 3 Domine petra mea et robur meum et salvator meus Deus meus fortis meus sperabo in eo scutum meum et cornu salutis meae susceptor meus
4 Praising, I will call upon the Lord: and I shall be saved from my enemies. 4 laudatum invocabo Dominum et ab inimicis meis salvus ero
5 The sorrows of death surrounded me: and the torrents of iniquity troubled me. 5 circumdederunt me funes mortis et torrentes diabuli terruerunt me
6 The sorrows of hell encompassed me: and the snares of death prevented me. 6 funes inferi circumdederunt me praevenerunt me laquei mortis
7 In my affliction I called upon the Lord, and I cried to my God: And he heard my voice from his holy temple: and my cry before him came into his ears. 7 in tribulatione mea invocabo Dominum et ad Deum meum clamabo exaudiet de templo suo vocem meam et clamor meus ante faciem eius veniet in aures eius
8 The earth shook and trembled: the foundations of the mountains were troubled and were moved, because he was angry with them. 8 commota est et contremuit terra et fundamenta montium concussa sunt et conquassata quoniam iratus est
9 There went up a smoke in his wrath: and a fire flamed from his face: coals were kindled by it. 9 ascendit fumus de furore eius et ignis ex ore eius devorans carbones incensi sunt ab eo
10 He bowed the heavens, and came down, and darkness was under his feet. 10 inclinavit caelos et descendit et caligo sub pedibus eius
11 And he ascended upon the cherubim, and he flew; he flew upon the wings of the winds. 11 et ascendit super cherub et volavit super pinnas venti
12 And he made darkness his covert, his pavilion round about him: dark waters in the clouds of the air. 12 posuit tenebras latibulum suum in circuitu eius tabernaculum eius tenebrosas aquas in nubibus aetheris
13 At the brightness that was before him the clouds passed, hail and coals of fire. 13 prae fulgore in conspectu eius nubes transierunt grando et carbones ignis
14 And the Lord thundered from heaven, and the Highest gave his voice: hail and coals of fire. 14 et intonuit de caelo Dominus et Altissimus dedit vocem suam grandinem et carbones ignis
15 And he sent forth his arrows, and he scattered them: he multiplied lightnings, and troubled them. 15 et emisit sagittas suas et dissipavit eos fulgora multiplicavit et conturbavit illos
16 Then the fountains of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were discovered: At thy rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the spirit of thy wrath. 16 et apparuerunt effusiones aquarum et revelata sunt fundamenta orbis ab increpatione tua Domine ab inspiratione spiritus furoris tui
17 He sent from on high, and took me: and received me out of many waters. 17 misit de alto et accepit me extraxit me de aquis multis
18 He delivered me from my strongest enemies, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me. 18 liberavit me de inimicis meis potentissimis et de his qui oderant me quoniam robustiores me erant
19 They prevented me in the day of my affliction: and the Lord became my protector. 19 praevenerunt me in die adflictionis meae et factus est Dominus firmamentum meum
20 And he brought me forth into a large place: he saved me, because he was well pleased with me. 20 et eduxit me in latitudinem liberavit me quia placuit ei
21 And the Lord will reward me according to my justice; and will repay me according to the cleanness of my hands: 21 retribuit mihi Dominus secundum iustitiam meam et secundum munditiam manuum mearum reddidit mihi
22 Because I have kept the ways of the Lord; and have not done wickedly against my God. 22 quia custodivi vias Domini et non egi impie a Deo meo
23 For all his judgments are in my sight: and his justices I have not put away from me. 23 omnia enim iudicia eius in conspectu meo et praecepta eius non amovi a me
24 And I shall be spotless with him: and shall keep myself from my iniquity. 24 et fui inmaculatus cum eo et custodivi me ab iniquitate mea
25 And the Lord will reward me according to my justice: and according to the cleanness of my hands before his eyes. 25 et restituit Dominus mihi secundum iustitiam meam et secundum munditiam manuum mearum in conspectu oculorum eius
26 With the holy thou wilt be holy; and with the innocent man thou wilt be innocent: 26 cum sancto sanctus eris cum viro innocente innocenter ages
27 And withe the elect thou wilt be elect: and with the perverse thou wilt be perverted. 27 cum electo electus eris et cum perverso pervertes
28 For thou wilt save the humble people; but wilt bring down the eyes of the proud. 28 quia tu populum pauperem salvabis et oculos excelsos humiliabis
29 For thou lightest my lamp, O Lord: O my God, enlighten my darkness. 29 quia tu inluminabis lucernam meam Domine Deus meus inlustrabis tenebras meas
30 For by thee I shall be delivered from temptation; and through my God I shall go over a wall. 30 in te enim curram accinctus et in Deo meo transiliam murum
31 As for my God, his way is undefiled: the words of the Lord are fire-tried: he is the protector of all that trust in him. 31 Deus inmaculata via eius eloquium Domini igne examinatum scutum est omnium sperantium in se
32 For who is God but the Lord? or who is God but our God? 32 quis est deus praeter Dominum et quis fortis praeter Deum nostrum
33 God, who hath girt me with strength; and made my way blameless. 33 Deus qui accingit me fortitudine et posuit inmaculatam viam meam
34 Who hath made my feet like the feet of harts: and who setteth me upon high places. 34 coaequans pedes meos cervis et super excelsa statuens me
35 Who teacheth my hands to war: and thou hast made my arms like a brazen bow. 35 docens manus meas ad proelium et conponens quasi arcum aereum brachia mea
36 And thou hast given me the protection of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath held me up: And thy discipline hath corrected me unto the end: and thy discipline, the same shall teach me. 36 dedisti mihi clipeum salutis tuae et dextera tua confortavit me et mansuetudo tua multiplicavit me
37 Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; and my feet are not weakened. 37 dilatabis gressus meos subtus me et non deficient tali mei
38 I will pursue after my enemies, and overtake them: and I will not turn again till they are consumed. 38 persequar inimicos meos et adprehendam et non revertar donec consumam eos
39 I will break them, and they shall not be able to stand: they shall fall under my feet. 39 caedam eos et non poterunt surgere cadent sub pedibus meis
40 And thou hast girded me with strength unto battle; and hast subdued under me them that rose up against me. 40 accinxisti me fortitudine ad proelium incurvabis resistentes mihi sub me
41 And thou hast made my enemies furn their back upon me, and hast destroyed them that hated me. 41 inimicorum meorum dedisti mihi dorsum et odientes me disperdidisti
42 They cried, but there was none to save them, to the Lord: but he heard them not. 42 clamabunt et non erit qui salvet ad Dominum et non exaudiet eos
43 And I shall beat them as small as the dust before the wind; I shall bring them to nought, like the dirt in the streets. 43 delebo eos ut pulverem ante faciem venti ut lutum platearum proiciam eos
44 Thou wilt deliver me from the contradictions of the people; thou wilt make me head of the Gentiles. 44 salvabis me a contradictionibus populi pones me in caput gentium
45 A people which I knew not, hath served me: at the hearing of the ear they have obeyed me. 45 populus quem ignoravi serviet mihi auditione auris oboediet mihi
46 The children that are strangers have lied to me, strange children have faded away, and have halted from their paths. 46 filii alieni mentientur mihi filii alieni defluent et contrahentur in angustiis suis
47 The Lord liveth, and blessed by my God, and let the God of my salvation be exalted. 47 vivit Dominus et benedictus Deus meus et exaltabitur Deus salutis meae
48 O God, who avengest me, and subduest the people under me, my deliverer from my enraged enemies. 48 Deus qui das vindictas mihi et congregas populos sub me qui servas me ab inimicis meis
49 And thou wilt lift me up above them that rise up against me: from the unjust man thou wilt deliver me. 49 et a resistentibus mihi elevas me a viro iniquo libera me
50 Therefore will I give glory to thee, O Lord, among the nations, and I will sing a psalm to thy name. 50 propterea confitebor tibi in gentibus Domine et nomini tuo cantabo
51 Giving great deliverance to his king, and shewing mercy to David, his anointed: and to his seed for ever. 51 magnificanti salutes regis sui et facienti misericordiam christo suo David et semini eius usque in aeternum

Chapter 18

Coeli enarrant. The works of God shew forth his glory: his law is greatly to be esteemed and loved.

1 Unto the end. A Psalm for David. 1 victori canticum David
2 The heavens shew forth the glory of God, and the firmament declareth the work of his hands. 2 caeli enarrant gloriam Dei et opus manus eius adnuntiat firmamentum
3 Day to day uttereth speech, and night to night sheweth knowledge. 3 dies diei eructat verbum et nox nocti indicat scientiam
4 There are no speeches nor languages, where their voices are not heard. 4 non est sermo et non sunt verba quibus non audiatur vox eorum
5 Their sound hath gone forth into all the earth: and their words unto the ends of the world. 5 in universam terram exivit sonus eorum et in finibus orbis verba eorum
6 He hath set his tabernacle in the sun: and he as a bridegroom coming out of his bridechamber, Hath rejoiced as a giant to run the way: 6 soli posuit tabernaculum in eis et ipse quasi sponsus procedens de thalamo suo exultavit ut fortis ad currendam viam
7 His going out is from the end of heaven, And his circuit even to the end thereof: and there is no one that can hide himself from his heat. 7 a summitate caeli egressus eius et cursus eius usque ad summitatem illius nec est qui se abscondat a calore eius
8 The law of the Lord is unspotted, converting souls: the testimony of the Lord is faithful, giving wisdom to little ones. 8 lex Domini inmaculata convertens animam testimonium Domini fidele sapientiam praestans parvulis
9 The justices of the Lord are right, rejoicing hearts: the commandment of the Lord is lightsome, enlightening the eyes. 9 praecepta Domini recta laetificantia cor mandatum Domini lucidum inluminans oculos
10 The fear of the Lord is holy, enduring for ever and ever: the judgments of the Lord are true, justified in themselves. 10 timor Domini mundus perseverans in saecula iudicia Domini vera iustificata in semet ipsis
11 More to be desired than gold and many precious stones: and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb. 11 desiderabilia super aurum et lapidem pretiosum multum et dulciora super mel et favum redundantem
12 For thy servant keepeth them, and in keeping them there is a great reward. 12 unde et servus tuus docebit ea in custodiendis eis fructus multus
13 Who can understand sins? from my secret ones cleanse me, O Lord: 13 errores quis intelleget ab occultis munda me
14 And from those of others spare thy servant. If they shall have no dominion over me, then shall I be without spot: and I shall be cleansed form the greatest sin. 14 a superbis quoque libera servum tuum si non fuerint dominati mei tunc inmaculatus ero et mundabor a delicto maximo
15 And the words of my mouth shall be such as may please: and the meditation of my heart always in thy sight. O Lord, my helper and my Redeemer. 15 sint placentes sermones oris mei meditatio cordis mei in conspectu tuo Domine fortitudo mea et redemptor meus

Chapter 19

Exaudiat te Dominus. A prayer for the king.

1 Unto the end. A psalm for David. 1 victori canticum David
2 May the Lord hear thee in the day of tribulation: may the name of the God of Jacob protect thee. 2 exaudiat te Dominus in die tribulationis protegat te nomen Dei Iacob
3 May he send thee help from the sanctuary: and defend thee out of Sion. 3 mittat tibi auxilium de sancto et de Sion roboret te
4 May he be mindful of all thy sacrifices: and may thy whole burntoffering be made fat. 4 memor sit omnis sacrificii tui et holocaustum tuum pingue fiat semper
5 May he give thee according to thy own heart; and confirm all thy counsels. 5 det tibi secundum cor tuum et omnem voluntatem tuam impleat
6 We will rejoice in thy salvation; and in the name of our God we shall be exalted. 6 laudabimus in salutari tuo et in nomine Dei nostri ducemus choros
7 The Lord fulfil all thy petitions: now have I known that the Lord hath saved his anointed. He will hear him from his holy heaven: the salvation of his right hand is in powers. 7 impleat Dominus omnes petitiones tuas nunc scio quoniam salvabit Dominus christum suum exaudiet eum de caelo sancto suo in fortitudine salutis dexterae suae
8 Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will call upon the name of the Lord, our God. 8 hii in curribus et hii in equis nos autem nominis Domini Dei nostri recordabimur
9 They are bound, and have fallen: but we are risen, and are set upright. O Lord, save the king: and hear us in the day that we shall call upon thee. 9 ipsi incurvati sunt et ceciderunt nos autem resurreximus et erecti sumus
. . 10 Domine salva rex exaudiet nos in die qua invocaverimus

Chapter 20

Domine, in virtute. Praise to God for Christ's exaltation after his passion.

1 Unto the end. A psalm for David. 1 victori canticum David
2 In thy strength, O Lord, the king shall joy; and in thy salvation he shall rejoice exceedingly. 2 Domine in fortitudine tua laetabitur rex et in salutari tuo exultabit vehementer
3 Thou hast given him his heart's desire: and hast not withholden from him the will of his lips. 3 desiderium cordis eius dedisti ei et voluntate labiorum eius non fraudasti eum semper
4 For thou hast prevented him with blessings of sweetness: thou hast set on his head a crown of precious stones. 4 quoniam praevenies eum benedictionibus bonitatis pones in capite eius coronam de lapide pretioso
5 He asked life of thee: and thou hast given him length of days for ever and ever. 5 vitam petivit te et dedisti ei longitudinem dierum in saeculum et in aeternum
6 His glory is great in thy salvation: glory and great beauty shalt thou lay upon him. 6 magna gloria eius in salutari tuo gloriam et decorem pones super eum
7 For thou shalt give him to be a blessing for ever and ever: thou shalt make him joyful in gladness with thy countenance. 7 pones enim eum benedictionem sempiternam et hilarabis eum laetitia apud vultum tuum
8 For the king hopeth in the Lord: and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved. 8 quia rex confidet in Domino et in misericordia Excelsi non decipietur
9 Let thy hand be found by all thy enemies: let thy right hand find out all them that hate thee. 9 inveniet manus tua omnes inimicos tuos dextera tua inveniet odientes te
10 Thou shalt make them as an oven of fire, in the time of thy anger: the Lord shall trouble them in his wrath, and fire shall devour them. 10 pones eos ut clibanum ignis in tempore vultus tui Dominus in furore suo praecipitabit eos et devorabit eos ignis
11 Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth: and their seed from among the children of men. 11 fructum eorum de terra perdes et semen eorum de filiis hominum
12 For they have intended evils against thee: they have devised counsels which they have not been able to establish. 12 quoniam inclinaverunt super te malum cogitaverunt scelus quod non potuerunt
13 For thou shalt make them turn their back: in thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face. 13 quia pones eos umerum funes tuos firmabis contra facies eorum
14 Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy own strength: we will sing and praise thy power. 14 exaltare Domine in fortitudine tua cantabimus et psallemus fortitudines tuas

Chapter 21

Deus Deus meus. Christ's passion: and the conversion of the Gentiles.

1 Unto the end, for the morning protection, a psalm for David. 1 victori pro cervo matutino canticum
2 O God my God, look upon me: why hast thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation are the words of my sins. 2 Deus Deus meus quare dereliquisti me longe a salute mea verba rugitus mei
3 O my God, I shall cry by day, and thou wilt not hear: and by night, and it shall not be reputed as folly in me. 3 Deus meus clamabo per diem et non exaudies et nocte nec est silentium mihi
4 But thou dwellest in the holy place, the praise of Israel. 4 et tu sancte habitator Laus Israhel
5 In thee have our fathers hoped: they have hoped, and thou hast delivered them. 5 in te confisi sunt patres nostri confisi sunt et salvasti eos
6 They cried to thee, and they were saved: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded. 6 ad te clamaverunt et salvati sunt in te confisi sunt et non sunt confusi
7 But I am a worm, and no man: the reproach of men, and the outcast of the people. 7 ego autem sum vermis et non homo obprobrium hominum et dispectio plebis
8 All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn: they have spoken with the lips, and wagged the head. 8 omnes videntes me subsannant me dimittunt labium movent caput
9 He hoped in the Lord, let him deliver him: let him save him, seeing he delighteth in him. 9 confugit ad Dominum salvet eum liberet eum quoniam vult eum
10 For thou art he that hast drawn me out of the womb: my hope from the breasts of my mother. 10 tu autem propugnator meus ex utero fiducia mea ab uberibus matris meae
11 I was cast upon thee from the womb. From my mother's womb thou art my God, 11 in te proiectus sum ex vulva de ventre matris meae Deus meus es tu
12 Depart not from me. For tribulation is very near: for there is none to help me. 12 ne longe fias a me quoniam tribulatio proxima est quoniam non est adiutor
13 Many calves have surrounded me: fat bulls have besieged me. 13 circumdederunt me vituli multi tauri pingues vallaverunt me
14 They have opened their mouths against me, as a lion ravening and roaring. 14 aperuerunt super me os suum quasi leo capiens et rugiens
15 I am poured out like water; and all my bones are scattered. My heart is become like wax melting in the midst of my bowels. 15 sicut aqua effusus sum et separata sunt omnia ossa mea factum est cor meum sicut cera liquefacta in medio ventris mei
16 My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue hath cleaved to my jaws: and thou hast brought me down into the dust of death. 16 aruit velut testa fortitudo mea et lingua mea adhesit palato meo et in pulverem mortis detraxisti me
17 For many dogs have encompassed me: the council of the malignant hath besieged me. They have dug my hands and feet. 17 circumdederunt me venatores concilium pessimorum vallavit me vinxerunt manus meas et pedes meos
18 They have numbered all my bones. And they have looked and stared upon me. 18 numeravi omnia ossa mea quae ipsi respicientes viderunt in me
19 They parted my garments amongst them; and upon my vesture they cast lots. 19 diviserunt vestimenta mea sibi et super vestimentum meum miserunt sortem
20 But thou, O Lord, remove not thy help to a distance from me; look towards my defence. 20 tu autem Domine ne longe fias fortitudo mea in auxilium meum festina
21 Deliver, O God, my soul from the sword: my only one from the hand of the dog. 21 erue a gladio animam meam de manu canis solitariam meam
22 Save me from the lion's mouth; and my lowness from the horns of the unicorns. 22 salva me ex ore leonis et de cornibus unicornium exaudi me
23 I will declare thy name to my brethren: in the midst of the church will I praise thee. 23 narrabo nomen tuum fratribus meis in medio ecclesiae laudabo te
24 Ye that fear the Lord, praise him: all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him. 24 qui timetis Dominum laudate eum omne semen Iacob glorificate eum
25 Let all the seed of Israel fear him: because he hath not slighted nor despised the supplication of the poor man. Neither hath he turned away his face form me: and when I cried to him he heard me. 25 et metuite eum universum semen Israhel quoniam non dispexit neque contempsit modestiam pauperis et non abscondit faciem suam ab eo et cum clamaret ad eum audivit
26 With thee is my praise in a great church: I will pay my vows in the sight of them that fear him. 26 apud te laus mea in ecclesia multa vota mea reddam in conspectu timentium eum
27 The poor shall eat and shall be filled: and they shall praise the Lord that seek him: their hearts shall live for ever and ever. 27 comedent mites et saturabuntur laudabunt Dominum quaerentes eum vivet cor vestrum in sempiternum
28 All the ends of the earth shall remember, and shall be converted to the Lord: And all the kindreds of the Gentiles shall adore in his sight. 28 recordabuntur et convertentur ad Dominum omnes fines terrae et adorabunt coram eo universae cognationes gentium
29 For the kingdom is the Lord's; and he shall have dominion over the nations. 29 quia Domini est regnum et dominabitur gentibus
30 All the fat ones of the earth have eaten and have adored: all they that go down to the earth shall fall before him. 30 comederunt et adoraverunt omnes pingues terrae ante faciem eius curvabunt genu universi qui descendunt in pulverem
31 And to him my soul shall live: and my seed shall serve him. 31 et anima eius ipsi vivet semen serviet ei
32 There shall be declared to the Lord a generation to come: and the heavens shall shew forth his justice to a people that shall be born, which the Lord hath made. 32 narrabitur Domino in generatione venient et adnuntiabunt iustitias eius populo qui nascetur quas fecit

Chapter 22

Dominus regit me. God's spiritual benefits to faithful souls.

1 A psalm for David. The Lord ruleth me: and I shall want nothing. 1 canticum David Dominus pascit me nihil mihi deerit
2 He hath set me in a place of pasture. He hath brought me up, on the water of refreshment: 2 in pascuis herbarum adclinavit me super aquas refectionis enutrivit me
3 He hath converted my soul. He hath led me on the paths of justice, for his own name's sake. 3 animam meam refecit duxit me per semitas iustitiae propter nomen suum
4 For though I should walk in the midst of the shadow of death, I will fear no evils, for thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they have comforted me. 4 sed et si ambulavero in valle mortis non timebo malum quoniam tu mecum es virga tua et baculus tuus ipsa consolabuntur me
5 Thou hast prepared a table before me against them that afflict me. Thou hast anointed my head with oil; and my chalice which inebreateth me, how goodly is it! 5 pones coram me mensam ex adverso hostium meorum inpinguasti oleo caput meum calix meus inebrians
6 And thy mercy will follow me all the days of my life. And that I may dwell in the house of the Lord unto length of days. 6 sed et benignitas et misericordia subsequetur me omnibus diebus vitae meae et habitabo in domo Domini in longitudine dierum

Chapter 23

Domini est terra. Who are they that shall ascend to heaven: Christ's triumphant ascension thither.

1 On the first day of the week, a psalm for David. The earth is the Lord's and the fulness thereof: the world, and all they that dwell therein. 1 David canticum Domini est terra et plenitudo eius orbis et habitatores eius
2 For he hath founded it upon the seas; and hath prepared it upon the rivers. 2 quia ipse super maria fundavit eum et super flumina stabilivit illum
3 Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord: or who shall stand in his holy place? 3 quis ascendet in montem Domini et quis stabit in loco sancto eius
4 The innocent in hands, and clean of heart, who hath not taken his soul in vain, nor sworn deceitfully to his neighbour. 4 innocens manibus et mundo corde qui non exaltavit frustra animam suam et non iuravit dolose
5 He shall receive a blessing from the Lord, and mercy from God his Saviour. 5 accipiet benedictionem a Domino et iustitiam a Deo salutari suo
6 This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek the face of the God of Jacob. 6 haec generatio quaerentium eum quaerentium faciem tuam Iacob semper
7 Lift up your gates, O ye princes, and be ye lifted up, O eternal gates: and the King of Glory shall enter in. 7 levate portae capita vestra et elevamini ianuae sempiternae et ingrediatur rex gloriae
8 Who is this King of Glory? the Lord who is strong and mighty: the Lord mighty in battle. 8 quis est iste rex gloriae Dominus fortis et potens Dominus fortis in proelio
9 Lift up your gates, O ye princes, and be ye lifted up, O eternal gates: and the King of Glory shall enter in. 9 levate portae capita vestra et erigite ianuae sempiternae et ingrediatur rex gloriae
10 Who is this King of Glory? the Lord of hosts, he is the King of Glory. 10 quis est iste rex gloriae Dominus exercituum ipse est rex gloriae semper

Chapter 24

Ad te, Domine, levavi. A prayer for grace, mercy, and protection against our enemies.

1 Unto the end, a psalm for David. To thee, O Lord, have I lifted up my soul. 1 David ad te Domine animam meam levabo
2 In thee, O my God, I put my trust; let me not be ashamed. 2 Deus meus in te confisus sum ne confundar
3 Neither let my enemies laugh at me: for none of them that wait on thee shall be confounded. 3 ne laetentur inimici mei sed et universi qui sperant in te non confundantur
4 Let all them be confounded that act unjust things without cause. Shew, O Lord, thy ways to me, and teach me thy paths. 4 confundantur qui iniqua gerunt frustra vias tuas Domine ostende mihi semitas tuas doce me
5 Direct me in thy truth, and teach me; for thou art God my Saviour; and on thee have I waited all the day long. 5 deduc me in veritate tua et doce me quia tu Deus salvator meus te expectavi tota die
6 Remember, O Lord, thy bowels of compassion; and thy mercies that are from the beginning of the world. 6 recordare miserationum tuarum Domine et misericordiarum tuarum quia ex sempiterno sunt
7 The sins of my youth and my ignorances do not remember. According to thy mercy remember thou me: for thy goodness' sake, O Lord. 7 peccatorum adulescentiae meae et scelerum meorum ne memineris secundum misericordiam tuam recordare mei propter bonitatem tuam Domine
8 The Lord is sweet and righteous: therefore he will give a law to sinners in the way. 8 bonus et rectus Dominus propterea docebit peccatores in via
9 He will guide the mild in judgment: he will teach the meek his ways. 9 deducet mansuetos in iudicio et docebit modestos viam suam
10 All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth, to them that seek after his covenant and his testimonies. 10 omnes semitae Domini misericordia et veritas his qui custodiunt pactum eius et testificationem eius
11 For thy name's sake, O Lord, thou wilt pardon my sin: for it is great. 11 propter nomen tuum propitiare iniquitati meae quoniam grandis est
12 Who is the man that feareth the Lord? He hath appointed him a law in the way he hath chosen. 12 quis est iste vir timens Dominum quem docebit in via quam elegerit
13 His soul shall dwell in good things: and his seed shall inherit the land. 13 anima eius in bono commorabitur et semen eius hereditabit terram
14 The Lord is a firmament to them that fear him: and his covenant shall be made manifest to them. 14 secretum Domini timentibus eum et pactum suum ostendet eis
15 My eyes are ever towards the Lord: for he shall pluck my feet out of the snare. 15 oculi mei semper ad Dominum quia ipse educet de rete pedes meos
16 Look thou upon me, and have mercy on me; for I am alone and poor. 16 respice in me et miserere mei quoniam solus et pauper sum ego
17 The troubles of my heart are multiplied: deliver me from my necessities. 17 tribulationes cordis mei multiplicatae sunt de angustiis meis educ me
18 See my abjection and my labour; and forgive me all my sins. 18 vide adflictionem meam et laborem meum et porta omnia peccata mea
19 Consider my enemies for they are multiplied, and have hated me with an unjust hatred. 19 vide inimicos meos quia multiplicati sunt et odio iniquo oderunt me
20 Deep thou my soul, and deliver me: I shall not be ashamed, for I have hoped in thee. 20 custodi animam meam et libera me non confundar quia speravi in te
21 The innocent and the upright have adhered to me: because I have waited on thee. 21 simplicitas et aequitas servabunt me quia expectavi te
22 Deliver Israel, O God, from all his tribulations. 22 redime Deus Israhelem ex omnibus angustiis suis

Chapter 25

Judica me, Domine. David's prayer to God in his distress, to be delivered, that he may come to worship him in his tabernacle.

1 Unto the end, a psalm for David. Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in my innocence: and I have put my trust in the Lord, and shall not be weakened. 1 David iudica me Deus quoniam ego in simplicitate mea ambulavi et in Domino confidens non deficiam
2 Prove me, O Lord, and try me; burn my reins and my heart. 2 proba me Domine et tempta me ure renes meos et cor meum
3 For thy mercy is before my eyes; and I am well pleased with thy truth. 3 quia misericordia tua in conspectu oculorum meorum est et ambulabo in veritate tua
4 I have not sat with the council of vanity: neither will I go in with the doers of unjust things. 4 non sedi cum viris vanitatis et cum superbis non ingrediar
5 I have hated the assembly of the malignant; and with the wicked I will not sit. 5 odivi ecclesiam pessimorum et cum iniquis non sedebo
6 I will wash my hands among the innocent; and will compass thy altar, O Lord: 6 lavabo in innocentia manus meas et circuibo altare tuum Domine
7 That I may hear the voice of thy praise: and tell of all thy wondrous works. 7 ut clara voce praedicem laudem et narrem omnia mirabilia tua
8 I have loved, O Lord, the beauty of thy house; and the place where thy glory dwelleth. 8 Domine dilexi habitaculum domus tuae et locum tabernaculi gloriae tuae
9 Take not away my soul, O God, with the wicked: nor my life with bloody men: 9 ne auferas cum peccatoribus animam meam cum viris sanguinum vitam meam
10 In whose hands are iniquities: their right hand is filled with gifts. 10 in quorum manibus scelus est et dextera eorum repleta est muneribus
11 But as for me, I have walked in my innocence: redeem me, and have mercy on me. 11 ego autem in simplicitate mea gradiar redime me et miserere mei
12 My foot hath stood in the direct way: in the churches I will bless thee, O Lord. 12 pes meus stetit in recto in ecclesiis benedicam Domino

Chapter 26

Dominus illuminatio. David's faith and hope in God.

1 The psalm of David before he was anointed. The Lord is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? The Lord is the protector of my life: of whom shall I be afraid? 1 David Dominus lux mea et salutare meum quem timebo Dominus fortitudo vitae meae quem formidabo
2 Whilst the wicked draw near against me, to eat my flesh. My enemies that trouble me, have themselves been weakened, and have fallen. 2 cum adpropinquarent mihi maligni ut comederent carnem meam hostes mei et inimici mei ipsi inpigerunt et ceciderunt
3 If armies in camp should stand together against me, my heart shall not fear. If a battle should rise up against me, in this will I be confident. 3 si steterint adversus me castra non timebit cor meum si surrexerit contra me bellum in hoc ego confidam
4 One thing I have asked of the Lord, this will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life. That I may see the delight of the Lord, and may visit his temple. 4 unum petivi a Domino hoc requiram ut habitem in domo Domini omnibus diebus vitae meae ut videam pulchritudinem Domini et adtendam templum eius
5 For he hath hidden me in his tabernacle; in the day of evils, he hath protected me in the secret place of his tabernacle. 5 abscondet enim me in umbra sua in die pessima abscondet me in secreto tabernaculi sui
6 He hath exalted me upon a rock: and now he hath lifted up my head above my enemies. I have gone round, and have offered up in his tabernacle a sacrifice of jubilation: I will sing, and recite a psalm to the Lord. 6 in petra exaltabit me nunc quoque exaltabit caput meum super inimicos meos qui sunt in circuitu meo et immolabo in tabernaculo eius hostias iubili cantabo et psallam Domino
7 Hear, O Lord, my voice, with which I have cried to thee: have mercy on me and hear me. 7 audi Domine vocem meam invocantis miserere mei et exaudi me
8 My heart hath said to thee: My face hath sought thee: thy face, O Lord, will I still seek. 8 tibi dixit cor meum quaesivit vultus meus faciem tuam Domine et requiram
9 Turn not away thy face from me; decline not in thy wrath from thy servant. Be thou my helper, forsake me not; do not thou despise me, O God my Saviour. 9 ne abscondas faciem tuam a me ne declines in furore tuo a servo tuo auxilium meum fuisti ne derelinquas me et ne dimittas me Deus salvator meus
10 For my father and my mother have left me: but the Lord hath taken me up. 10 pater enim meus et mater mea dereliquerunt me Dominus autem collegit me
11 Set me, O Lord, a law in thy way, and guide me in the right path, because of my enemies. 11 ostende mihi Domine viam tuam et deduc me in semita recta propter insidiatores meos
12 Deliver me not over to the will of them that trouble me; for unjust witnesses have risen up against me; and iniquity hath lied to itself. 12 ne tradas me Domine animae tribulantium me quoniam surrexerunt contra me testes falsi et apertum mendacium
13 I believe to see the good things of the Lord in the land of the living. 13 ego autem credo quod videam bona Domini in terra viventium
14 Expect the Lord, do manfully, and let thy heart take courage, and wait thou for the Lord. 14 expecta Dominum confortare et roboretur cor tuum et sustine Dominum

Chapter 27

Ad te, Domine, clamabo. David's prayer that his enemies may not prevail over him.

1 A psalm for David himself. Unto thee will I cry, O Lord: O my God, be not thou silent to me: lest if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit. 1 David ad te Domine clamabo Fortis meus ne obsurdescas mihi ne forte tacente te mihi conparer his qui descendunt in lacum
2 Hear, O Lord, the voice of my supplication, when I pray to thee; when I lift up my hands to thy holy temple. 2 audi Domine deprecationem meam cum clamavero ad te cum levavero manus meas ad oraculum sanctum tuum
3 Draw me not away together with the wicked; and with the workers of iniquity destroy me not: Who speak peace with their neighbour, but evils are in their hearts. 3 ne trahas me cum impiis et cum operantibus iniquitatem qui loquuntur pacem cum amicis suis et est malum in corde eorum
4 Give them according to their works, and according to the wickedness of their inventions. According to the works of their hands give thou to them: render to them their reward. 4 da eis secundum opus suum et secundum malum adinventionum suarum iuxta opus manuum suarum da eis redde retributionem suam illis
5 Because they have not understood the works of the Lord, and the operations of his hands: thou shalt destroy them, and shalt not build them up. 5 quoniam non intellegunt opera Domini et opus manuum eius destrues eos et non aedificabis
6 Blessed be the Lord, for he hath heard the voice of my supplication. 6 benedictus Dominus qui audivit vocem deprecationis meae
7 The Lord is my helper and my protector: in him hath my heart confided, and I have been helped. And my flesh hath flourished again, and with my will I will give praise to him. 7 Dominus fortitudo mea et scutum meum in ipso confisum est cor meum et habui adiutorium gavisum est cor meum et in cantico meo confitebor illi
8 The Lord is the strength of his people, and the protector of the salvation of his anointed. 8 Dominus fortitudo mea et robur salutarium christi sui est
9 Save, O Lord, thy people, and bless thy inheritance: and rule them and exalt them for ever. 9 salva populum tuum et benedic hereditati tuae et pasce eos et subleva eos usque in sempiternum

Chapter 28

Afferte Domino. An invitation to glorify God, with a commemoration of his mighty works.

1 A psalm for David, at the finishing of the tabernacle. Bring to the Lord, O ye children of God: bring to the Lord the offspring of rams. 1 canticum David adferte Domino filios arietum
2 Bring to the Lord glory and honour: bring to the Lord glory to his name: adore ye the Lord in his holy court. 2 adferte Domino gloriam et imperium adferte Domino gloriam nomini eius adorate Dominum in decore sancto
3 The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; the God of majesty hath thundered, The Lord is upon many waters. 3 vox Domini super aquas Deus gloriae intonuit Dominus super aquas multas
4 The voice of the Lord is in power; the voice of the Lord in magnificence. 4 vox Domini in fortitudine vox Domini in decore
5 The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars: yea, the Lord shall break the cedars of Libanus. 5 vox Domini confringentis cedros et confringet Dominus cedros Libani
6 And shall reduce them to pieces, as a calf of Libanus, and as the beloved son of unicorns. 6 et disperget eas quasi vitulus Libani et Sarion quasi filius rinocerotis
7 The voice of the Lord divideth the flame of fire: 7 vox Domini dividens flammas ignis
8 The voice of the Lord shaketh the desert: and the Lord shall shake the desert of Cades. 8 vox Domini parturire faciens desertum Cades
9 The voice of the Lord prepareth the stags: and he will discover the thick woods: and in his temple all shall speak his glory. 9 vox Domini obsetricans cervis et revelans saltus et in templo eius omnis loquetur gloriam
10 The Lord maketh the flood to dwell: and the Lord shall sit king for ever. The Lord will give strength to his people: the Lord will bless his people with peace. 10 Dominus diluvium inhabitat et sedebit Dominus rex in aeternum
. . 11 Dominus fortitudinem populo suo dabit Dominus benedicet populo suo in pace

Chapter 29

Exaltabo te, Domine. David praiseth God for his deliverance, and his merciful dealings with him.

1 A psalm of a canticle, at the dedication of David's house. 1 psalmus cantici pro dedicatione domus David
2 I will extol thee, O Lord, for thou hast upheld me: and hast not made my enemies to rejoice over me. 2 exaltabo te Domine quoniam salvasti me et non delectasti inimicos meos super me
3 O Lord my God, I have cried to thee, and thou hast healed me. 3 Domine Deus meus clamavi ad te et sanasti me
4 Thou hast brought forth, O Lord, my soul from hell: thou hast saved me from them that go down into the pit. 4 Domine eduxisti de inferno animam meam vivificasti me ne descenderem in lacum
5 Sing to the Lord, O ye his saints: and give praise to the memory of his holiness. 5 cantate Domino sancti eius et confitemini memoriae sanctitatis eius
6 For wrath is in his indignation; and life in his good will. In the evening weeping shall have place, and in the morning gladness. 6 quoniam ad momentum est ira eius et vita in repropitiatione eius ad vesperum commorabitur fletus et in matutino laus
7 And in my abundance I said: I shall never be moved. 7 ego autem dixi in abundantia mea non commovebor in sempiternum
8 O Lord, in thy favour, thou gavest strength to my beauty. Thou turnedst away thy face from me, and I became troubled. 8 Domine in voluntate tua posuisti monti meo fortitudinem abscondisti faciem tuam et factus sum conturbatus
9 To thee, O Lord, will I cry: and I will make supplication to my God. 9 ad Dominum clamabo et Dominum deprecabor
10 What profit is there in my blood, whilst I go down to corruption? Shall dust confess to thee, or declare thy truth? 10 quae est utilitas in sanguine meo cum descendero in corruptionem numquid confitebitur tibi pulvis aut adnuntiabit veritatem tuam
11 The Lord hath heard, and hath had mercy on me: the Lord became my helper. 11 audi Domine et miserere mei Domine esto adiutor
12 Thou hast turned for me my mourning into joy: thou hast cut my sackcloth, and hast compassed me with gladness: 12 convertisti planctum meum in chorum mihi solvisti saccum meum et accinxisti me laetitia
13 To the end that my glory may sing to thee, and I may not regret: O Lord my God, I will give praise to thee for ever. 13 ut laudet te gloria et non taceat Domine Deus meus in sempiternum confitebor tibi

Chapter 30

In te, Domine, speravi. A prayer of a just man under affliction.

1 Unto the end, a psalm for David, in an ecstasy. 1 victori canticum David
2 In thee, O Lord, have I hoped, let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy justice. 2 in te Domine speravi non confundar in aeternum in iustitia tua salva me
3 Bow down thy ear to me: make haste to deliver me. Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a house of refuge, to save me. 3 inclina ad me aurem tuam velociter libera me esto mihi in lapidem fortissimum et in domum munitam ut salves me
4 For thou art my strength and my refuge; and for thy name's sake thou wilt lead me, and nourish me. 4 quia petra mea et munitio mea tu es et propter nomen tuum dux meus eris et enutries me
5 Thou wilt bring me out of this snare, which they have hidden for me: for thou art my protector. 5 educes me de rete quod absconderunt mihi quia tu fortitudo mea es
6 Into thy hands I commend my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth. 6 in manu tua commendabo spiritum meum redemisti me Domine Deus veritatis
7 Thou hast hated them that regard vanities, to no purpose. But I have hoped in the Lord: 7 odisti custodientes vanitates frustra ego autem in Domino confisus sum
8 I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy. For thou hast regarded my humility, thou hast saved my soul out of distresses. 8 exultabo et laetabor in misericordia tua quia vidisti adflictionem meam cognovisti tribulationes animae meae
9 And thou hast not shut me up in the hands of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a spacious place. 9 et non conclusisti me in manibus inimici posuisti in latitudine pedes meos
10 Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am afflicted: my eye is troubled with wrath, my soul, and my belly: 10 miserere mei Domine quoniam tribulor caligavit in furore oculus meus anima mea et venter meus
11 For my life is wasted with grief: and my years in sighs. My strength is weakened through poverty and my bones are disturbed. 11 quia consumptae sunt in maerore vitae meae et anni mei in gemitu infirmata est in iniquitate fortitudo mea et ossa mea contabuerunt
