62 And he shut up his people under the sword: and he despised his inheritance. 62 et conclusit in gladio populum suum et in hereditate sua non distulit
63 Fire consumed their young men: and their maidens were not lamented. 63 iuvenes eius devoravit ignis et virgines eius nemo luxit
64 Their priests fell by the sword: and their widows did not mourn. 64 sacerdotes eius gladio ceciderunt et viduae eius non sunt fletae
65 And the Lord was awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that hath been surfeited with wine. 65 et evigilavit quasi dormiens Dominus quasi fortis post crapulam vini
66 And he smote his enemies on the hinder parts: he put them to an everlasting reproach. 66 et percussit hostes suos retrorsum obprobrium sempiternum dedit eos
67 And he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim: 67 et proiecit tabernaculum Ioseph et tribum Efraim non elegit
68 But he chose the tribe of Juda, mount Sion which he loved. 68 sed elegit tribum Iuda montem Sion quem dilexit
69 And he built his sanctuary as of unicorns, in the land which he founded for ever. 69 et aedificavit in similitudinem monoceroton sanctuarium suum quasi terram fundavit illud in saeculum
70 And he chose his servant David, and took him from the flocks of sheep: he brought him from following the ewes great with young, 70 et elegit David servum suum et tulit eum de gregibus ovium sequentem fetas adduxit eum
71 To feed Jacob his servant and Israel his inheritance. 71 ut pasceret Iacob populum eius et Israhel hereditatem eius
72 And he fed them in the innocence of his heart: and conducted them by the skilfulness of his hands. 72 qui pavit eos in simplicitate cordis sui et in prudentia manuum suarum dux eorum fuit

Chapter 78

Deus, venerunt gentes. The church in time of persecution prayeth for relief. It seems to belong to the time of the Machabees.

1 A psalm for Asaph. O God, the heathens are come into thy inheritance, they have defiled thy holy temple: they have made Jerusalem as a place to keep fruit. 1 canticum Asaph Deus venerunt gentes in hereditatem tuam polluerunt templum sanctum tuum posuerunt Hierusalem in acervis lapidum
2 They have given the dead bodies of thy servants to be meat for the fowls of the air: the flesh of thy saints for the beasts of the earth. 2 dederunt cadavera servorum tuorum escam volatilibus caeli carnes sanctorum tuorum bestiis terrae
3 They have poured out their blood as water, round about Jerusalem and there was none to bury them. 3 effuderunt sanguinem eorum quasi aquam in circuitu Hierusalem et non erat qui sepeliret
4 We are become a reproach to our neighbours: a scorn and derision to them that are round about us. 4 facti sumus obprobrium vicinis nostris subsannatio et derisio his qui in circuitu nostro sunt
5 How long, O Lord, wilt thou be angry for ever: shall thy zeal be kindled like a fire? 5 usquequo Domine irasceris in finem ardebit quasi ignis zelus tuus
6 Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that have not known thee: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name. 6 effunde furorem tuum super gentes quae non cognoverunt te et super regna quae nomen tuum non invocaverunt
7 Because they have devoured Jacob; and have laid waste his place. 7 quia comederunt Iacob et decorem eius desolaverunt
8 Remember not our former iniquities: let thy mercies speedily prevent us, for we are become exceeding poor. 8 ne recorderis iniquitatum nostrarum veterum cito occupent nos misericordiae tuae quia adtenuati sumus nimis
9 Help us, O God, our saviour: and for the glory of thy name, O Lord, deliver us: and forgive us our sins for thy name's sake: 9 auxiliare nobis Deus Iesus noster propter gloriam nominis tui et libera nos et propitiare peccatis nostris propter nomen tuum
10 Lest they should say among the Gentiles: Where is their God? And let him be made known among the nations before our eyes, By the revenging the blood of thy servants, which hath been shed: 10 quare dicunt gentes ubi est Deus eorum nota fiat in gentibus ante oculos nostros ultio sanguinis servorum tuorum qui effusus est
11 Let the sighing of the prisoners come in before thee. According to the greatness of thy arm, take possession of the children of them that have been put to death. 11 ingrediatur coram te gemitus vinctorum in magnitudine brachii tui relinque filios interitus
12 And render to our neighbours sevenfold in their bosom: the reproach wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord. 12 et redde vicinis nostris septuplum in sinu eorum obprobrium suum quo exprobraverunt tibi Domine
13 But we thy people, and the sheep of thy pasture, will give thanks to thee for ever. We will shew forth thy praise, unto generation and generation. 13 nos enim populus tuus et grex pascuae tuae confitebimur tibi in sempiternum in generatione et generatione narrabimus laudes tuas

Chapter 79

Qui regis Israel. A prayer for the church in tribulation, commemorating God's former favours.

1 Unto the end, for them that shall be changed, a testimony for Asaph, a psalm. 1 victori pro liliis testimonii Asaph canticum
2 Give ear, O thou that rulest Israel: thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep. Thou that sittest upon the cherubims, shine forth 2 qui pascis Israhel ausculta qui ducis quasi gregem Ioseph qui sedes super cherubin ostendere
3 Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses. Stir up thy might, and come to save us. 3 ante Efraim et Beniamin et Manasse suscita fortitudinem tuam et veni ut salvos facias nos
4 Convert us, O God: and shew us thy face, and we shall be saved. 4 Deus converte nos et ostende faciem tuam et salvi erimus
5 O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy servant? 5 Domine Deus exercituum usquequo fumabis ad orationem populi tui
6 How long wilt thou feed us with the bread of tears: and give us for our drink tears in measure? 6 cibasti nos pane flebili et potasti nos in lacrimis tripliciter
7 Thou hast made us to be a contradiction to our neighbours: and our enemies have scoffed at us. 7 posuisti nos contentionem vicinis nostris et inimici nostri subsannaverunt nos
8 O God of hosts, convert us: and shew thy face, and we shall be saved. 8 Deus exercituum converte nos et ostende faciem tuam et salvi erimus
9 Thou hast brought a vineyard out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the Gentiles and planted it. 9 vineam de Aegypto tulisti eiecisti gentes et plantasti eam
10 Thou wast the guide of its journey in its sight: thou plantedst the roots thereof, and it filled the land. 10 praeparasti ante faciem eius et stabilisti radices eius et implevit terram
11 The shadow of it covered the hills: and the branches thereof the cedars of God. 11 operti sunt montes umbra eius et ramis illius cedri Dei
12 It stretched forth its branches unto the sea, and its boughs unto the river. 12 expandit comas suas usque ad mare et usque ad Flumen germina sua
13 Why hast thou broken down the hedge thereof, so that all they who pass by the way do pluck it? 13 quare dissipasti maceriam eius et vindemiaverunt eam omnes qui transeunt per viam
14 The boar out of the wood hath laid it waste: and a singular wild beast hath devoured it. 14 vastavit eam aper de silva et omnes bestiae agri depastae sunt eam
15 Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vineyard: 15 Deus exercituum revertere obsecro respice de caelo et vide et visita vineam hanc
16 And perfect the same which thy right hand hath planted: and upon the son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself. 16 et radicem quam plantavit dextera tua et filium quem confirmasti tibi
17 Things set on fire and dug down shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance. 17 succensam igni et deramatam ab increpatione faciei tuae pereant
18 Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand: and upon the son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself. 18 fiat manus tua super virum dexterae tuae et super filium hominis quem confirmasti tibi
19 And we depart not from thee, thou shalt quicken us: and we will call upon thy name. 19 et non recedemus a te vivificabis nos et nomine tuo vocabimur
20 O Lord God of hosts, convert us and shew thy face, and we shall be saved. 20 Domine Deus exercituum converte nos et ostende faciem tuam et salvi erimus

Chapter 80

Exultate Deo. An invitation to a solemn praising of God.

1 Unto the end, for the winepresses, a psalm for Asaph himself. 1 victori in torcularibus Asaph
2 Rejoice to God our helper: sing aloud to the God of Jacob. 2 laudate Deum fortitudinem nostram iubilate Deo Iacob
3 Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel: the pleasant psaltery with the harp. 3 adsumite carmen et date tympanum citharam decoram cum psalterio
4 Blow up the trumpet on the new moon, on the noted day of your solemnity. 4 clangite in neomenia bucina et in medio mense die sollemnitatis nostrae
5 For it is a commandment in Israel, and a judgment to the God of Jacob. 5 quia legitimum Israhel est et iudicium Dei Iacob
6 He ordained it for a testimony in Joseph, when he came out of the land of Egypt: he heard a tongue which he knew not. 6 testimonium in Ioseph posuit cum egrederetur terra Aegypti labium quod nesciebam audivi
7 He removed his back from the burdens: his hands had served in baskets. 7 amovi ab onere umerum eius manus eius a cofino recesserunt
8 Thou calledst upon me in affliction, and I delivered thee: I heard thee in the secret place of tempest: I proved thee at the waters of contradiction. 8 in tribulatione invocasti et erui te exaudivi te in abscondito tonitrui probavi te super aquam Contradictionis semper
9 Hear, O my people, and I will testify to thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken to me, 9 audi populus meus et contestor te Israhel si audieris me
10 there shall be no new god in thee: neither shalt thou adore a strange god. 10 non sit in te deus alienus et non adores deum peregrinum
11 For I am the Lord thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it. 11 ego sum Dominus Deus tuus qui eduxi te de terra Aegypti dilata os tuum et implebo illud
12 But my people heard not my voice: and Israel hearkened not to me. 12 et non audivit populus meus vocem meam et Israhel non credidit mihi
13 So I let them go according to the desires of their heart: they shall walk in their own inventions. 13 et dimisi eum in pravitate cordis sui ambulabunt in consiliis suis
14 If my people had heard me: if Israel had walked in my ways: 14 utinam populus meus audisset me Israhel in viis meis ambulasset
15 I should soon have humbled their enemies, and laid my hand on them that troubled them. 15 quasi nihilum inimicos eius humiliassem et super hostes eorum vertissem manum meam
16 The enemies of the Lord have lied to him: and their time shall be for ever. 16 qui oderunt Dominum negabunt eum et erit tempus eorum in saeculo
17 And he fed them with the fat of wheat, and filled them with honey out of the rock. 17 et cibavit eos de adipe frumenti et de petra mellis saturavit eos

Chapter 81

Deus stetit. An exhortation to judges and men in power.

1 A psalm for Asaph. God hath stood in the congregation of gods: and being in the midst of them he judgeth gods. 1 canticum Asaph Deus stetit in coetu Dei in medio Deus iudicat
2 How long will you judge unjustly: and accept the persons of the wicked? 2 usquequo iudicatis iniquitatem et facies impiorum suscipitis semper
3 Judge for the needy and fatherless: do justice to the humble and the poor. 3 iudicate pauperi et pupillo egeno et inopi iuste facite
4 Rescue the poor; and deliver the needy out of the hand of the sinner. 4 salvate inopem et pauperem de manu impiorum liberate
5 They have not known nor understood: they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth shall be moved. 5 non cognoscunt nec intellegunt in tenebris ambulant movebuntur omnia fundamenta terrae
6 I have said: You are gods and all of you the sons of the most High. 6 ego dixi dii estis et filii Excelsi omnes vos
7 But you like men shall die: and shall fall like one of the princes. 7 ergo quasi Adam moriemini et quasi unus de principibus cadetis
8 Arise, O God, judge thou the earth: for thou shalt inherit among all the nations. 8 surge Domine iudica terram quoniam hereditabis omnes gentes

Chapter 82

Deus, quis similis. A prayer against the enemies of God's church.

1 A canticle of a psalm for Asaph. 1 canticum psalmi Asaph
2 O God, who shall be like to thee? hold not thy peace, neither be thou still, O God. 2 Deus ne taceas ne sileas et non quiescas Deus
3 For lo, thy enemies have made a noise: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head. 3 quia ecce inimici tui tumultuati sunt et qui oderunt te levaverunt caput
4 They have taken a malicious counsel against thy people, and have consulted against thy saints. 4 contra populum tuum nequiter tractaverunt et inierunt consilium adversum arcanum tuum
5 They have said: Come and let us destroy them, so that they be not a nation: and let the name of Israel be remembered no more. 5 dixerunt venite et conteramus eos de gente et non sit memoria nominis Israhel ultra
6 For they have contrived with one consent: they have made a covenant together against thee, 6 quoniam tractaverunt pariter contra te foedus pepigerunt
7 The tabernacle of the Edomites, and the Ishmahelites: Moab, and the Agarens, 7 tabernacula Idumeae et Ismahelitarum Moab et Aggareni
8 Gebal, and Ammon and Amalec: the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre. 8 Gebal et Ammon et Amalech Palestina cum habitatoribus Tyri
9 Yea, and the Assyrian also is joined with them: they are come to the aid of the sons of Lot. 9 sed et Assur venit cum eis facti sunt brachium filiorum Loth semper
10 Do to them as thou didst to Madian and to Sisara: as to Jabin at the brook of Cisson. 10 fac illis sicut Madian et Sisarae sicut Iabin in torrente Cison
11 Who perished at Endor: and became as dung for the earth. 11 contriti sunt in Aendor fuerunt quasi sterquilinium terrae
12 Make their princes like Oreb, and Zeb, and Zebee, and Salmana. All their princes, 12 pone duces eorum sicut Oreb et Zeb et Zebee et Salmana omnes principes eorum
13 Who have said: Let us possess the sanctuary of God for an inheritance. 13 qui dixerunt possideamus nobis pulchritudinem Dei
14 O my God, make them like a wheel; and as stubble before the wind. 14 Deus meus pone eos ut rotam quasi stipulam ante faciem venti
15 As fire which burneth the wood: and as a flame burning mountains: 15 quomodo ignis conburit silvam et sicut flamma devorat montes
16 So shalt thou pursue them with thy tempest: and shalt trouble them in thy wrath. 16 sic persequere eos in tempestate tua et in turbine tuo conturba eos
17 Fill their faces with shame; and they shall seek thy name, O Lord. 17 imple facies eorum ignominia et quaerent nomen tuum Domine
18 Let them be ashamed and troubled for ever and ever: and let them be confounded and perish. 18 confundantur et conturbentur usque in saeculum et erubescant et pereant
19 And let them know that the Lord is thy name: thou alone art the most High over all the earth. 19 et sciant quia nomen tuum est Dominus solus tu Excelsus super omnem terram

Chapter 83

Quam dilecta. The soul aspireth after heaven; rejoicing in the mean time, in being in the communion of God's church upon earth.

1 Unto the end, for the winepresses, a psalm for the sons of Core. 1 victori pro torculari filiorum Core canticum
2 How lovely are thy tabernacles, O Lord of hosts! 2 quam dilecta tabernacula tua Domine exercituum
3 my soul longeth and fainteth for the courts of the Lord. My heart and my flesh have rejoiced in the living God. 3 desiderat et defecit anima mea in atria Domini cor meum et caro mea laudabunt Deum viventem
4 For the sparrow hath found herself a house, and the turtle a nest for herself where she may lay her young ones: Thy altars, O Lord of hosts, my king and my God. 4 siquidem avis invenit domum et passer nidum sibi ubi ponat pullos suos altaria tua Domine exercituum rex meus et Deus meus
5 Blessed are they that dwell in thy house, O Lord: they shall praise thee for ever and ever. 5 beati qui habitant in domo tua adhuc laudabunt te semper
6 Blessed is the man whose help is from thee: in his heart he hath disposed to ascend by steps, 6 beatus homo cuius fortitudo est in te semitae in corde eius
7 In the vale of tears, in the place which he hath set. 7 transeuntes in valle fletus fontem ponent eam
8 For the lawgiver shall give a blessing, they shall go from virtue to virtue: the God of gods shall be seen in Sion. 8 benedictione quoque amicietur doctor ibunt de fortitudine in fortitudinem parebunt apud Deum in Sion
9 O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. 9 Domine Deus exercituum exaudi orationem meam ausculta Deus Iacob semper
10 Behold, O God our protector: and look on the face of thy Christ. 10 clipeus noster vide Deus et adtende faciem christi tui
11 For better is one day in thy courts above thousands. I have chosen to be an abject in the house of my God, rather than to dwell in the tabernacles of sinners. 11 quoniam melior est dies in atriis tuis super milia elegi abiectus esse in domo Dei mei magis quam habitare in tabernaculis impietatis
12 For God loveth mercy and truth: the Lord will give grace and glory. 12 quia sol et scutum Dominus Deus gratiam et gloriam dabit Dominus
13 He will not deprive of good things them that walk in innocence: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee. 13 nec prohibebit bonum ab his qui ambulant in perfectione Domine exercituum beatus homo qui confidet in te

Chapter 84

Benedixisti, Domine. The coming of Christ, to bring peace and salvation to man.

1 Unto the end, for the sons of Core, a psalm. 1 victori filiorum Core canticum
2 Lord, thou hast blessed thy land: thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob. 2 placatus es Domine terrae tuae reduxisti captivitatem Iacob
3 Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people: thou hast covered all their sins. 3 dimisisti iniquitatem populo tuo operuisti omnes iniquitates eorum semper
4 Thou hast mitigated all thy anger: thou hast turned away from the wrath of thy indignation. 4 continuisti omnem indignationem tuam conversus es ab ira furoris tui
5 Convert us, O God our saviour: and turn off thy anger from us. 5 converte nos Deus Iesus noster et solve iram tuam adversum nos
6 Wilt thou be angry with us for ever: or wilt thou extend thy wrath from generation to generation? 6 noli in aeternum irasci nobis extendens iram tuam in generationem et generationem
7 Thou wilt turn, O God, and bring us to life: and thy people shall rejoice in thee. 7 nonne tu revertens vivificabis nos et populus tuus laetabitur in te
8 Shew us, O Lord, thy mercy; and grant us thy salvation. 8 ostende nobis Domine misericordiam tuam et salutare tuum da nobis
9 I will hear what the Lord God will speak in me: for he will speak peace unto his people: And unto his saints: and unto them that are converted to the heart. 9 audiam quid loquatur Dominus Deus loquetur enim pacem ad populum suum et ad sanctos suos ut non convertantur ad stultitiam
10 Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him : that glory may dwell in our land. 10 verumtamen prope est his qui timent eum salutare eius ut habitet gloria in terra nostra
11 Mercy and truth have met each other: justice and peace have kissed. 11 misericordia et veritas occurrerunt iustitia et pax deosculatae sunt
12 Truth is sprung out of the earth: and justice hath looked down from heaven. 12 veritas de terra orta est et iustitia de caelo prospexit
13 For the Lord will give goodness: and our earth shall yield her fruit. 13 sed et Dominus dabit bonum et terra nostra dabit germen suum
14 Justice shall walk before him: and ,shall set his steps in the way. 14 iustitia ante eum ibit et ponet in via gressus suos

Chapter 85

Inclina, Domine. A prayer for God's grace to assist us to the end.

1 A prayer for David himself. Incline thy ear, O Lord, and hear me: for I am needy and poor. 1 oratio David inclina Domine aurem tuam exaudi me quia egenus et pauper ego sum
2 Preserve my soul, for I am holy: save thy servant, O my God, that trusteth in thee. 2 custodi animam meam quia sanctus sum salva servum tuum tu Deus meus qui confidit in te
3 Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I have cried to thee all the day. 3 miserere mei Domine quoniam ad te clamabo tota die
4 Give joy to the soul of thy servant, for to thee, O Lord, I have lifted up my soul. 4 laetifica animam servi tui quia ad te animam meam levo
5 For thou, O Lord, art sweet and mild: and plenteous in mercy to all that call upon thee. 5 tu enim es Domine bonus et propitiabilis et multus misericordia omnibus qui invocant te
6 Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer: and attend to the voice of my petition. 6 exaudi Domine orationem meam et ausculta vocem deprecationum mearum
7 I have called upon thee in the day of my trouble: because thou hast heard me. 7 in die tribulationis meae invocabo te quia exaudies me
8 There is none among the gods like unto thee, O Lord: and there is none according to thy works. 8 non est similis tui in diis Domine non est iuxta opera tua
9 All the nations thou hast made shall come and adore before thee, O Lord: and they shall glorify thy name. 9 omnes gentes quas fecisti venient et adorabunt coram te Domine et glorificabunt nomen tuum
10 For thou art great and dost wonderful things: thou art God alone. 10 quia magnus tu et faciens mirabilia tu Deus solus
11 Conduct me, O Lord, in thy way, and I will walk in thy truth: let my heart rejoice that it may fear thy name. 11 doce me Domine viam tuam ut ambulem in veritate tua unicum fac cor meum ut timeat nomen tuum
12 I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart, and I will glorify thy name for ever: 12 confitebor tibi Domine Deus meus in toto corde meo et glorificabo nomen tuum in sempiternum
13 For thy mercy is great towards me: and thou hast delivered my soul out of the lower hell. 13 quia misericordia tua magna super me et eruisti animam meam de inferno extremo
14 O God, the wicked are risen up against me, and the assembly of the mighty have sought my soul: and they have not set thee before their eyes. 14 Deus superbi surrexerunt adversus me et coetus robustorum quaesivit animam meam et non posuerunt te in conspectu suo
15 And thou, O Lord, art a God of compassion, and merciful, patient, and of much mercy, and true. 15 tu autem Domine Deus misericors et clemens patiens et multae misericordiae et verus
16 O look upon me, and have mercy on me: give thy command to thy servant, and save the son of thy handmaid. 16 respice ad me et miserere mei da fortitudinem tuam servo tuo et salva filium ancillae tuae
17 Shew me a token for good: that they who hate me may see, and be confounded, because thou, O Lord, hast helped me and hast comforted me. 17 fac mecum signum in bonitate et videant qui oderunt me et confundantur quia tu Domine auxiliatus es mihi et consolatus es me

Chapter 86

Fundamenta ejus. The glory of the church of Christ.

1 For the sons of Core, a psalm of a canticle. The foundations thereof are the holy mountains: 1 filiorum Core psalmus cantici fundamentum eius in montibus sanctuarii
2 The Lord loveth the gates of Sion above all the tabernacles of Jacob. 2 diligit Dominus portas Sion super omnia tabernacula Iacob
3 Glorious things are said of thee, O city of God. 3 gloriosa dicta sunt in te civitas Dei semper
4 I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me. Behold the foreigners, and Tyre, and the people of the Ethiopians, these were there. 4 commemorabo superbiae et Babylonis scientes me ecce Palestina et Tyrus cum Aethiopia iste natus est ibi
5 Shall not Sion say: This man and that man is born in her? and the Highest himself hath founded her. 5 ad Sion autem dicetur vir et vir natus est in ea et ipse fundavit eam Excelsus
6 The Lord shall tell in his writings of peoples and of princes, of them that have been in her. 6 Dominus numerabit scribens populos ipse natus est in ea semper
7 The dwelling in thee is as it were of all rejoicing. 7 et cantabunt quasi in choris omnes fontes mei in te

Chapter 87

Domine, Deus salutis. A prayer of one under grievous affliction: it agrees to Christ in his passion, and alludes to his death and burial.

1 A canticle of a psalm for the sons of Core: unto the end, for Maheleth, to answer understanding of Eman the Ezrahite. 1 canticum carminis filiorum Core victori per chorum ad praecinendum eruditionis Eman Ezraitae
2 O Lord, the God of my salvation: I have cried in the day, and in the night before thee. 2 Domine Deus salutis meae per diem clamavi in nocte coram te
3 Let my prayer come in before thee: incline thy ear to my petition. 3 ingrediatur ante te oratio mea inclina aurem tuam ad laudationem meam
4 For my soul is filled with evils: and my life hath drawn nigh to hell. 4 quia repleta est malis anima mea et vita mea ad infernum descendit
5 I am counted among them that go down to the pit: I am become as a man without help, 5 reputatus sum cum descendentibus lacum factus sum quasi homo invalidus
6 Free among the dead. Like the slain sleeping in the sepulchres, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand. 6 inter mortuos liber sicut interfecti et dormientes in sepulchro quorum non recordaris amplius et qui a manu tua abscisi sunt
7 They have laid me in the lower pit: in the dark places, and in the shadow of death. 7 posuisti me in lacu novissimo in tenebris in profundis
8 Thy wrath is strong over me: and all thy waves thou hast brought in upon me. 8 super me confirmatus est furor tuus et cunctis fluctibus tuis adflixisti me semper
9 Thou hast put away my acquaintance far from me: they have set me an abomination to themselves. I was delivered up, and came not forth: 9 longe fecisti notos meos a me posuisti me abominationem eis clausum et non prodeuntem
10 My eyes languished through poverty. All the day I cried to thee, O Lord: I stretched out my hands to thee. 10 oculus meus infirmatus est ab adflictione invocavi te Domine tota die expandi ad te palmas meas
11 Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? or shall physicians raise to life, and give praise to thee? 11 numquid mortuis facies mirabilia aut gigantes surgent et confitebuntur tibi semper
12 Shall any one in the sepulchre declare thy mercy: and thy truth in destruction? 12 numquid narrabitur in sepulchro misericordia tua et veritas tua in perditione
13 Shall thy wonders be known in the dark; and thy justice in the land of forgetfulness? 13 numquid noscentur in tenebris mirabilia tua et iustitia tua in terra quae oblivioni tradita est
14 But I, O Lord, have cried to thee: and in the morning my prayer shall prevent thee. 14 ego autem ad te Domine clamavi et mane oratio mea praeveniet te
15 Lord, why castest thou off my prayer: why turnest thou away thy face from me? 15 quare Domine abicis animam meam abscondis faciem tuam a me
16 I am poor, and in labours from my youth: and being exalted have been humbled and troubled. 16 pauper ego et aerumnosus ab adulescentia portavi furorem tuum et conturbatus sum
17 Thy wrath hath come upon me: and thy terrors have troubled me. 17 per me transierunt irae tuae terrores tui oppresserunt me
18 They have come round about me like water all the day: they have compassed me about together. 18 circumdederunt me quasi aquae tota die vallaverunt me pariter
19 Friend and neighbour thou hast put far from me: and my acquaintance, because of misery. 19 longe fecisti a me amicum et sodalem notos meos abstulisti

Chapter 88

Misericordias Domini. The perpetuity of the church of Christ, in consequence of the promise of God: which, notwithstanding, God permits her to suffer sometimes most grievous afflictions.

1 Of understanding, for Ethan the Ezrahite. 1 eruditionis Aethan Ezraitae
2 The mercies of the Lord I will sing for ever. I will shew forth thy truth with my mouth to generation and generation. 2 misericordias Domini in aeternum cantabo in generatione et generatione adnuntiabo veritatem tuam in ore meo
3 For thou hast said: Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens: thy truth shall be prepared in them. 3 quia dixisti sempiterna misericordia aedificabitur caelos fundabis et veritas tua in eis
4 I have made a covenant with my elect: I have sworn to David my servant: 4 percussi foedus cum electo meo iuravi David servo meo
5 Thy seed will I settle for ever. And I will build up thy throne unto generation and generation. 5 usque in aeternum stabiliam semen tuum et aedificabo in generationem et generationem thronum tuum semper
6 The heavens shall confess thy wonders, O Lord: and thy truth in the church of the saints. 6 confitebuntur caeli mirabilia tua Domine et veritatem tuam in ecclesia sanctorum
7 For who in the clouds can be compared to the Lord: or who among the sons of God shall be like to God? 7 quis enim in nubibus adaequabitur Domino adsimilabitur Domino de filiis Dei
8 God, who is glorified in the assembly of the saints: great and terrible above all them that are about him. 8 Deus inclitus in arcano sanctorum nimio et terribilis in cunctis qui circum eum sunt
9 O Lord God of hosts, who is like to thee? thou art mighty, O Lord, and thy truth is round about thee. 9 Domine Deus exercituum quis similis tui fortissime Domine et veritas tua in circuitu tuo
10 Thou rulest the power of the sea: and appeasest the motion of the waves thereof. 10 tu dominaris superbiae maris et elationes gurgitum eius tu conprimis
11 Thou hast humbled the proud one, as one that is slain: with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies. 11 tu confregisti quasi vulneratum superbum in brachio forti tuo dispersisti inimicos tuos
12 Thine are the heavens, and thine is the earth: the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded: 12 tui sunt caeli et tua est terra orbem et plenitudinem eius tu fundasti
13 The north and the sea thou hast created. Thabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name: 13 aquilonem et dexteram tu creasti Thabor et Hermon nomen tuum laudabunt
14 Thy arm is with might. Let thy hand be strengthened, and thy right hand exalted: 14 tuum brachium cum fortitudine roboretur manus tua exaltetur dextera tua
15 Justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne. Mercy and truth shall go before thy face: 15 iustitia et iudicium firmamentum throni tui misericordia et veritas praecedent faciem tuam
16 Blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation. They shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance: 16 beatus populus qui novit iubilum Domine in lumine vultus tui ambulabunt
17 And in thy name they shall rejoice all the day, and in thy justice they shall be exalted. 17 in nomine tuo exultabunt tota die et in iustitia tua exaltabuntur
18 For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted. 18 quia gloria fortitudinis eorum tu es et in misericordia tua elevabis cornu nostrum
19 For our protection is of the Lord, and of our king the holy one of Israel. 19 quia a Domino est protectio nostra et a Sancto Israhel rege nostro
20 Then thou spokest in a vision to thy saints, and saidst: I have laid help upon one that is mighty, and have exalted one chosen out of my people. 20 tunc locutus es per visionem sanctis tuis et dixisti posui adiutorium super robustum exaltavi electum de populo
21 I have found David my servant: with my holy oil I have anointed him. 21 inveni David servum meum oleo sancto meo unxi eum
22 For my hand shall help him: and my arm shall strengthen him. 22 cum quo manus mea firma erit et brachium meum roborabit eum
23 The enemy shall have no advantage over him: nor the son of iniquity have power to hurt him. 23 non decipiet inimicus eum et filius iniquitatis non adfliget eum
24 And I will cut down his enemies before his face; and them that hate him I will put to flight. 24 sed concidam ante faciem eius hostes illius et qui eum oderunt percutiam
25 And my truth and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted. 25 veritas autem mea et misericordia mea erit cum eo et in nomine meo exaltabitur cornu eius
26 And I will set his hand in the sea; and his right hand in the rivers. 26 et ponam in mari manum eius et in fluminibus dexteram eius
27 He shall cry out to me: Thou art my father: my God, and the support of my salvation. 27 ipse vocabit me pater meus es tu Deus meus et fortitudo salutis meae
28 And I will make him my firstborn, high above the kings of the earth. 28 ego autem primogenitum ponam eum excelsum regibus terrae
29 I will keep my mercy for him for ever: and my covenant faithful to him. 29 in aeternum custodiam ei misericordiam meam et pactum meum fidele ei erit
30 And I will make his seed to endure for evermore: and his throne as the days of heaven. 30 et ponam perpetuum semen eius et thronum eius sicut dies caeli
31 And if his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments: 31 si autem dereliquerint filii eius legem meam et in iudiciis meis non ambulaverint
32 If they profane my justices: and keep not my commandments: 32 si caerimonias meas profanaverint et praecepta mea non custodierint
33 I will visit their iniquities with a rod and their sins with stripes. 33 visitabo in virga scelera eorum et in plagis iniquitatem eorum
34 But my mercy I will not take away from him: nor will I suffer my truth to fail. 34 misericordiam autem meam non auferam ab eo nec mentiar in veritate mea
35 Neither will I profane my covenant: and the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void. 35 non violabo pactum meum et quod egressum est de labiis meis non mutabo
36 Once have I sworn by my holiness: I will not lie unto David: 36 semel iuravi in sancto meo ne David mentiar
37 His seed shall endure for ever. 37 semen eius in sempiternum erit
38 And his throne as the sun before me: and as the moon perfect for ever, and a faithful witness in heaven. 38 et thronus eius sicut sol in conspectu meo sicut luna stabilietur in sempiternum et testis in caelo fidelis semper
39 But thou hast rejected and despised: thou hast been angry with my anointed. 39 tu autem reppulisti et proiecisti iratus es adversum christum tuum
40 Thou hast overthrown the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his sanctuary on the earth. 40 adtenuasti pactum servi tui profanasti in terra diadema eius
41 Thou hast broken down all his hedges: thou hast made his strength fear. 41 dissipasti omnes macerias eius posuisti munitiones eius pavorem
42 All that pass by the way have robbed him: he is become a reproach to his neighbours. 42 diripuerunt eum omnes qui transeunt per viam factus est obprobrium vicinis suis
43 Thou hast set up the right hand of them that oppress him: thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice. 43 elevasti dexteram hostium eius laetificasti omnes inimicos illius
44 Thou hast turned away the help of his sword; and hast not assisted him in battle. 44 avertisti robur gladii eius et non sublevasti eum in proelio
45 Thou hast made his purification to cease: and thou hast cast his throne down to the ground. 45 quiescere fecisti munditiam eius et thronum illius in terram detraxisti
46 Thou hast shortened the days of his time: thou hast covered him with confusion. 46 adbreviasti dies adulescentiae eius operuisti eum ignominia sempiterna
47 How long, O Lord, turnest thou away unto the end? shall thy anger burn like fire? 47 usquequo Domine absconderis in finem succendetur quasi ignis indignatio tua
48 Remember what my substance is: for hast thou made all the children of men in vain? 48 memento mei de profundo alioquin quare frustra creasti filios hominum
49 Who is the man that shall live, and not see death: that shall deliver his soul from the hand of hell? 49 quis est vir qui vivat et non videat mortem salvans animam suam de manu inferi semper
50 Lord, where are thy ancient mercies, according to what thou didst swear to David in thy truth? 50 ubi sunt misericordiae tuae antiquae Domine quas iurasti David in veritate tua
51 Be mindful, O Lord, of the reproach of thy servants (which I have held in my bosom) of many nations: 51 recordare Domine obprobrii servorum tuorum quia portavi in sinu meo omnes iniquitates populorum
52 Wherewith thy enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the change of thy anointed. 52 quas exprobraverunt inimici tui Domine quibus exprobraverunt vestigia christi tui
53 Blessed be the Lord for evermore. So be it. So be it. 53 benedictus Dominus in sempiternum amen et amen

Chapter 89

Domine, refugium. A prayer for the mercy of God: recounting the shortness and miseries of the days of man.

1 A prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, thou hast been our refuge from generation to generation. 1 oratio Mosi viri Dei Domine habitaculum tu factus es nobis in generatione et generatione
2 Before the mountains were made, or the earth and the world was formed; from eternity and to eternity thou art God. 2 antequam montes nascerentur et parturiretur terra et orbis a saeculo et usque in saeculum tu es
3 Turn not man away to be brought low: and thou hast said: Be converted, O ye sons of men. 3 convertes hominem usque ad contritionem et dices revertimini filii Adam
4 For a thousand years in thy sight are as yesterday, which is past. And as a watch in the night, 4 quia mille anni in oculis tuis sicut dies hesterna quae pertransiit et vigilia nocturna
5 Things that are counted nothing, shall their years be. 5 percutiente te eos somnium erunt
6 In the morning man shall grow up like grass; in the morning he shall flourish and pass away: in the evening he shall fall, grow dry, and wither. 6 mane quasi herba pertransiens mane floruit et abiit ad vesperam conteretur atque siccabitur
7 For in thy wrath we have fainted away: and are troubled in thy indignation. 7 consumpti enim sumus in furore tuo et in indignatione tua conturbati sumus
8 Thou hast set our iniquities before thy eyes: our life in the light of thy countenance. 8 posuisti iniquitates nostras coram te neglegentias nostras in luce vultus tui
9 For all our days are spent; and in thy wrath we have fainted away. Our years shall be considered as a spider: 9 omnes enim dies nostri transierunt in furore tuo consumpsimus annos nostros quasi sermonem loquens
10 The days of our years in them are threescore and ten years. But if in the strong they be fourscore years: and what is more of them is labour and sorrow. For mildness is come upon us: and we shall be corrected. 10 dies annorum nostrorum in ipsis septuaginta anni si autem multum octoginta anni et quod amplius est labor et dolor quoniam transivimus cito et avolavimus
11 Who knoweth the power of thy anger, and for thy fear 11 quis novit fortitudinem irae tuae et secundum timorem tuum indignationem tuam
12 Can number thy wrath? So make thy right hand known: and men learned in heart, in wisdom. 12 ut numerentur dies nostri sic ostende et veniemus corde sapienti
13 Return, O Lord, how long? and be entreated in favour of thy servants. 13 revertere Domine usquequo et exorabilis esto super servis tuis
14 We are filled in the morning with thy mercy: and we have rejoiced, and are delighted all our days. 14 imple nos matutina misericordia tua et laudabimus et laetabimur in cunctis diebus nostris
15 We have rejoiced for the days in which thou hast humbled us: for the years in which we have seen evils. 15 laetifica nos pro diebus quibus adflixisti nos et annis in quibus vidimus mala
16 Look upon thy servants and upon their works: and direct their children. 16 appareat apud servos tuos opus tuum et gloria tua super filios eorum
17 And let the brightness of the Lord our God be upon us: and direct thou the works of our hands over us; yea, the work of our hands do thou direct. 17 et sit decor Domini Dei nostri super nos et opus manuum nostrarum fac stabile super nos opus manuum nostrarum confirma

Chapter 90

Qui habitat. The just is secure under the protection of God.

1 The praise of a canticle for David. He that dwelleth in the aid of the most High, shall abide under the protection of the God of Jacob. 1 qui habitat in abscondito Excelsi in umbraculo Domini commorabitur
2 He shall say to the Lord: Thou art my protector, and my refuge: my God, in him will I trust. 2 dicens Domino spes mea et fortitudo mea Deus meus confidam in eum
3 For he hath delivered me from the snare of the hunters: and from the sharp word. 3 quia ipse liberabit te de laqueo venantium de morte insidiarum
4 He will overshadow thee with his shoulders: and under his wings thou shalt trust. 4 in scapulis suis obumbrabit tibi et sub alis eius sperabis
5 His truth shall compass thee with a shield: thou shalt not be afraid of the terror of the night. 5 scutum et protectio veritas eius non timebis a timore nocturno
6 Of the arrow that flieth in the day, of the business that walketh about in the dark: of invasion, or of the noonday devil. 6 a sagitta volante per diem a peste in tenebris ambulante a morsu insanientis meridie
7 A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand: but it shall not come nigh thee. 7 cadent a latere tuo mille et decem milia a dextris tuis ad te autem non adpropinquabit
8 But thou shalt consider with thy eyes: and shalt see the reward of the wicked. 8 verumtamen oculis tuis videbis et ultionem impiorum cernes
9 Because thou, O Lord, art my hope: thou hast made the most High thy refuge. 9 tu enim es Domine spes mea Excelsum posuisti habitaculum tuum
10 There shall no evil come to thee: nor shall the scourge come near thy dwelling. 10 non accedet ad te malum et lepra non adpropinquabit tabernaculo tuo
11 For he hath given his angels charge over thee; to keep thee in all thy ways. 11 quia angelis suis mandabit de te ut custodiant te in omnibus viis tuis
12 In their hands they shall bear thee up: lest thou dash thy foot against a stone. 12 in manibus portabunt te ne forte offendat ad lapidem pes tuus
13 Thou shalt walk upon the asp and the basilisk: and thou shalt trample under foot the lion and the dragon. 13 super aspidem et basiliscum calcabis conculcabis leonem et draconem
14 Because he hoped in me I will deliver him: I will protect him because he hath known my name. 14 quoniam mihi adhesit et liberabo eum exaltabo eum quoniam cognovit nomen meum
15 He shall cry to me, and I will hear him: I am with him in tribulation, I will deliver him, and I will glorify him. 15 invocabit me et exaudiam eum cum ipso ero in tribulatione eruam eum et glorificabo
16 I will fill him with length of days; and I will shew him my salvation. 16 longitudine dierum implebo illum et ostendam ei salutare meum

Chapter 91

Bonum est confiteri. God is to be praised for his wondrous works.

1 A psalm of a canticle on the sabbath day. 1 psalmus cantici in die sabbati
2 It is good to give praise to the Lord: and to sing to thy name, O most High. 2 bonum est confiteri Domino et psallere nomini tuo Altissime
3 To shew forth thy mercy in the morning, and thy truth in the night: 3 ad adnuntiandam mane misericordiam tuam et fidem tuam in nocte
4 Upon an instrument of ten strings, upon the psaltery: with a canticle upon the harp. 4 in decacordo et in psalterio in cantico in cithara
5 For thou hast given me, O Lord, a delight in thy doings: and in the works of thy hands I shall rejoice. 5 quoniam laetificasti me Domine in opere tuo in facturis manuum tuarum laudabo
6 O Lord, how great are thy works! thy thoughts are exceeding deep. 6 quam magnificata sunt opera tua Domine satis profundae factae sunt cogitationes tuae
7 The senseless man shall not know: nor will the fool understand these things. 7 vir insipiens non cognoscet et stultus non intelleget istud
8 When the wicked shall spring up as grass: and all the workers of iniquity shall appear: That they may perish for ever and ever: 8 germinaverunt impii quasi faenum et floruerunt omnes qui operantur iniquitatem ut contererentur usque in sempiternum
9 But thou, O Lord, art most high for evermore. 9 tu autem Excelsus in aeternum Domine
10 For behold thy enemies, O lord, for behold thy enemies shall perish: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered. 10 ecce enim inimici tui Domine ecce inimici tui peribunt et dissipabuntur omnes qui operantur iniquitatem
11 But my horn shall be exalted like that of the unicorn: and my old age in plentiful mercy. 11 et exaltabitur quasi monocerotis cornu meum et senecta mea in oleo uberi
12 My eye also hath looked down upon my enemies: and my ear shall hear of the downfall of the malignant that rise up against me. 12 et dispiciet oculus meus eos qui insidiantur mihi de his qui consurgunt adversum me malignantibus audit auris mea
13 The just shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow up like the cedar of Libanus. 13 iustus ut palma florebit ut cedrus in Libano multiplicabitur
14 They that are planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God. 14 transplantati in domo Domini in atriis Dei nostri germinabunt
15 They shall still increase in a fruitful old age: and shall be well treated, 15 adhuc fructificabunt in senectute pingues et frondentes erunt
16 That they may shew, That the Lord our God is righteous, and there is no iniquity in him. 16 adnuntiantes quia rectus Dominus fortitudo mea et non est iniquitas in eo

Chapter 92

Dominus regnavit. The glory and stability of the kingdom; that is, of the church of Christ. Praise in the way of a canticle, for David himself, on the day before the sabbath, when the earth was founded.

1 The Lord hath reigned, he is clothed with beauty: the Lord is clothed with strength, and hath girded himself. For he hath established the world which shall not be moved. 1 Dominus regnavit gloria indutus est indutus est Dominus fortitudine et accinctus est insuper adpendit orbem qui non commovebitur
2 My throne is prepared from of old: thou art from everlasting. 2 firmum solium tuum ex tunc ab aeterno tu es
3 The floods have lifted up, O Lord: the floods have lifted up their voice. The floods have lifted up their waves, 3 levaverunt flumina Domine levaverunt flumina voces suas levaverunt flumina gurgites suos
4 With the noise of many waters. Wonderful are the surges of the sea: wonderful is the Lord on high. 4 a vocibus aquarum multarum grandes fluctus maris grandis in excelso Dominus
5 Thy testimonies are become exceedingly credible: holiness becometh thy house, O Lord, unto length of days. 5 testimonia tua fidelia facta sunt nimis domum tuam decet sanctitas Domine in longitudine dierum

Chapter 93

Deus ultionum. God shall judge and punish the oppressors of his people. A psalm for David himself on the fourth day of the week.

1 The Lord is the God to whom revenge belongeth: the God of revenge hath acted freely. 1 Deus ultionum Domine Deus ultionum ostendere
2 Lift up thyself, thou that judgest the earth: render a reward to the proud. 2 elevare qui iudicas terram redde vicissitudinem superbis
3 How long shall sinners, O Lord: how long shall sinners glory? 3 usquequo impii Domine usquequo impii exultabunt
4 Shall they utter, and speak iniquity: shall all speak who work injustice? 4 fluent loquentes antiquum garrient omnes qui operantur iniquitatem
5 Thy people, O Lord, they have brought low: and they have afflicted thy inheritance. 5 populum tuum Domine conterent et hereditatem tuam adfligent
6 They have slain the widow and the stranger: and they have murdered the fatherless. 6 viduam et advenam interficient et pupillos occident
7 And they have said: The Lord shall not see: neither shall the God of Jacob understand. 7 et dixerunt non videbit Dominus et non intelleget Deus Iacob
8 Understand, ye senseless among the people: and, you fools, be wise at last. 8 intellegite stulti in populo et insipientes aliquando discite
9 He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? or he that formed the eye, doth he not consider? 9 qui plantavit aurem non audiet aut qui finxit oculum non videbit
10 He that chastiseth nations, shall he not rebuke: he that teacheth man knowledge? 10 qui erudit gentes non arguet qui docet hominem scientiam
11 The Lord knoweth the thoughts of men, that they are vain. 11 Dominus novit cogitationes hominum quia vanae sunt
12 Blessed is the man whom thou shalt instruct, O Lord: and shalt teach him out of thy law. 12 beatus vir quem erudieris Domine et de lege tua docueris eum
13 That thou mayst give him rest from the evil days: till a pit be dug for the wicked. 13 ut quiescat a diebus adflictionis donec fodiatur impio interitus
14 For the Lord will not cast off his people: neither will he forsake his own inheritance. 14 non enim derelinquet Dominus populum suum et hereditatem suam non deseret
15 Until justice be turned into judgment: and they that are near it are all the upright in heart. 15 quoniam ad iustitiam revertetur iudicium et sequentur illud omnes recti corde
16 Who shall rise up for me against the evildoers? or who shall stand with me against the workers of iniquity? 16 quis stabit pro me adversum malos quis stabit pro me adversum operarios iniquitatis
17 Unless the Lord had been my helper, my soul had almost dwelt in hell. 17 nisi quia Dominus auxiliator meus paulo minus habitasset in inferno anima mea
18 If I said: My foot is moved: thy mercy, O Lord, assisted me. 18 si dicebam commotus est pes meus misericordia tua Domine sustentabat me
19 According to the multitude of my sorrows in my heart, thy comforts have given joy to my soul. 19 in multitudine cogitationum mearum quae sunt in me intrinsecus consolationes tuae delectabunt animam meam
20 Doth the seat of iniquity stick to thee, who framest labour in commandment? 20 numquid particeps erit tui thronus insidiarum fingens laborem in praecepto
21 They will hunt after the soul of the just, and will condemn innocent blood. 21 copulabuntur adversus animam iusti et sanguinem innocentem condemnabunt
22 But the Lord is my refuge: and my God the help of my hope. 22 erit autem Dominus mihi in refugium et Deus meus quasi petra spei meae
23 And he will render them their iniquity : and in their malice he will destroy them: the Lord our God will destroy them. 23 et restitues super eos iniquitatem suam et in malitia sua perdes eos perdet eos Dominus Deus noster

Chapter 94

Venite exultemus. An invitation to adore and serve God, and to hear his voice. Praise of a canticle for David himself.

1 Come let us praise the Lord with joy: let us joyfully sing to God our saviour. 1 venite laudemus Dominum iubilemus petrae Iesu nostro
2 Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving; and make a joyful noise to him with psalms. 2 praeoccupemus vultum eius in actione gratiarum in canticis iubilemus ei
3 For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods. 3 quoniam fortis et magnus Dominus et rex magnus super omnes deos
4 For in his hand are all the ends of the earth: and the heights of the mountains are his. 4 in cuius manu fundamenta terrae et excelsa montium ipsius sunt
5 For the sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land. 5 cuius est mare ipse enim fecit illud et siccam manus eius plasmaverunt
6 Come let us adore and fall down: and weep before the Lord that made us. 6 venite adoremus et curvemur flectamus genua ante faciem Domini factoris nostri
7 For he is the Lord our God: and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. 7 quia ipse est Deus noster et nos populus pascuae eius et grex manus eius
8 To day if you shall hear his voice, harden not your hearts: 8 hodie si vocem eius audieritis nolite indurare corda vestra
9 As in the provocation, according to the day of temptation in the wilderness: where your fathers tempted me, they proved me, and saw my works. 9 sicut in contradictione sicut in die temptationis in deserto ubi temptaverunt me patres vestri probaverunt me et viderunt opus meum
10 Forty years long was I offended with that generation, and I said: These always err in heart. 10 quadraginta annis displicuit mihi generatio illa et dixi populus errans corde est
11 And these men have not known my ways: so I swore in my wrath that they shall not enter into my rest. 11 et non cognoscens vias meas et iuravi in furore meo ut non introirent in requiem meam

Chapter 95

Cantate Domino. An exhortation to praise God for the coming of Christ and his kingdom.

1 A canticle for David himself, when the house was built after the captivity. Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: sing to the Lord, all the earth. 1 canite Domino canticum novum canite Domino omnis terra
2 Sing ye to the Lord and bless his name: shew forth his salvation from day to day. 2 canite Domino benedicite nomini eius adnuntiate de die in diem salutare eius
3 Declare his glory among the Gentiles: his wonders among all people. 3 narrate in gentibus gloriam eius in universis populis mirabilia eius
4 For the Lord is great, and exceedingly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods. 4 quia magnus Dominus et laudabilis nimis terribilis est super omnes deos
5 For all the gods of the Gentiles are devils: but the Lord made the heavens. 5 omnes enim dii populorum sculptilia Dominus autem caelos fecit
6 Praise and beauty are before him: holiness and majesty in his sanctuary. 6 gloria et decor ante vultum eius fortitudo et exultatio in sanctuario eius
7 Bring ye to the Lord, O ye kindreds of the Gentiles, bring ye to the Lord glory and honour: 7 adferte Domino familiae populorum adferte Domino gloriam et fortitudinem
8 Bring to the Lord glory unto his name. Bring up sacrifices, and come into his courts: 8 adferte Domino gloriam nomini eius levate munera et introite in atria eius
9 Adore ye the Lord in his holy court. Let all the earth be moved at his presence. 9 adorate Dominum in decore sanctuarii paveat a facie eius omnis terra
10 Say ye among the Gentiles, the Lord hath reigned. For he hath corrected the world, which shall not be moved: he will judge the people with justice. 10 dicite in gentibus Dominus regnavit siquidem adpendit orbem inmobilem iudicabit populos in aequitate
11 Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad, let the sea be moved, and the fulness thereof: 11 laetamini caeli et exultet terra tonet mare et plenitudo eius
12 The fields and all things that are in them shall be joyful. Then shall all the trees of the woods rejoice 12 gaudeat ager et omnia quae in eo sunt tunc laudabunt universa ligna saltus
13 before the face of the Lord, because he cometh: because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice, and the people with his truth. 13 ante faciem Domini quoniam venit quoniam venit iudicare terram iudicabit orbem in iusto et populos in fide sua

Chapter 96

Dominus regnavit. All are invited to rejoice at the glorious coming and reign of Christ.

1 For the same David, when his land was restored again to him. The Lord hath reigned, let the earth rejoice: let many islands be glad. 1 Dominus regnavit exultabit terra laetabuntur insulae multae
2 Clouds and darkness are round about him: justice and judgment are the establishment of his throne. 2 nubes et caligo in circuitu eius iustitia et iudicium firmamentum solii eius
3 A fire shall go before him, and shall burn his enemies round about. 3 ignis ante faciem eius ibit et exuret per circuitum hostes eius
4 His lightnings have shone forth to the world: the earth saw and trembled. 4 apparuerunt fulgora eius orbi vidit et contremuit terra
5 The mountains melted like wax, at the presence of the Lord: at the presence of the Lord of all the earth. 5 montes sicut cera tabefacti sunt a facie Domini a facie dominatoris omnis terrae
6 The heavens declared his justice: and all people saw his glory. 6 adnuntiaverunt caeli iustitiam eius et viderunt omnes populi gloriam eius
7 Let them be all confounded that adore graven things, and that glory in their idols. Adore him, all you his angels: 7 confundantur universi qui serviunt sculptili qui gloriantur in idolis adorate eum omnes dii
8 Sion heard, and was glad. And the daughters of Juda rejoiced, because of thy judgments, O Lord. 8 audivit et laetata est Sion et exultaverunt filiae Iudae propter iudicia tua Domine
9 For thou art the most high Lord over all the earth: thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods. 9 tu enim Dominus Excelsus super omnem terram vehementer elevatus es super universos deos
10 You that love the Lord, hate evil: the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints, he will deliver them out of the hand of the sinner. 10 qui diligitis Dominum odite malum custodit animas sanctorum suorum de manu impiorum eruet eos
11 Light is risen to the just, and joy to the right of heart. 11 lux orta est iusto et rectis corde laetitia
12 Rejoice, ye just, in the Lord: and give praise to the remembrance of his holiness. 12 laetamini iusti in Domino et confitemini memoriae sanctae eius

Chapter 97

Cantate Domino. All are again invited to praise the Lord, for the victories of Christ.

1 A psalm for David himself. Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: because he hath done wonderful things. His right hand hath wrought for him salvation, and his arm is holy. 1 canticum cantate Domino canticum novum quia mirabilia fecit salvavit sibi dextera eius et brachium sanctum eius
2 The Lord hath made known his salvation: he hath revealed his justice in the sight of the Gentiles. 2 notum fecit Dominus salutare suum in conspectu gentium revelavit iustitiam suam
3 He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God. 3 recordatus est misericordiae suae et veritatis suae domui Iacob viderunt omnes fines terrae salutare Dei nostri
4 Sing joyfully to God, all the earth; make melody, rejoice and sing. 4 iubilate Domino omnis terra vociferamini et laudate et canite
5 Sing praise to the Lord on the harp, on the harp, and with the voice of a psalm: 5 cantate Domino in cithara in cithara et voce carminis
6 With long trumpets, and sound of cornet. Make a joyful noise before the Lord our king: 6 in tubis et clangore bucinae iubilate coram rege Domino
7 Let the sea be moved and the fullness thereof: the world and they that dwell therein. 7 tonet mare et plenitudo eius orbis et habitatores eius
8 The rivers shall clap their hands, the mountains shall rejoice together 8 flumina plaudent manu simul montes laudabunt
9 At the presence of the Lord: because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice, and the people with equity. 9 ante Dominum quia venit iudicare terram iudicabit orbem in iustitia et populos in aequitatibus

Chapter 98

Dominus regnavit. The reign of the Lord in Sion: that is, of Christ in his church.

1 A psalm for David himself. The Lord hath reigned, let the people be angry: he that sitteth on the cherubims: let the earth be moved. 1 Dominus regnavit commoveantur populi sessor cherubin concutiatur terra
2 The lord is great in Sion, and high above all people. 2 Dominus in Sion magnus et excelsus est super omnes populos
3 Let them give praise to thy great name: for it is terrible and holy: 3 confiteantur nomini tuo magno et terribili sanctoque
4 And the king's honour loveth judgment. Thou hast prepared directions: thou hast done judgment and justice in Jacob. 4 imperium regis iudicium diligit tu fundasti aequitates iudicium et iustitiam in Iacob tu fecisti
5 Exalt ye the Lord our God, and adore his footstool, for it is holy. 5 exaltate Dominum Deum nostrum et adorate scabillum pedum eius quia sanctus est
6 Moses and Aaron among his priests: and Samuel among them that call upon his name. They called upon the Lord, and he heard them: 6 Moses et Aaron in sacerdotibus eius et Samuhel in his qui invocant nomen eius invocabant Dominum et ipse exaudivit eos
7 He spoke to them in the pillar of the cloud. They kept his testimonies, and the commandment which he gave them. 7 in columna nubis loquebatur ad eos custodierunt testimonia eius et praeceptum dedit eis
8 Thou didst hear them, O Lord our God: thou wast a merciful God to them, and taking vengeance on all their inventions. 8 Domine Deus noster tu exaudisti eos Domine propitius fuisti eis et ultor super commutationibus eorum
9 Exalt ye the Lord our God, and adore at his holy mountain: for the Lord our God is holy. 9 exaltate Dominum Deum nostrum et adorate in monte sancto eius quia sanctus Dominus Deus noster

Chapter 99

Jubilate Deo. All are invited to rejoice in God the creator of all.

1 A psalm of praise. 1 canticum in gratiarum actione
2 Sing joyfully to God, all the earth: serve ye the Lord with gladness. Come in before his presence with exceeding great joy. 2 iubilate Domino omnis terra servite Domino in laetitia ingredimini coram eo in laude
3 Know ye that the Lord he is God: he made us, and not we ourselves. We are his people and the sheep of his pasture. 3 scitote quoniam Dominus ipse est Deus ipse fecit nos et ipsius sumus populus eius et grex pascuae eius
4 Go ye into his gates with praise, into his courts with hymns: and give glory to him. Praise ye his name: 4 ingredimini portas eius in gratiarum actione atria eius in laude confitemini ei benedicite nomini eius
5 For the Lord is sweet, his mercy endureth for ever, and his truth to generation and generation. 5 quia bonus Dominus in sempiternum misericordia eius et usque ad generationem et generationem fides eius

Chapter 100

Misericordiam et judicium. The prophet exhorteth all by his example, to follow mercy and justice.

1 A psalm for David himself. Mercy and judgment I will sing to thee, O Lord: I will sing, 1 David canticum misericordiam et iudicium cantabo tibi Domine psallam
2 And I will understand in the unspotted way, when thou shalt come to me. I walked in the innocence of my heart, in the midst of my house. 2 erudiar in via perfecta quando venies ad me ambulabo in simplicitate cordis mei in medio domus meae
3 I will not set before my eyes any unjust thing: I hated the workers of iniquities. 3 non ponam coram oculis meis verbum Belial facientem declinationes odivi nec adhesit mihi
4 The perverse heart did not cleave to me: and the malignant, that turned aside from me, I would not know. 4 cor pravum recedet a me malum nesciam
5 The man that in private detracted his neighbour, him did I persecute. With him that had a proud eye, and an unsatiable heart, I would not eat. 5 loquentem in abscondito contra proximum suum hunc interficiam superbum oculis et altum corde cum hoc esse non potero
6 My eyes were upon the faithful of the earth, to sit with me: the man that walked in the perfect way, he served me. 6 oculi mei ad fideles terrae ut habitent mecum ambulans in via simpliciter hic ministrabit mihi
7 He that worketh pride shall not dwell in the midst of my house: he that speaketh unjust things did not prosper before my eyes. 7 non habitabit in medio domus meae faciens dolum loquens mendacium non placebit in conspectu oculorum meorum
8 In the morning I put to death all the wicked of the land: that I might cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the Lord. 8 mane perdam omnes impios terrae ut interficiam de civitate Domini universos qui operantur iniquitatem

Chapter 101

Domine, exaudi. A prayer for one in affliction: the fifth penitential psalm.

1 The prayer of the poor man, when he was anxious, and poured out his supplication before the Lord. 1 oratio pauperis quando sollicitus fuerit et coram Domino fuderit eloquium suum
2 Hear, O Lord, my prayer: and let my cry come to thee. 2 Domine audi orationem meam et clamor meus ad te veniat
3 Turn not away thy face from me: in the day when I am in trouble, incline thy ear to me. In what day soever I shall call upon thee, hear me speedily. 3 ne abscondas faciem tuam a me in die tribulationis meae inclina ad me aurem tuam in quacumque die invocavero velociter exaudi me
4 For my days are vanished like smoke, and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire. 4 quoniam consumpti sunt sicut fumus dies mei et ossa mea quasi frixa contabuerunt
5 I am smitten as grass, and my heart is withered: because I forgot to eat my bread. 5 percussum est quasi faenum et arefactum est cor meum quia oblitus sum comedere panem meum
6 Through the voice of my groaning, my bone hath cleaved to my flesh. 6 a voce gemitus mei adhesit os meum carni meae
7 I am become like to a pelican of the wilderness: I am like a night raven in the house. 7 adsimilatus sum pelicano deserti factus sum quasi bubo solitudinum
8 I have watched, and am become as a sparrow all alone on the housetop. 8 vigilavi et fui sicut avis solitaria super tectum
9 All the day long my enemies reproached me: and they that praised me did swear against me. 9 tota die exprobrabant mihi inimici mei exultantes per me iurabant
10 For I did eat ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping. 10 quia cinerem sicut panem comedi et potum meum cum fletu miscui
11 Because of thy anger and indignation: for having lifted me up thou hast thrown me down. 11 a facie indignationis et irae tuae quia elevasti me et adlisisti me
12 My days have declined like a shadow, and I am withered like grass. 12 dies mei quasi umbra inclinati sunt et ego quasi faenum arui
13 But thou, O Lord, endurest for ever: and thy memorial to all generations. 13 tu autem Domine in aeternum permanes memoriale tuum in generatione et generatione
14 Thou shalt arise and have mercy on Sion: for it is time to have mercy on it, for the time is come. 14 tu suscitans misereberis Sion quia tempus est ut miserearis eius quoniam venit tempus quoniam venit pactum
15 For the stones thereof have pleased thy servants: and they shall have pity on the earth thereof. 15 quoniam placitos fecerunt servi tui lapides eius et pulverem eius miserabilem
16 All the Gentiles shall fear thy name, O Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory. 16 et timebunt gentes nomen Domini et universi reges terrae gloriam tuam
17 For the Lord hath built up Sion: and he shall be seen in his glory. 17 quia aedificavit Dominus Sion apparuit in gloria sua
18 He hath had regard to the prayer of the humble: and he hath not despised their petition. 18 respexit ad orationem vacui et non dispexit orationem eorum
19 Let these things be written unto another generation: and the people that shall be created shall praise the Lord: 19 scribatur hoc in generatione novissima et populus qui creabitur laudabit Dominum
20 Because he hath looked forth from his high sanctuary: from heaven the Lord hath looked upon the earth. 20 quoniam prospexit de excelso sanctuario suo Dominus de caelo terram contemplatus est
21 That he might hear the groans of them that are in fetters: that he might release the children of the slain: 21 ut audiret gemitum vincti ut solveret filios mortis
22 That they may declare the name of the Lord in Sion: and his praise in Jerusalem; 22 ut narretur in Sion nomen Domini et laudatio eius in Hierusalem
23 When the people assemble together, and kings, to serve the Lord. 23 cum congregati fuerint populi simul et regna ut serviant Domino
24 He answered him in the way of his strength: Declare unto me the fewness of my days. 24 adflixit in via fortitudinem meam adbreviavit dies meos
25 Call me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are unto generation and generation. 25 dicam Deus meus ne rapias me in dimidio dierum meorum in generatione generationum anni tui
26 In the beginning, O Lord, thou foundedst the earth: and the heavens are the works of thy hands. 26 a principio terram fundasti et opus manuum tuarum caeli
27 They shall perish but thou remainest: and all of them shall grow old like a garment: And as a vesture thou shalt change them, and they shall be changed. 27 ipsi peribunt tu autem stabis et omnes quasi vestimentum adterentur et quasi pallium mutabis illos et mutabuntur
28 But thou art always the selfsame, and thy years shall not fail. 28 tu autem ipse es et anni tui non deficient
29 The children of thy servants shall continue and their seed shall be directed for ever. 29 filii servorum tuorum habitabunt et semen eorum ante faciem eorum perseverabit

Chapter 102

Benedic, anima. Thanksgiving to God for his mercies.

1 For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: and let all that is within me bless his holy name. 1 David benedic anima mea Domino et omnia viscera mea nomini sancto eius
2 Bless the Lord, O my soul, and never forget all he hath done for thee. 2 benedic anima mea Domino et noli oblivisci omnium retributionum eius
3 Who forgiveth all thy iniquities: who healeth all thy diseases. 3 qui propitiatur cunctis iniquitatibus tuis et sanat omnes infirmitates tuas
4 Who redeemeth thy life from destruction: who crowneth thee with mercy and compassion. 4 qui redimit de corruptione vitam tuam et coronat te misericordia et miserationibus
5 Who satisfieth thy desire with good things: thy youth shall be renewed like the eagle's. 5 qui replet bonis ornamentum tuum innovabitur sicut aquilae iuventus tua
6 The Lord doth mercies, and judgment for all that suffer wrong. 6 faciens iustitias Dominus et iudicia cunctis qui calumniam sustinent
7 He hath made his ways known to Moses: his wills to the children of Israel. 7 notas fecit vias suas Mosi filiis Israhel cogitationes suas
8 The Lord is compassionate and merciful: longsuffering and plenteous in mercy. 8 misericors et clemens Dominus patiens et multae miserationis
9 He will not always be angry: nor will he threaten for ever. 9 non in sempiternum iudicabit neque in aeternum irascetur
10 He hath not dealt with us according to our sins: nor rewarded us according to our iniquities. 10 non secundum peccata nostra fecit nobis neque secundum iniquitates nostras retribuit nobis
11 For according to the height of the heaven above the earth: he hath strengthened his mercy towards them that fear him. 11 quantum enim excelsius est caelum terra tantum confortata est misericordia eius super timentes eum
12 As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our iniquities from us. 12 quantum longe est oriens ab occidente tantum longe fecit a nobis scelera nostra
13 As a father hath compassion on his children, so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him: 13 sicut miseretur pater filiorum misertus est Dominus timentibus se
14 For he knoweth our frame. He remembereth that we are dust: 14 ipse enim novit plasmationem nostram recordatus est quia pulvis sumus
15 Man's days are as grass, as the flower of the field so shall he flourish. 15 homo quasi herba dies eius sicut flos agri sic florebit
16 For the spirit shall pass in him, and he shall not be: and he shall know his place no more. 16 quia spiritus pertransiit eum et non subsistet et non cognoscet eum ultra locus eius
17 But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity and unto eternity upon them that fear him: And his justice unto children's children, 17 misericordia autem Domini ab aeterno et usque in aeternum super timentes eum et iustitia eius in filios filiorum
18 To such as keep his covenant, And are mindful of his commandments to do them. 18 his qui custodiunt pactum eius et recordantur praeceptorum eius ad facienda ea
19 The lord hath prepared his throne in heaven: and his kingdom shall rule over all. 19 Dominus in caelo stabilivit thronum suum et regnum illius omnium dominatur
20 Bless the Lord, all ye his angels: you that are mighty in strength, and execute his word, hearkening to the voice of his orders. 20 benedicite Domino angeli eius fortes robore facientes verbum eius oboedientes voci sermonis eius
21 Bless the Lord, all ye his hosts: you ministers of his that do his will. 21 benedicite Domino omnes exercitus eius ministri eius qui facitis placitum illius
22 Bless the Lord, all his works: in every place of his dominion, O my soul, bless thou the Lord. 22 benedicite Domino universa opera eius in omnibus locis potestatis eius benedic anima mea Domino

Chapter 103

Benedic, anima. God is to be praised for his mighty works, and wonderful providence.

1 For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: O Lord my God, thou art exceedingly great. Thou hast put on praise and beauty: 1 benedic anima mea Domino Domine Deus meus magnificatus es nimis gloria et decore indutus es
2 And art clothed with light as with a garment. Who stretchest out the heaven like a pavilion: 2 amictus luce quasi vestimento extendens caelos ut pellem
3 Who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water. Who makest the clouds thy chariot: who walkest upon the wings of the winds. 3 qui tegis aquis cenacula eius qui ponis nubes currum tuum qui ambulas super pinnas venti
4 Who makest thy angels spirits: and thy ministers a burning fire. 4 qui facis angelos tuos spiritus ministros tuos ignem urentem
5 Who hast founded the earth upon its own bases: it shall not be moved for ever and ever. 5 qui fundasti terram super basem suam non commovebitur in saeculum et in saeculum
6 The deep like a garment is its clothing: above the mountains shall the waters stand. 6 abysso quasi vestimento operuisti eam super montes stabunt aquae
7 At thy rebuke they shall flee: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear. 7 ab increpatione tua fugient a voce tonitrui tui formidabunt
8 The mountains ascend, and the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them. 8 ascendent montes et descendent campi ad locum quem fundasti eis
9 Thou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over; neither shall they return to cover the earth. 9 terminum posuisti quem non pertransibunt nec revertentur ut operiant terram
10 Thou sendest forth springs in the vales: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass. 10 qui emittis fontes in convallibus ut inter medios montes fluant
11 All the beasts of the field shall drink: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst. 11 ut bibant omnia animalia regionum et reficiat onager sitim suam
12 Over them the birds of the air shall dwell: from the midst of the rocks they shall give forth their voices. 12 super ea volucres caeli morabuntur de medio nemorum dabunt vocem
13 Thou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works: 13 qui inrigas montes de cenaculis tuis de fructu operum tuorum implebitur terra
14 Bringing forth grass for cattle, and herb for the service of men. That thou mayst bring bread out of the earth: 14 germinans herbam iumentis et faenum servituti hominum ut educat panem de terra
15 And that wine may cheer the heart of man. That he may make the face cheerful with oil: and that bread may strengthen man's heart. 15 et vinum laetificat cor hominis ad exhilarandam faciem oleo panis autem cor hominis roborat
16 The trees of the field shall be filled, and the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted: 16 saturabuntur ligna Domini cedri Libani quas plantasti
17 There the sparrows shall make their nests. The highest of them is the house of the heron. 17 ibi aves nidificabunt milvo abies domus eius
18 The high hills are a refuge for the harts, the rock for the irchins. 18 montes excelsi cervis petra refugium ericiis
19 He hath made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down. 19 fecit lunam per tempora sol cognovit occubitum suum
20 Thou hast appointed darkness, and it is night: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about: 20 posuisti tenebras et facta est nox in ipsa moventur omnes bestiae silvae
21 The young lions roaring after their prey, and seeking their meat from God. 21 leones rugientes ad praedam et quaerentes a Deo escam sibi
22 The sun ariseth, and they are gathered together: and they shall lie down in their dens. 22 oriente sole recedent et in speluncis suis cubabunt
23 Man shall go forth to his work, and to his labour until the evening. 23 egreditur homo ad opus suum et ad servitutem suam usque ad vesperam
24 How great are thy works, O Lord ? thou hast made all things in wisdom: the earth is filled with thy riches. 24 quam multa sunt opera tua Domine omnia in sapientia fecisti impleta est terra possessione tua
25 So is this great sea, which stretcheth wide its arms: there are creeping things without number: Creatures little and great. 25 hoc mare magnum et latum manibus ibi reptilia innumerabilia animalia parva cum grandibus
26 There the ships shall go. This sea dragon which thou hast formed to play therein. 26 ibi naves pertranseunt Leviathan istum plasmasti ut inluderet ei
27 All expect of thee that thou give them food in season. 27 omnia in te sperant ut des cibum eis in tempore suo
28 What thou givest to them they shall gather up: when thou openest thy hand, they shall all be filled with good. 28 dante te illis colligent aperiente manum tuam replebuntur bono
29 But if thou turnest away thy face, they shall be troubled: thou shalt take away their breath, and they shall fail, and shall return to their dust. 29 abscondes vultum tuum et turbabuntur auferes spiritum eorum et deficient et in pulverem suum revertentur
30 Thou shalt send forth thy spirit, and they shall be created: and thou shalt renew the face of the earth. 30 emittes spiritum tuum et creabuntur et instaurabis faciem terrae
31 May the glory of the Lord endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works. 31 sit gloria Domini in sempiternum laetabitur Dominus in operibus suis
32 He looketh upon the earth, and maketh it tremble: he troubleth the mountains, and they smoke. 32 qui respicit terram et tremet tangit montes et fumabunt
33 I will sing to the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being. 33 cantabo Domino in vita mea psallam Deo quamdiu sum
34 Let my speech be acceptable to him: but I will take delight in the Lord. 34 placeat ei eloquium meum ego autem laetabor in Domino
35 Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, and the unjust, so that they be no more: O my soul, bless thou the Lord. 35 deficiant peccatores de terra et impii ultra non sint benedic anima mea Domino

Chapter 104

Confitemini Domino. A thanksgiving to God for his benefits to his people Israel. Alleluia.

1 Give glory to the Lord, and call upon his name: declare his deeds among the Gentiles. 1 alleluia confitemini Domino invocate nomen eius notas facite populis cogitationes eius
2 Sing to him, yea sing praises to him: relate all his wondrous works. 2 canite ei et psallite illi loquimini in universis mirabilibus eius
3 Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord. 3 exultate in nomine sancto eius laetetur cor quaerentium Dominum
4 Seek ye the lord, and be strengthened: seek his face evermore. 4 quaerite Dominum et virtutem eius quaerite faciem eius iugiter
5 Remember his marvellous works which he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth. 5 recordamini mirabilium eius quae fecit signorum et iudiciorum oris eius
6 O ye seed of Abraham his servant; ye sons of Jacob his chosen. 6 semen Abraham servi eius filii Iacob electi eius
7 He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth. 7 ipse Dominus Deus noster in universa terra iudicia eius
8 He hath remembered his covenant for ever: the word which he commanded to a thousand generations. 8 recordatus est in aeternum pacti sui verbi quod praecepit in mille generationes
9 Which he made to Abraham; and his oath to Isaac: 9 quod pepigit cum Abraham et iuramenti sui cum Isaac
10 And he appointed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting testament: 10 et firmavit illud cum Iacob in lege cum Israhel pactum sempiternum
11 Saying: To thee will I give the land of Chanaan, the lot of your inheritance. 11 dicens tibi dabo terram Chanaan funiculum hereditatis vestrae
12 When they were but a small number: yea very few, and sojourners therein: 12 cum essent viri pauci modici et advenae in ea
13 And they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people. 13 et transierunt de gente in gentem de regno ad populum alterum
14 He suffered no man to hurt them: and he reproved kings for their sakes. 14 non dimisit hominem ut noceret eis et corripuit pro eis reges
15 Touch ye not my anointed: and do no evil to my prophets. 15 nolite tangere christos meos et prophetas meos nolite adfligere
