16 And he called a famine upon the land: and he broke in pieces all the support of bread. 16 et vocavit famem super terram omnem virgam panis contrivit
17 He sent a man before them: Joseph, who was sold for a slave. 17 misit ante faciem eorum virum in servum venundatus est Ioseph
18 They humbled his feet in fetters: the iron pierced his soul, 18 adflixerunt in conpede pedes eius in ferrum venit anima eius
19 Until his word came. The word of the Lord inflamed him. 19 usque ad tempus donec veniret sermo eius eloquium Domini probavit eum
20 The king sent, and he released him: the ruler of the people, and he set him at liberty. 20 misit rex et solvit eum princeps populorum et dimisit illum
21 He made him master of his house, and ruler of all his possession. 21 posuit eum dominum domus suae et principem in omni possessione sua
22 That he might instruct his princes as himself, and teach his ancients wisdom. 22 ut erudiret principes eius secundum voluntatem suam et senes eius sapientiam doceret
23 And Israel went into Egypt: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham. 23 et ingressus est Israhel Aegyptum et Iacob advena fuit in terra Ham
24 And he increased his people exceedingly: and strengthened them over their enemies. 24 et crescere fecit populum suum nimis et roboravit eum super hostes eius
25 He turned their heart to hate his people: and to deal deceitfully with his servants. 25 convertit cor eorum ut odio haberent populum eius ut dolose agerent contra servos illius
26 He sent Moses his servant: Aaron the man whom he had chosen. 26 misit Mosen servum suum Aaron quem elegit sibi
27 He gave them power to shew them signs, and his wonders in the land of Cham. 27 posuit in eis verba signorum suorum et portentorum in terra Ham
28 He sent darkness, and made it obscure: and grieved not his words. 28 misit tenebras et contenebravit et non fuerunt increduli verbis eius
29 He turned their waters into blood, and destroyed their fish. 29 commutavit aquas eorum in sanguinem et occidit pisces eorum
30 Their land brought forth frogs, in the inner chambers of their kings. 30 ebullivit terra eorum ranas in cubiculis regum eorum
31 He spoke, and there came divers sorts of flies and sciniphs in all their coasts. 31 dixit et venit musca omnimoda scinifes in universis terminis eorum
32 He gave them hail for rain, a burning fire in the land. 32 dedit pluvias eorum grandinem ignem flammantem in terra eorum
33 And he destroyed their vineyards and their fig trees: and he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts. 33 et percussit vineam eorum et ficum eorum et confregit lignum finium eorum
34 He spoke, and the locust came, and the bruchus, of which there was no number. 34 dixit et venit lucusta et bruchus cuius non erat numerus
35 And they devoured all the grass in their land, and consumed all the fruit of their ground. 35 et comedit omne faenum terrae eorum et devoravit fructum terrae eorum
36 And he slew all the firstborn in their land: the firstfruits of all their labour. 36 et percussit omne primogenitum in terra eorum primitias universi partus eorum
37 And he brought them out with silver and gold: and there was not among their tribes one that was feeble. 37 et eduxit eos cum argento et auro et non erat in tribubus eorum infirmus
38 Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them lay upon them. 38 laetata est Aegyptus cum egrederentur quoniam inruerat terror eorum super eos
39 He spread a cloud for their protection, and fire to give them light in the night. 39 expandit nubem in tentorium et ignem ut luceret nocte
40 They asked, and the quail came: and he filled them with the bread of heaven. 40 petierunt et adduxit ortygometran et pane caelesti saturavit eos
41 He opened the rock, and waters flowed: rivers ran down in the dry land. 41 aperuit petram et fluxerunt aquae cucurrerunt in aridis flumina
42 Because he remembered his holy word, which he had spoken to his servant Abraham. 42 quia recordatus est verbi sancti sui cum Abraham servo suo
43 And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness. 43 et eduxit populum suum in laetitia laudantes electos suos
44 And he gave them the lands of the Gentiles: and they possessed the labours of the people: 44 et dedit eis terras gentium et laborem tribuum possederunt
45 That they might observe his justifications, and seek after his law. 45 ut custodirent caerimonias eius et leges eius servarent alleluia

Chapter 105

Confitemini Domino. A confession of the manifold sins and ingratitudes of the Israelites. Alleluia.

1 Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. 1 alleluia confitemini Domino quoniam bonus quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
2 Who shall declare the powers of the Lord? who shall set forth all his praises? 2 quis loquetur fortitudines Domini auditas faciet omnes laudes eius
3 Blessed are they that keep judgment, and do justice at all times. 3 beati qui custodiunt iudicium et faciunt iustitiam in omni tempore
4 Remember us, O Lord, in the favour of thy people: visit us with thy salvation. 4 recordare mei Domine in repropitiatione populi tui visita me in salutari tuo
5 That we may see the good of thy chosen, that we may rejoice in the joy of thy nation: that thou mayst be praised with thy inheritance. 5 ut videam bona electorum tuorum et laeter in laetitia gentis tuae et exultem cum hereditate tua
6 We have sinned with our fathers: we have acted unjustly, we have wrought iniquity. 6 peccavimus cum patribus nostris inique fecimus impie egimus
7 Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt: they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies: And they provoked to wrath going up to the sea, even the Red Sea. 7 patres nostri in Aegypto non intellexerunt mirabilia tua non sunt recordati multitudinis misericordiae tuae et ad iracundiam provocaverunt super mare in mari Rubro
8 And he saved them for his own name's sake: that he might make his power known. 8 salvavit autem eos propter nomen suum ut ostenderet fortitudinem suam
9 And he rebuked the Red Sea and it was dried up: and he led them through the depths, as in a wilderness. 9 et comminatus est mari Rubro et aruit et transduxit eos per abyssos quasi in deserto
10 And he saved them from the hand of them that hated them: and he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy. 10 et salvavit eos de manu odientis et redemit eos de manu inimici
11 And the water covered them that afflicted them: there was not one of them left. 11 et operuit aqua hostes eorum unus de ipsis non superfuit
12 And they believed his words: and they sang his praises. 12 et crediderunt verbis eius cecineruntque laudem eius
13 They had quickly done, they forgot his works: and they waited not for his counsel. 13 cito obliti sunt operum illius nec expectaverunt voluntatem eius
14 And they coveted their desire in the desert: and they tempted God in the place without water. 14 et desideraverunt desiderium in deserto et temptaverunt Deum in solitudine
15 And he gave them their request: and sent fulness into their souls. 15 dedit ergo eis petitionem eorum et misit tenuitatem in animam eorum
16 And they provoked Moses in the camp, Aaron the holy one of the Lord. 16 et zelati sunt Mosen in castris Aaron sanctum Domini
17 The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan: and covered the congregation of Abiron. 17 aperta est terra et devoravit Dathan et operuit synagogam Abiram
18 And a fire was kindled in their congregation: the flame burned the wicked. 18 et succensus est ignis in synagoga eorum flamma exusit impios
19 They made also a calf in Horeb: and they adored the graven thing. 19 fecerunt vitulum in Horeb et adoraverunt conflatile
20 And they changed their glory into the likeness of a calf that eateth grass. 20 et mutaverunt gloriam suam in similitudine bovis comedentis faenum
21 They forgot God, who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt, 21 obliti sunt Dei salvatoris sui qui fecit magnalia in Aegypto
22 Wondrous works in the land of Cham: terrible things in the Red Sea. 22 mirabilia in terra Ham terribilia super mare Rubrum
23 And he said that he would destroy them: had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach: To turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them. 23 dixit ergo ut contereret eos nisi Moses electus eius stetisset medius contra faciem illius ut converteret indignationem eius et non interficeret
24 And they set at nought the desirable land. They believed not his word, 24 et dispexerunt terram desiderabilem nec crediderunt sermoni eius
25 And they murmured in their tents: they hearkened not to the voice of the Lord. 25 et murmuraverunt in tabernaculis suis non audierunt vocem Domini
26 And he lifted up his hand over them: to overthrow them in the desert; 26 et levavit manum suam super eos ut deiceret eos in deserto
27 And to cast down their seed among the nations, and to scatter them in the countries. 27 et ut deiceret semen eorum in gentibus et dispergeret eos in terris
28 They also were initiated to Beelphegor: and ate the sacrifices of the dead. 28 et consecrati sunt Beelphegor et comederunt victimas mortuorum
29 And they provoked him with their inventions: and destruction was multiplied among them. 29 et concitaverunt eum in studiis suis et percussit eos plaga
30 Then Phinees stood up, and pacified him: and the slaughter ceased. 30 stetit autem Finees et deiudicavit et est retenta percussio
31 And it was reputed to him unto justice, to generation and generation for evermore. 31 et reputatum est ei in iustitia in generatione et generatione usque in aeternum
32 They provoked him also at the waters of contradiction: and Moses was afflicted for their sakes: 32 et provocaverunt super aquam Contradictionis et adflictus est Moses propter eos
33 Because they exasperated his spirit. And he distinguished with his lips. 33 quia provocaverunt spiritum eius et praecepit labiis suis
34 They did not destroy the nations of which the Lord spoke unto them. 34 non exterminaverunt populos quos dixit Dominus eis
35 And they were mingled among the heathens, and learned their works: 35 et commixti sunt gentibus et didicerunt opera eorum
36 And served their idols, and it became a stumblingblock to them. 36 et servierunt sculptilibus eorum et factum est eis in scandalum
37 And they sacrificed their sons, and their daughters to devils. 37 et immolaverunt filios suos et filias suas daemonibus
38 And they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons and of their daughters which they sacrificed to the idols of Chanaan. And the land was polluted with blood, 38 et effuderunt sanguinem innocentem sanguinem filiorum suorum et filiarum suarum quos immolaverunt sculptilibus Chanaan et polluta est terra sanguinibus
39 And was defiled with their works: and they went aside after their own inventions. 39 et coinquinati sunt in operibus suis et fornicati sunt in studiis suis
40 And the Lord was exceedingly angry with his people: and he abhorred his inheritance. 40 iratus est itaque furor Domini in populum suum et abominatus est hereditatem suam
41 And he delivered them into the hands of the nations: and they that hated them had dominion over them. 41 et dedit eos in manu gentium et dominati sunt eorum qui oderant eos
42 And their enemies afflicted them: and they were humbled under their hands: 42 et adflixerunt eos inimici sui et humiliati sunt sub manu eorum
43 Many times did he deliver them. But they provoked him with their counsel: and they were brought low by their iniquities. 43 multis vicibus liberavit eos ipsi vero provocabant in consiliis suis et humiliati sunt propter iniquitates suas
44 And he saw when they were in tribulation: and he heard their prayer. 44 et vidit tribulationem eorum cum audiret eos rogantes
45 And he was mindful of his covenant: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies. 45 et recordatus est pacti sui cum eis et paenituit eum secundum multitudinem misericordiae suae
46 And he gave them unto mercies, in the sight of all those that had made them captives. 46 et dedit eos miserabiles coram omnibus qui ceperant eos
47 Save us, O Lord, our God: and gather us from among the nations: That we may give thanks to thy holy name, and may glory in thy praise. 47 salva nos Domine Deus noster et congrega nos de gentibus ut confiteamur nomini sancto tuo et canamus laudantes te
48 Blessed be the Lord the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say: So be it, so be it. 48 benedictus Dominus Deus Israhel ab aeterno et usque in aeternum et dicet omnis populus amen alleluia

Chapter 106

Confitemini Domino. All are invited to give thanks to God for his perpetual providence over men. Alleluia.

1 Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. 1 confitemini Domino quoniam bonus quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
2 Let them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy: and gathered out of the countries. 2 dicant qui redempti sunt a Domino quos redemit de manu hostis et de terris congregavit eos
3 From the rising and from the setting of the sun, from the north and from the sea. 3 ab oriente et ab occidente ab aquilone et mari
4 They wandered in a wilderness, in a place without water: they found not the way of a city for their habitation. 4 erraverunt in solitudine in deserta via civitatem quae habitaretur non reppererunt
5 They were hungry and thirsty: their soul fainted in them. 5 esurientes et sitientes anima eorum in ipsis deficiebat
6 And they cried to the Lord in their tribulation: and he delivered them out of their distresses. 6 et clamaverunt ad Dominum in tribulatione sua de adflictione eorum eripuit eos
7 And he led them into the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation. 7 et duxit illos per viam rectam ut venirent in civitatem habitabilem
8 Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men. 8 confiteantur Domino misericordiam eius et mirabilia eius in filios hominum
9 For he hath satisfied the empty soul, and hath filled the hungry soul with good things. 9 quia saturavit animam vacuam et animam esurientem implevit bonis
10 Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death: bound in want and in iron. 10 habitantes in tenebris et umbra mortis alligatos inopia et ferro
11 Because they had exasperated the words of God: and provoked the counsel of the most High: 11 quia provocaverunt sermones Dei et consilium Excelsi blasphemaverunt
12 And their heart was humbled with labours: they were weakened, and there was none to help them. 12 et humiliavit in labore cor eorum ceciderunt et non erat qui adiuvaret
13 Then they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses. 13 et clamaverunt ad Dominum in tribulatione sua et de angustiis eorum salvavit eos
14 And he brought them out of darkness, and the shadow of death; and broke their bonds in sunder. 14 et eduxit eos de tenebris et umbra mortis et vincula eorum disrupit
15 Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men. 15 confiteantur Domino misericordiam eius et mirabilia eius in filios hominum
16 Because he hath broken gates of brass, and burst iron bars. 16 quia contrivit portas aereas et vectes ferreos confregit
17 He took them out of the way of their iniquity: for they were brought low for their injustices. 17 stultos propter viam sceleris eorum et propter iniquitates adflictos
18 Their soul abhorred all manner of meat: and they drew nigh even to the gates of death. 18 omnem cibum abominata est anima eorum et accesserunt ad portas mortis
19 And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses. 19 et clamaverunt ad Dominum in tribulatione sua de angustiis eorum salvavit eos
20 He sent his word, and healed them: and delivered them from their destructions. 20 misit verbum suum et sanavit eos et salvavit de interitu
21 Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men. 21 confiteantur Domino misericordiam eius et mirabilia eius in filios hominum
22 And let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise: and declare his works with joy. 22 et immolent hostias gratiarum et narrent opera eius in laude
23 They that go down to the sea in ships, doing business in the great waters: 23 qui descendunt in mare navibus facientes opus in aquis multis
24 These have seen the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep. 24 ipsi viderunt opera Domini et mirabilia eius in profundo
25 He said the word, and there arose a storm of wind: and the waves thereof were lifted up. 25 dixit et surrexit ventus tempestatis et elevavit gurgites eius
26 They mount up to the heavens, and they go down to the depths: their soul pined away with evils. 26 ascendunt in caelum et descendunt in abyssos anima eorum in adflictione consumitur
27 They were troubled, and reeled like a drunken man; and all their wisdom was swallowed up. 27 obstipuerunt et intremuerunt quasi ebrius et universa sapientia eorum absorta est
28 And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he brought them out of their distresses. 28 clamabunt autem ad Dominum in tribulatione sua et de angustia educet eos
29 And he turned the storm into a breeze: and its waves were still. 29 statuet turbinem in tranquillitatem et silebunt fluctus eius
30 And they rejoiced because they were still: and he brought them to the haven which they wished for. 30 laetabuntur quoniam quieverunt et deducet eos ad portum quem voluerunt
31 Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men. 31 confiteantur Domino misericordiam eius et mirabilia eius in filios hominum
32 And let them exalt him in the church of the people: and praise him in the chair of the ancients. 32 et exaltent eum in ecclesia populi et in cathedra seniorum laudent eum
33 He hath turned rivers into a wilderness: and the sources of waters into dry ground: 33 ponet flumina in desertum et fontes aquarum in sitim
34 A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein. 34 terram fructiferam in salsuginem prae malitia habitatorum eius
35 He hath turned a wilderness into pools of waters, and a dry land into water springs. 35 ponet desertum in paludes aquarum et terram inviam in fontes aquarum
36 And hath placed there the hungry; and they made a city for their habitation. 36 et conlocabit ibi esurientes et fundabunt urbem ad habitandum
37 Anti they sowed fields, and planted vineyards: and they yielded fruit of birth. 37 et serent agros et plantabunt vineas et facient fruges genimina
38 And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly: and their cattle he suffered not to decrease. 38 et benedicet eis et multiplicabuntur nimis et pecora eorum non inminuet
39 Then they were brought to be few: and they were afflicted through the trouble of evils and sorrow. 39 inminuta sunt autem et adflicta propter angustiam mali et doloris
40 Contempt was poured forth upon their princes: and he caused them to wander where there was no passing, and out of the way. 40 et effundet despectionem super principes et errare eos faciet in solitudine devia
41 And he helped the poor out of poverty: and made him families like a flock of sheep. 41 et sublevabit pauperem de inopia et ponet quasi gregem familias
42 The just shall see, and shall rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth. 42 videbunt recti et laetabuntur et omnis iniquitas contrahet os suum
43 Who is wise, and will keep these things; and will understand the mercies of the Lord? 43 quis sapiens et custodiet haec et intellegent misericordias Domini

Chapter 107

Paratum cor meum. The prophet praiseth God for benefits received.

1 A canticle of a psalm for David himself. 1 canticum psalmi David
2 My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready: I will sing, and will give praise, with my glory. 2 paratum cor meum Deus cantabo et psallam sed et gloria mea
3 Arise, my glory; arise, psaltery and harp: I will arise in the morning early. 3 consurge psalterium et cithara consurgam mane
4 I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing unto thee among the nations. 4 confitebor tibi in populis Domine et cantabo te in nationibus
5 For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth even unto the clouds. 5 quoniam magna super caelos misericordia tua et usque ad aethera veritas tua
6 Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory over all the earth: 6 exaltare super caelos Deus et super omnem terram gloria tua
7 That thy beloved may be delivered. Save with thy right hand and hear me. 7 ut liberentur dilecti tui salva dextera tua et exaudi me
8 God hath spoken in his holiness. I will rejoice, and I will divide Sichem and I will mete out the vale of tabernacles. 8 Deus locutus est in sanctuario suo gaudebo dividam Sychem et vallem Socchoth dimetiar
9 Galaad is mine: and Manasses is mine and Ephraim the protection of my head. Juda is my king: 9 meus est Galaad et meus est Manasse et Efraim hereditas capitis mei Iuda dux meus
10 Moab the pot of my hope. Over Edom I will stretch out my shoe: the aliens are become my friends. 10 Moab lebes pelvis meae super Idumeam proiciam calciamentum meum cum Philisthim foederabor
11 Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom? 11 quis deducet me in civitatem munitam quis deducet me usque in Idumeam
12 Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off ? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies? 12 nonne tu Deus qui proieceras nos et non exieras Deus in exercitibus nostris
13 O grant us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man. 13 da nobis auxilium in tribulatione vana est enim salus ab homine
14 Through God we shall do mightily: and he will bring our enemies to nothing. 14 in Deo erimus fortes et ipse conculcabit hostes nostros

Chapter 108

Deus, laudem meam. David in the person of Christ, prayeth against his persecutors; more especially the traitor Judas: foretelling and approving his just punishment for his obstinacy in sin and final impenitence.

1 Unto the end, a psalm for David. 1 pro victoria David canticum
2 O God, be not thou silent in my praise: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful man is opened against me. 2 Deus laudabilis mihi ne taceas quia os impii et os dolosi contra me apertum est
3 They have spoken against me with deceitful tongues; and they have compassed me about with words of hatred; and have fought against me without cause. 3 locuti sunt de me lingua mendacii verbis odii circumdederunt me et expugnaverunt me frustra
4 Instead of making me a return of love, they detracted me: but I gave myself to prayer. 4 pro eo quod eos diligebam adversabantur mihi ego autem orabam
5 And they repaid me evil for good: and hatred for my love. 5 et posuerunt contra me malum pro bono et odium pro dilectione mea
6 Set thou the sinner over him: and may the devil stand at his right hand. 6 constitue super eum impium et Satan astet a dextris eius
7 When he is judged, may he go out condemned; and may his prayer be turned to sin. 7 cum fuerit iudicatus exeat condemnatus et oratio eius sit in peccatum
8 May his days be few: and his bishopric let another take. 8 fiant dies eius parvi episcopatum eius accipiat alter
9 May his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow. 9 sint filii eius pupilli et uxor eius vidua
10 Let his children be carried about vagabonds, and beg; and let them be cast out of their dwellings. 10 instabiles vagentur liberi eius et mendicent et quaerantur in parietinis suis
11 May the usurer search all his substance: and let strangers plunder his labours. 11 scrutetur exactor universa quae habet et diripiant alieni laborem eius
12 May there be none to help him: nor none to pity his fatherless offspring. 12 non sit qui eius misereatur nec qui clemens sit in pupillos eius
13 May his posterity be cut off; in one generation may his name be blotted out. 13 fiat novissimum eius interitus in generatione altera deleatur nomen eius
14 May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered in the sight of the Lord: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out. 14 redeat in memoria iniquitas patrum eius apud Deum et iniquitas matris eius ne deleatur
15 May they be before the Lord continually, and let the memory of them perish from the earth: 15 sit contra Dominum semper et intereat de terra memoria eorum
16 because he remembered not to shew mercy, 16 eo quod non est recordatus facere misericordiam
17 But persecuted the poor man and the beggar; and the broken in heart, to put him to death. 17 et persecutus est virum inopem et pauperem et conpunctum corde ut interficeret
18 And he loved cursing, and it shall come unto him: and he would not have blessing, and it shall be far from him. And he put on cursing, like a garment: and it went in like water into his entrails, and like oil in his bones. 18 et dilexit maledictionem quae veniet ei et noluit benedictionem quae elongabitur ab eo et indutus est maledictione quasi vestimento suo et ingredietur quasi aqua in viscera eius et quasi oleum in ossa eius
19 May it be unto him like a garment which covereth him; and like a girdle with which he is girded continually. 19 sit ei quasi pallium quo circumdatur et quasi cingulum quo semper accingitur
20 This is the work of them who detract me before the Lord; and who speak evils against my soul. 20 haec est retributio his qui adversantur mihi a Domino et qui loquuntur malum contra animam meam
21 But thou, O Lord, do with me for thy name's sake: because thy mercy is sweet. Do thou deliver me, 21 tu autem Deus Domine fac mecum propter nomen tuum quoniam bona est misericordia tua libera me
22 For I am poor and needy, and my heart is troubled within me. 22 quoniam egenus et pauper sum et cor meum vulneratum est intrinsecus
23 I am taken away like the shadow when it declineth: and I am shaken off as locusts. 23 quasi umbra cum inclinatur abductus sum et excussus quasi lucusta
24 My knees are weakened through fasting: and my flesh is changed for oil. 24 genua mea vacillaverunt a ieiunio et caro mea mutata est absque oleo
25 And I am become a reproach to them: they saw me and they shaked their heads. 25 et ego factus sum obprobrium eis videntes me moverunt caput suum
26 Help me, O Lord my God; save me; according to thy mercy. 26 adiuva me Domine Deus meus salva me secundum misericordiam tuam
27 And let them know that this is thy hand: and that thou, O Lord, hast done it. 27 et sciant quoniam manus tua haec tu Domine fecisti eam
28 They will curse and thou wilt bless: let them that rise up against me be confounded: but thy servant shall rejoice. 28 maledicent illi et tu benedices restiterunt et confundentur servus autem tuus laetabitur
29 Let them that detract me be clothed with shame: and let them be covered with their confusion as with a double cloak. 29 induantur adversarii mei confusione et operiantur quasi indumento confusione sua
30 I will give great thanks to the Lord with my mouth: and in the midst of many I will praise him. 30 confitebor Domino vehementer in ore meo et in medio populorum laudabo eum
31 Because he hath stood at the right hand of the poor, to save my soul from persecutors. 31 quoniam stabit a dextris pauperis ut salvet a iudicibus animam eius

Chapter 109

Dixit Dominus. Christ's exaltation and everlasting priesthood.

1 A psalm for David. The Lord said to my Lord: Sit thou at my right hand: Until I make thy enemies thy footstool. 1 David canticum dixit Dominus Domino meo sede a dextris meis donec ponam inimicos tuos scabillum pedum tuorum
2 The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies. 2 virgam fortitudinis tuae emittet Dominus ex Sion dominare in medio inimicorum tuorum
3 With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength: in the brightness of the saints: from the womb before the day star I begot thee. 3 populi tui spontanei erunt in die fortitudinis tuae in montibus sanctis quasi de vulva orietur tibi ros adulescentiae tuae
4 The Lord hath sworn, and he will not repent: Thou art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedech. 4 iuravit Dominus et non paenitebit eum tu es sacerdos in aeternum secundum ordinem Melchisedech
5 The Lord at thy right hand hath broken kings in the day of his wrath. 5 Dominus ad dexteram tuam percussit in die furoris sui reges
6 He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins: he shall crush the heads in the land of many. 6 iudicabit in gentibus implebit valles percutiet caput in terra multa
7 He shall drink of the torrent in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head. 7 de torrente in via bibet propterea exaltabit caput

Chapter 110

Confitebor tibi, Domine. God is to be praised for his graces, and benefits to his church. Alleluia.

1 I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; in the council of the just, and in the congregation. 1 alleluia aleph confitebor Domino in toto corde beth in consilio iustorum et congregatione
2 Great are the works of the Lord: sought out according to all his wills. 2 gimel magna opera Domini deleth exquirenda in cunctis voluntatibus suis
3 His work is praise and magnificence: and his justice continueth for ever and ever. 3 he gloria et decor opus eius vav et iustitia eius perseverans semper
4 He hath made a remembrance of his wonderful works, being a merciful and gracious Lord: 4 zai memoriam fecit mirabilium suorum heth clemens et misericors Dominus
5 He hath given food to them that fear him. He will be mindful for ever of his covenant: 5 teth escam dedit timentibus se ioth memor erit in sempiternum pacti sui
6 He will shew forth to his people the power of his works. 6 caph fortitudinem operum suorum adnuntiabit populo suo
7 That he may give them the inheritance of the Gentiles: the works of his hands are truth and judgment. 7 lameth ut det eis hereditatem gentium mem opus manuum eius veritas et iudicium
8 All his commandments are faithful: confirmed for ever and ever, made in truth and equity. 8 nun fidelia omnia praecepta eius samech firmata in sempiternum iugiter ain facta in veritate et aequitate
9 He hath sent redemption to his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever. Holy and terrible is his name: 9 fe redemptionem misit populo suo sade mandavit in aeternum pactum suum coph sanctum et terribile nomen eius
10 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. A good understanding to all that do it: his praise continueth for ever and ever. 10 res principium sapientiae timor Domini sen doctrina bona cunctis qui faciunt ea thau laus eius perseverans iugiter alleluia

Chapter 111

Beatus vir. The good man is happy. Alleluia, of the returning of Aggeus and Zacharias. Of the returning, etc. . .This is in the Greek and Latin, but not in the Hebrew. It signifies that this psalm was proper to be sung at the time of the return of the people from their captivity; to inculcate to them, how happy they might be, if they would be constant in the service of God.

1 Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord: he shall delight exceedingly in his commandments. 1 aleph beatus vir qui timet Dominum beth in mandatis eius volet nimis
2 His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the righteous shall be blessed. 2 gimel potens in terra erit semen eius deleth generatio iustorum benedicetur
3 Glory and wealth shall be in his house: and his justice remaineth for ever and ever. 3 he substantia et divitiae in domo eius vav et iustitia eius perseverans semper
4 To the righteous a light is risen up in darkness: he is merciful, and compassionate and just. 4 zai ortum est in tenebris lumen iustis heth clemens et misericors et iustus
5 Acceptable is the man that sheweth mercy and lendeth: he shall order his words with judgment: 5 teth bonus vir clemens et fenerans ioth dispensabit verba sua in iudicio
6 Because he shall not be moved for ever. 6 caph quia in aeternum non commovebitur
7 The just shall be in everlasting remembrance: he shall not fear the evil hearing. His heart is ready to hope in the Lord: 7 lameth in memoria sempiterna erit iustus mem ab auditu malo non timebit nun paratum cor eius confidens in Domino
8 His heart is strengthened, he shall not be moved until he look over his enemies. 8 samech firmum cor eius non timebit ain donec aspiciat hostibus suis
9 He hath distributed, he hath given to the poor: his justice remaineth for ever and ever: his horn shall be exalted in glory. 9 phe dispersit dedit pauperibus sade iustitia eius permanet in aeternum coph cornu eius exaltabitur in gloria
10 The wicked shall see, and shall be angry, he shall gnash with his teeth and pine away: the desire of the wicked shall perish. 10 res impius videbit et irascetur sen dentibus suis frendet et tabescet thau desiderium impiorum peribit

Chapter 112

Laudate, pueri. God is to be praised for his regard to the poor and humble. Alleluia.

1 Praise the Lord, ye children: praise ye the name of the Lord. 1 alleluia laudate servi Dominum laudate nomen Domini
2 Blessed be the name of the Lord, from henceforth now and for ever. 2 sit nomen Domini benedictum amodo et usque in aeternum
3 From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, the name of the Lord is worthy of praise. 3 ab ortu solis usque ad occasum eius laudabile nomen Domini
4 The Lord is high above all nations; and his glory above the heavens. 4 excelsus super omnes gentes Dominus super caelum gloria eius
5 Who is as the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high: 5 quis ut Dominus Deus noster qui in excelsis habitans
6 and looketh down on the low things in heaven and in earth? 6 humilia respicit in caelo et in terra
7 Raising up the needy from the earth, and lifting up the poor out of the dunghill: 7 suscitans de terra inopem et de stercore elevat pauperem
8 That he may place him with princes, with the princes of his people. 8 ut eum sedere faciat cum principibus cum principibus populi sui
9 Who maketh a barren woman to dwell in a house, the joyful mother of children. 9 qui conlocat sterilem in domo matrem filiorum laetantem alleluia

Chapter 113

In exitu Israel. God hath shewn his power in delivering his people: idols are vain. The Hebrews divide this into two psalms. Alleluia.

1 When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a barbarous people: 1 cum egrederetur Israhel de Aegypto domus Iacob de populo barbaro
2 Judea was made his sanctuary, Israel his dominion. 2 factus est Iudas in sanctificatione eius Israhel potestas eius
3 The sea saw and fled: Jordan was turned back. 3 mare vidit et fugit Iordanis conversus est retrorsum
4 The mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like the lambs of the flock. 4 montes subsilierunt quasi arietes colles quasi filii gregis
5 What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou didst flee: and thou, O Jordan, that thou wast turned back? 5 quid tibi est mare quia fugisti Iordanis quia conversus es retrorsum
6 Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams, and ye hills, like lambs of the flock? 6 montes sussultastis quasi arietes colles quasi filii gregis
7 At the presence of the Lord the earth was moved, at the presence of the God of Jacob: 7 a facie Domini contremesce terra a facie Dei Iacob
8 Who turned the rock into pools of water, and the stony hill into fountains of waters. 8 qui convertit petram in paludes aquarum silicem in fontes aquarum
1 Not to us, O Lord, not to us; but to thy name give glory. 9 non nobis Domine non nobis sed nomini tuo da gloriam
2 For thy mercy, and for thy truth's sake: lest the Gentiles should say: Where is their God? 10 propter misericordiam tuam et veritatem tuam ne dicant gentes ubi est Deus eorum
3 But our God is in heaven: he hath done all things whatsoever he would. 11 Deus autem noster in caelo universa quae voluit fecit
4 The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the works of the hands of men. 12 idola gentium argentum et aurum opus manuum hominum
5 They have mouths and speak not: they have eyes and see not. 13 os habent et non loquentur oculos habent et non videbunt
6 They have ears and hear not: they have noses and smell not. 14 aures habent et non audient nasum habent et non odorabuntur
7 They have hands and feel not: they have feet and walk not: neither shall they cry out through their throat. 15 manus habent et non palpabunt pedes habent et non ambulabunt nec sonabunt in gutture suo
8 Let them that make them become like unto them: and all such as trust in them. 16 similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea omnis qui confidit in eis
9 The house of Israel hath hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector. 17 Israhel confidet in Domino auxiliator et protector eorum est
10 The house of Aaron hath hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector. 18 domus Aaron confidet in Domino auxiliator et protector eorum est
11 They that fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector. 19 timentes Dominum confident in Domino auxiliator et protector eorum est
12 The Lord hath been mindful of us, and hath blessed us. He hath blessed the house of Israel: he hath blessed the house of Aaron. 20 Dominus recordatus nostri benedicet benedicet domui Israhel benedicet domui Aaron
13 He hath blessed all that fear the Lord, both little and great. 21 benedicet timentibus Dominum parvis et magnis
14 May the Lord add blessings upon you: upon you, and upon your children. 22 addat Dominus super vos super vos et super filios vestros
15 Blessed be you of the Lord, who made heaven and earth. 23 benedicti vos Domino qui fecit caelos et terram
16 The heaven of heaven is the Lord's: but the earth he has given to the children of men. 24 caelum caelorum Domino terram autem dedit filiis hominum
17 The dead shall not praise thee, O Lord: nor any of them that go down to hell. 25 non mortui laudabunt Dominum nec omnes qui descendunt in silentium
18 But we that live bless the Lord: from this time now and for ever. 26 sed nos benedicimus Domino amodo et usque in aeternum alleluia

Chapter 114

Dilexi. The prayer of a just man in affliction, with a lively confidence in God. Alleluia.

1 I have loved, because the Lord will hear the voice of my prayer. 1 dilexi quoniam audies Domine vocem deprecationis meae
2 Because he hath inclined his ear unto me: and in my days I will call upon him. 2 inclinavit aurem suam mihi et in diebus meis invocabo
3 The sorrows of death have compassed me: and the perils of hell have found me. I met with trouble and sorrow: 3 circumdederunt me funes mortis et munitiones inferni invenerunt me angustiam et dolorem repperi
4 And I called upon the name of the Lord. O Lord, deliver my soul. 4 et nomen Domini invocavi obsecro Domine salva animam meam
5 The Lord is merciful and just, and our God sheweth mercy. 5 clemens Dominus et iustus et Deus noster misericors
6 The Lord is the keeper of little ones: I was humbled, and he delivered me. 6 custodit parvulos Dominus adtenuatus sum et salvavit me
7 Turn, O my soul, into thy rest: for the Lord hath been bountiful to thee. 7 revertere anima mea in requiem tuam quia Dominus reddet tibi
8 For he hath delivered my soul from death: my eyes from tears, my feet from falling. 8 quia eruit animam meam de morte oculos meos a lacrimis pedes meos ab offensa
9 I will please the Lord in the land of the living. 9 deambulabo coram Domino in terris viventium

Chapter 115

Credidi. This in the Hebrew is joined with the foregoing psalm, and continues to express the faith and gratitude of the psalmist. Alleluia.

10 I have believed, therefore have I spoken; but I have been humbled exceedingly. 10 credidi propter quod locutus sum ego adflictus sum nimis
11 I said in my excess: Every man is a liar. 11 ego dixi in stupore meo omnis homo mendacium
12 What shall I render to the Lord, for all the things that he hath rendered to me? 12 quid reddam Domino pro omnibus quae tribuit mihi
13 I will take the chalice of salvation; and I will call upon the name of the Lord. 13 calicem salutis accipiam et nomen Domini invocabo
14 I will pay my vows to the Lord before all his people: 14 vota mea Domino reddam coram omni populo eius
15 Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints. 15 gloriosa in conspectu Domini mors sanctorum eius
16 O Lord, for I am thy servant: I am thy servant, and the son of thy handmaid. Thou hast broken my bonds: 16 obsecro Domine quia ego servus tuus ego servus tuus filius ancillae tuae dissolvisti vincula mea
17 I will sacrifice to thee the sacrifice of praise, and I will call upon the name of the Lord. 17 tibi immolabo hostiam laudis et in nomine Domini invocabo
18 I will pay my vows to the Lord in the sight of all his people: 18 vota mea Domino reddam in conspectu omnis populi eius
19 In the courts of the house of the Lord, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. 19 in atriis domus Domini in medio tui Hierusalem alleluia

Chapter 116

Laudate Dominum. All nations are called upon to praise God for his mercy and truth. Alleluia.

1 O Praise the Lord, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people. 1 laudate Dominum omnes gentes conlaudate eum universi populi
2 For his mercy is confirmed upon us: and the truth of the Lord remaineth for ever. 2 quia confortata est super nos misericordia eius et veritas Domini in aeternum alleluia

Chapter 117

Confitemini Domino. The psalmist praiseth God for his delivery from evils: putteth his whole trust in him; and foretelleth the coming of Christ. Alleluia.

1 Give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. 1 confitemini Domino quoniam bonus quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
2 Let Israel now say, that he is good: that his mercy endureth for ever. 2 dicat nunc Israhel quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
3 Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever. 3 dicat domus Aaron quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
4 Let them that fear the Lord now say, that his mercy endureth for ever. 4 dicant qui timent Dominum quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
5 In my trouble I called upon the Lord: and the Lord heard me, and enlarged me. 5 cum tribularer invocavi Dominum et exaudivit me in latitudine Dominus
6 The Lord is my helper: I will not fear what man can do unto me. 6 Dominus meus es non timebo quid faciat mihi homo
7 The Lord is my helper: and I will look over my enemies. 7 Dominus mihi auxiliator et ego despiciam odientes me
8 It is good to confide in the Lord, rather than to have confidence in man. 8 melius est sperare in Domino quam sperare in homine
9 It is good to trust in the Lord, rather than to trust in princes. 9 melius est sperare in Domino quam sperare in principibus
10 All nations compassed me about; and, in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them. 10 omnes gentes circumdederunt me et in nomine Domini ultus sum eas
11 Surrounding me they compassed me about: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them. 11 circumdederunt me et obsederunt me sed in nomine Domini ultus sum eas
12 They surrounded me like bees, and they burned like fire among thorns: and in the name of the Lord I was revenged on them. 12 circumdederunt me quasi apes extinctae sunt quasi ignis spinarum in nomine Domini quia ultus sum eas
13 Being pushed I was overturned that I might fall: but the Lord supported me. 13 inpulsus pellebar ut caderem et Dominus sustentavit me
14 The Lord is my strength and my praise: and he is become my salvation. 14 fortitudo mea et laus mea Dominus et factus est mihi in salutem
15 The voice of rejoicing and of salvation is in the tabernacles of the just. 15 vox laudis et salutis in tabernaculis iustorum
16 The right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength: the right hand of the Lord hath exalted me: the right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength. 16 dextera Domini fecit fortitudinem dextera Domini excelsa dextera Domini fecit fortitudinem
17 I shall not die, but live: and shall declare the works of the Lord. 17 non moriar sed vivam et narrabo opera Domini
18 The Lord chastising hath chastised me: but he hath not delivered me over to death. 18 corripiens arguit me Dominus et morti non tradidit me
19 Open ye to me the gates of justice: I will go in to them, and give praise to the Lord. 19 aperite mihi portas iustitiae ingressus eas confitebor Domino
20 This is the gate of the Lord, the just shall enter into it. 20 haec est porta Domini iusti intrabunt in eam
21 I will give glory to thee because thou hast heard me: and art become my salvation. 21 confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me et factus es mihi in salutem
22 The stone which the builders rejected; the same is become the head of the corner. 22 lapis quem reprobaverunt aedificantes factus est in caput anguli
23 This is the Lord's doing , and it is wonderful in our eyes. 23 a Domino factum est istud et hoc mirabile in oculis nostris
24 This is the day which the Lord hath made: let us be glad and rejoice therein. 24 haec est dies quam fecit Dominus exultemus et laetemur in ea
25 O Lord, save me: O Lord, give good success. 25 obsecro Domine salva obsecro obsecro Domine prosperare obsecro
26 Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord. We have blessed you out of the house of the Lord. 26 benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini benediximus vobis de domo Domini
27 The Lord is God, and he hath shone upon us. Appoint a solemn day, with shady boughs, even to the horn of the altar. 27 Deus Dominus et apparuit nobis frequentate sollemnitatem in frondosis usque ad cornua altaris
28 Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, and I will exalt thee. I will praise thee, because thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation. 28 Deus meus es tu et confitebor tibi Deus meus es tu exaltabo te
29 O praise ye the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. 29 confitemini Domino quoniam bonus quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius

Chapter 118

Beati immaculati. Of the excellence of virtue consisting in the love and observance of the commandments of God. Alleluia. ALEPH. Aleph. . .The first eight verses of this psalm in the original begin with Aleph, which is the name of the first letter of the Hebrew alphabet. The second eight verses begin with Beth, the name of the second letter of the Hebrew alphabet; and so to the end of the whole alphabet, in all twenty-two letters, each letter having eight verses. This order is variously expounded by the holy fathers; which shews the difficulty of understanding the holy scriptures, and consequently with what humility, a nd submission to the Church they are to be read.

1 Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the Lord. 1 aleph beati inmaculati in via qui ambulant in lege Domini
2 Blessed are they that search his testimonies: that seek him with their whole heart. 2 beati qui custodiunt testimonia eius in toto corde requirunt eum
3 For they that work iniquity, have not walked in his ways. 3 nec enim qui operantur iniquitatem in viis eius ambulaverunt
4 Thou hast commanded thy commandments to be kept most diligently. 4 tu mandasti praecepta tua custodire nimis
5 O! that my ways may be directed to keep thy justifications. 5 utinam dirigantur viae meae ad custodienda praecepta tua
6 Then shall I not be confounded, when I shall look into all thy commandments. 6 tunc non confundar cum respexero ad omnia mandata tua
7 I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned the judgments of thy justice. 7 confitebor tibi in directione cordis cum didicero iudicia iustitiae tuae
8 I will keep thy justifications: O! do not thou utterly forsake me. 8 praecepta tua custodiam ne derelinquas me nimis
9 By what doth a young man correct his way? by observing thy words. 9 beth in quo corrigit iuvenis semitam suam cum custodierit verba tua
10 With my whole heart have I sought after thee: let me not stray from thy commandments. 10 in toto corde meo exquisivi te ne errare me facias a mandatis tuis
11 Thy words have I hidden in my heart, that I may not sin against thee. 11 in corde meo abscondi eloquium tuum ut non peccem tibi
12 Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy justifications. 12 benedictus tu Domine doce me praecepta tua
13 With my lips I have pronounced all the judgments of thy mouth. 13 in labiis meis narravi omnes iustitias oris tui
14 I have been delighted in the way of thy testimonies, as in all riches. 14 in via testimoniorum tuorum laetatus sum quasi in omnibus divitiis
15 I will meditate on thy commandments: and I will consider thy ways. 15 in praeceptis tuis meditabor et contemplabor semitas tuas
16 I will think of thy justifications: I will not forget thy words. 16 iustitiis tuis delectabor non obliviscar verba tua
17 Give bountifully to thy servant, enliven me: and I shall keep thy words. 17 gimel tribue servo tuo vivam et custodiam verba tua
18 Open thou my eyes: and I will consider the wondrous things of thy law. 18 revela oculos meos et videbo mirabilia in lege tua
19 I am a sojourner on the earth: hide not thy commandments from me. 19 advena ego sum in terra ne abscondas a me mandata tua
20 My soul hath coveted to long for thy justifications, at all times. 20 desideravit anima mea desiderare iudicia tua in omni tempore
21 Thou hast rebuked the proud: they are cursed who decline from thy commandments. 21 increpasti superbos maledicti qui recedunt a mandatis tuis
22 Remove from me reproach and contempt: because I have sought after thy testimonies. 22 aufer a me obprobrium et contemptum quoniam testimonia tua custodivi
23 For princes sat, and spoke against me: but thy servant was employed in thy justifications. 23 etenim sedentes principes adversum me loquebantur servus autem tuus meditabatur praecepta tua
24 For thy testimonies are my meditation: and thy justifications my counsel. 24 sed et testimonia tua voluntas mea quasi viri amicissimi mei
25 My soul hath cleaved to the pavement: quicken thou me according to thy word. 25 deleth adhesit pulveri anima mea vivifica me iuxta verbum tuum
26 I have declared my ways, and thou hast heard me: teach me thy justifications. 26 vias meas exposui et exaudisti doce me iustitiam tuam
27 Make me to understand the way of thy justifications: and I shall be exercised in thy wondrous works. 27 viam praeceptorum tuorum fac me intellegere et loquar in mirabilibus tuis
28 My soul hath slumbered through heaviness: strengthen thou me in thy words. 28 destillavit anima mea prae stultitia serva me iuxta eloquium tuum
29 Remove from me the way of iniquity: and out of thy law have mercy on me. 29 viam mendacii aufer a me et legem tuam dona mihi
30 I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments I have not forgotten. 30 viam fidei elegi iudicia tua proponebam
31 I have stuck to thy testimonies, O Lord: put me not to shame. 31 adhesi testimoniis tuis Domine ne confundas me
32 I have run the way of thy commandments, when thou didst enlarge my heart. 32 viam mandatorum tuorum curram quoniam dilatasti cor meum
33 Set before me for a law the way of thy justifications, O Lord: and I will always seek after it. 33 he ostende mihi Domine viam praeceptorum tuorum et custodiam eam per vestigium
34 Give me understanding, and I will search thy law; and I will keep it with my whole heart. 34 doce me et observabo legem tuam et custodiam eam in toto corde
35 Lead me into the path of thy commandments; for this same I have desired. 35 deduc me in semita mandatorum tuorum quia ipsam volui
36 Incline my heart into thy testimonies and not to covetousness. 36 inclina cor meum ad testimonia tua et non ad avaritiam
37 Turn away my eyes that they may not behold vanity: quicken me in thy way. 37 averte oculos meos ne videant vanitatem in via tua vivifica me
38 Establish thy word to thy servant, in thy fear. 38 suscita servo tuo eloquium tuum in timorem tuum
39 Turn away my reproach, which I have apprehended: for thy judgments are delightful. 39 averte obprobrium meum quod reveritus sum iudicia tua bona
40 Behold I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy justice. 40 ecce desideravi praecepta tua iustitia tua vivifica me
41 Let thy mercy also come upon me, O Lord: thy salvation according to thy word. 41 vav et veniant mihi misericordiae tuae Domine et salus tua iuxta eloquium tuum
42 So shall I answer them that reproach me in any thing; that I have trusted in thy words. 42 et respondebo exprobranti mihi sermonem quia speravi in sermone tuo
43 And take not thou the word of truth utterly out of my mouth: for in thy words, I have hoped exceedingly. 43 et ne auferas de ore meo verbum veritatis usque nimis quoniam iudicia tua expectavi
44 So shall I always keep thy law, for ever and ever. 44 et custodiam legem tuam iugiter in sempiternum et ultra
45 And I walked at large: because I have sought after thy commandments. 45 et ambulabo in spatioso quia praecepta tua quaesivi
46 And I spoke of thy testimonies before kings: and I was not ashamed. 46 et loquar in testimoniis tuis coram regibus et non confundar
47 I meditated also on thy commandments, which I loved. 47 et delectabor in mandatis tuis quae dilexi
48 And I lifted up my hands to thy commandments, which I loved: and I was exercised in thy justifications. 48 et levabo manus meas ad mandata tua quae dilexi et loquar in praeceptis tuis
49 Be thou mindful of thy word to thy servant, in which thou hast given me hope. 49 zai memento sermonis servo tuo quem me sperare fecisti
50 This hath comforted me in my humiliation: because thy word hath enlivened me. 50 haec est consolatio mea in adflictione mea quia eloquium tuum vivificavit me
51 The proud did iniquitously altogether: but I declined not from thy law. 51 superbi deridebant me nimis a lege tua non declinavi
52 I remembered, O Lord, thy judgments of old: and I was comforted. 52 recordatus sum iudiciorum tuorum a saeculo Domine et consolatus sum
53 A fainting hath taken hold of me, because of the wicked that forsake thy law. 53 horror obtinuit me ab impiis qui dereliquerunt legem tuam
54 Thy justifications were the subject of my song, in the place of my pilgrimage. 54 carmina erant mihi praecepta tua in domo peregrinationis meae
55 In the night I have remembered thy name, O Lord: and have kept thy law. 55 recordatus sum in nocte nominis tui Domine et custodivi legem tuam
56 This happened to me: because I sought after thy justifications. 56 hoc factum est mihi quia praecepta tua custodivi
57 O Lord, my portion, I have said, I would keep thy law. 57 heth pars mea Domine dixi ut custodiam verbum tuum
58 I entreated thy face with all my heart: have mercy on me according to thy word. 58 deprecatus sum vultum tuum in toto corde miserere mei secundum eloquium tuum
59 I have thought on my ways: and turned my feet unto thy testimonies. 59 recogitavi vias meas et converti pedes meos ad testimonia tua
60 I am ready, and am not troubled: that I may keep thy commandments. 60 festinavi et non neglexi custodire mandata tua
61 The cords of the wicked have encompassed me: but I have not forgotten thy law. 61 funes impiorum inplicaverunt me legem tuam non sum oblitus
62 I rose at midnight to give praise to thee; for the judgments of thy justification. 62 medio noctis surgam ad confitendum tibi super iudicia iustificationis tuae
63 I am a partaker with all them that fear thee, and that keep thy commandments. 63 particeps ego sum omnium timentium te et custodientium praecepta tua
64 The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy justifications. 64 misericordia tua conpleta est terra praecepta tua doce me
65 Thou hast done well with thy servant, O Lord, according to thy word. 65 teth benefecisti servo tuo Domine secundum verbum tuum
66 Teach me goodness and discipline and knowledge; for I have believed thy commandments. 66 bonum sermonem et scientiam doce me quia mandatis tuis credidi
67 Before I was humbled I offended; therefore have I kept thy word. 67 antequam audirem ego ignoravi nunc autem eloquium tuum custodivi
68 Thou art good; and in thy goodness teach me thy justifications. 68 bonus tu et beneficus doce me praecepta tua
69 The iniquity of the proud hath been multiplied over me: but I will seek thy commandments with my whole heart. 69 adplicabant mihi mendacium superbi ego autem in toto corde servabam praecepta tua
70 Their heart is curdled like milk: but I have meditated on thy law. 70 incrassatum est velut adeps cor eorum et ego in lege tua delectabar
71 It is good for me that thou hast humbled me, that I may learn thy justifications. 71 bonum mihi quia adflictus sum ut discerem praecepta tua
72 The law of thy mouth is good to me, above thousands of gold and silver. 72 melior mihi est lex oris tui super milia auri et argenti
73 Thy hands have made me and formed me: give me understanding, and I will learn thy commandments. 73 ioth manus tuae fecerunt me et firmaverunt me doce me et discam mandata tua
74 They that fear thee shall see me, and shall be glad : because I have greatly hoped in thy words. 74 qui timent te videbunt me et laetabuntur quia sermonem tuum expectavi
75 I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are equity: and in thy truth thou hast humbled me. 75 scio Domine quia iustum iudicium tuum et vere adflixisti me
76 O! let thy mercy be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant. 76 sit obsecro misericordia tua in consolatione mea sicut locutus es servo tuo
77 Let thy tender mercies come unto me, and I shall live: for thy law is my meditation. 77 veniant mihi misericordiae tuae et vivam quia lex tua delectatio mea
78 Let the proud be ashamed, because they have done unjustly towards me: but I will be employed in thy commandments. 78 confundantur superbi quoniam inique contriverunt me ego autem loquar in praeceptis tuis
79 Let them that fear thee turn to me: and they that know thy testimonies. 79 revertantur ad me qui timent te et qui sciunt testimonium tuum
80 Let my heart be undefiled in thy justifications, that I may not be confounded. 80 fiat cor meum perfectum in praeceptis tuis ut non confundar
81 My soul hath fainted after thy salvation: and in thy word I have very much hoped. 81 caph defecit in salutare tuum anima mea verbum tuum expectavi
82 My eyes have failed for thy word, saying: When wilt thou comfort me? 82 consumpti sunt oculi mei in verbum tuum dicentes quando consolaberis me
83 For I am become like a bottle in the frost: I have not forgotten thy justifications. 83 et cum essem quasi uter in pruinam praecepta tua non sum oblitus
84 How many are the days of thy servant: when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me? 84 quot sunt dies servi tui quando facies in persequentibus me iudicium
85 The wicked have told me fables: but not as thy law. 85 foderunt mihi superbi foveas quae non erant iuxta legem tuam
86 All thy statutes are truth: they have persecuted me unjustly, do thou help me. 86 omnia mandata tua vera falso persecuti sunt me auxiliare mihi
87 They had almost made an end of me upon earth: but I have not forsaken thy commandments. 87 paulo minus consumpserunt me in terra ego autem non dimisi praecepta tua
88 Quicken thou me according to thy mercy: and I shall keep the testimonies of thy mouth. 88 secundum misericordiam tuam vivifica me et custodiam testimonium oris tui
89 For ever, O Lord, thy word standeth firm in heaven. 89 lameth in aeternum Domine verbum tuum perstat in caelo
90 Thy truth unto all generations: thou hast founded the earth, and it continueth. 90 in generatione et generatione fides tua fundasti terram et stat
91 By thy ordinance the day goeth on: for all things serve thee. 91 iudicio tuo stant usque hodie quia omnia serviunt tibi
92 Unless thy law had been my meditation, I had then perhaps perished in my abjection. 92 nisi quod lex tua delectatio mea forte perissem in pressura mea
93 Thy justifications I will never forget: for by them thou hast given me life. 93 in sempiternum non obliviscar praeceptorum tuorum quia per ipsa vivificasti me
94 I am thine, save thou me: for I have sought thy justifications. 94 tuus ego sum salva me quoniam praecepta tua quaesivi
95 The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I have understood thy testimonies. 95 me expectaverunt impii ut perderent me testimonium tuum considerabo
96 I have seen an end of all perfection: thy commandment is exceeding broad. 96 omni consummationi vidi finem latum mandatum tuum nimis
97 O how have I loved thy law, O Lord! it is my meditation all the day. 97 mem quam dilexi legem tuam tota die haec meditatio mea
98 Through thy commandment, thou hast made me wiser than my enemies: for it is ever with me. 98 super inimicos meos instruis me mandata tua quia in sempiternum hoc est mihi
99 I have understood more than all my teachers: because thy testimonies are my meditation. 99 super omnes qui docebant me eruditus sum quia testimonia tua meditatio mea
100 I have had understanding above ancients: because I have sought thy commandments. 100 super senes intellexi quia praecepta tua servavi
101 I have restrained my feet from every evil way: that I may keep thy words. 101 ab omni semita mala prohibui pedes meos ut custodirem verba tua
102 I have not declined from thy judgments, because thou hast set me a law. 102 a iudiciis tuis non recessi quia tu inluminasti me
103 How sweet are thy words to my palate! more than honey to my mouth. 103 quam dulce gutturi meo eloquium tuum super mel ori meo
104 By thy commandments I have had understanding: therefore have I hated every way of iniquity. 104 praecepta tua considerabam propterea odivi omnem semitam mendacii
105 Thy word is a lamp to my feet, and a light to my paths. 105 nun lucerna pedi meo verbum tuum et lux semitae meae
106 I have sworn and am determined to keep the judgments of thy justice. 106 iuravi et perseverabo ut custodiam iudicia iustitiae tuae
107 I have been humbled, O Lord, exceedingly: quicken thou me according to thy word. 107 adflictus sum usque nimis Domine vivifica me iuxta verbum tuum
108 The free offerings of my mouth make acceptable, O Lord: and teach me thy judgments. 108 voluntaria oris mei conplaceant tibi Domine et secundum iudicia tua doce me
109 My soul is continually in my hands: and I have not forgotten thy law. 109 anima mea in manu mea semper et legis tuae non sum oblitus
110 Sinners have laid a snare for me: but I have not erred from thy precepts. 110 posuerunt impii laqueum mihi et a praeceptis tuis non aberravi
111 I have purchased thy testimonies for an inheritance for ever: because they are the joy of my heart. 111 hereditas mea testimonia tua in sempiternum quia gaudium cordis mei sunt
112 I have inclined my heart to do thy justifications for ever, for the reward. 112 inclinavi cor meum ut facerem iustitias tuas propter aeternam retributionem
113 I have hated the unjust: and have loved thy law. 113 samech tumultuosos odivi et legem tuam dilexi
114 Thou art my helper and my protector: and in thy word I have greatly hoped. 114 protectio mea et scutum meum tu es verbum tuum expectavi
115 Depart from me, ye malignant: and I will search the commandments of my God. 115 recedite a me maligni et custodiam mandata Dei mei
116 Uphold me according to thy word, and I shall live: and let me not be confounded in my expectation. 116 confirma me secundum verbum tuum et vivam et noli me confundere ab expectatione mea
117 Help me, and I shall be saved: and I will meditate always on thy justifications. 117 auxiliare mihi et salvus ero et delectabor in praeceptis tuis iugiter
118 Thou hast despised all them that fall off from thy judgments; for their thought is unjust. 118 abiecisti omnes qui adversantur praecepta tua quia mendax cogitatio eorum
119 I have accounted all the sinners of the earth prevaricators: therefore have I loved thy testimonies. 119 quasi scoriam conputasti omnes impios terrae propterea dilexi testimonia tua
120 Pierce thou my flesh with thy fear: for I am afraid of thy judgments. 120 horripilavit a timore tuo caro mea et iudicia tua timui
121 I have done judgment and justice: give me not up to them that slander me. 121 ain feci iudicium et iustitiam ne derelinquas me his qui calumniantur me
122 Uphold thy servant unto good: let not the proud calumniate me. 122 sponde pro servo tuo in bonum ne calumnientur me superbi
123 My eyes have fainted after thy salvation: and for the word of thy justice. 123 oculi mei defecerunt in salutare tuum et in eloquium iustitiae tuae
124 Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy: and teach me thy justifications. 124 fac cum servo tuo iuxta misericordiam tuam et praecepta tua doce me
125 I am thy servant: give me understanding that I may know thy testimonies. 125 servus tuus ego instrue me et cognoscam testimonia tua
126 It is time, O Lord, to do: they have dissipated thy law. 126 tempus est ut facias Domine praevaricati sunt legem tuam
127 Therefore have I loved thy commandments above gold and the topaz. 127 propterea dilexi mandata tua super aurum et topazium
128 Therefore was I directed to all thy commandments: I have hated all wicked ways. 128 propterea in universa praecepta direxi omnem semitam mendacii odio habui
129 Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore my soul hath sought them. 129 fe mirabilia testimonia tua idcirco custodivit ea anima mea
130 The declaration of thy words giveth light: and giveth understanding to little ones. 130 ostium sermonum tuorum lucidum doce parvulos
131 I opened my mouth, and panted: because I longed for thy commandments. 131 os meum aperui et respiravi quia mandata tua desiderabam
132 Look thou upon me, and have mercy on me according to the judgment of them that love thy name. 132 respice ad me et miserere mei iuxta iudicium diligentium nomen tuum
133 Direct my steps according to thy word: and let no iniquity have dominion over me. 133 gressus meos firma in sermone tuo et non des potestatem in me universae iniquitati
134 Redeem me from the calumnies of men: that I may keep thy commandments. 134 redime me a calumnia hominis et custodiam praecepta tua
135 Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: and teach me thy justifications. 135 vultum tuum ostende servo tuo et doce me praecepta tua
136 My eyes have sent forth springs of water: because they have not kept thy law. 136 rivi aquarum fluebant de oculis meis quia non custodierunt legem tuam
137 Thou art just, O Lord: and thy judgment is right. 137 sade iustus es Domine et rectum iudicium tuum
138 Thou hast commanded justice thy testimonies: and thy truth exceedingly. 138 praecepisti iustitiam testimonii tui et veritatem nimis
139 My zeal hath made me pine away: because my enemies forgot thy words. 139 consumpsit me zelus meus quia obliti sunt verborum tuorum hostes mei
140 Thy word is exceedingly refined: and thy servant hath loved it. 140 probatus sermo tuus nimis et servus tuus dilexit illum
141 I am very young and despised; but I forget not thy justifications. 141 parvulus ego sum et contemptibilis sed praecepta tua non sum oblitus
142 Thy justice is justice for ever: and thy law is the truth. 142 iustitia tua iustitia sempiterna et lex tua veritas
143 Trouble and anguish have found me: thy commandments are my meditation. 143 tribulatio et angustia invenerunt me mandata tua voluntas mea
144 Thy testimonies are justice for ever: give me understanding, and I shall live. 144 iusta testimonia tua semper doce me et vivam
145 I cried with my whole heart, hear me, O Lord: I will seek thy justifications. 145 coph clamavi in toto corde exaudi me Domine praecepta tua custodiam
146 I cried unto thee, save me: that I may keep thy commandments. 146 invocavi te salvum me fac et custodiam testimonia tua
147 I prevented the dawning of the day, and cried: because in thy words I very much hoped. 147 surgebam adhuc in tenebris et clamabam verbum tuum expectans
148 My eyes to thee have prevented the morning: that I might meditate on thy words. 148 praeveniebant oculi mei vigilias ut meditarer in sermonibus tuis
149 Hear thou my voice, O Lord, according to thy mercy: and quicken me according to thy judgment. 149 vocem meam audi iuxta misericordiam tuam Domine secundum iudicium tuum vivifica me
150 They that persecute me have drawn nigh to iniquity; but they are gone far off from thy law. 150 adpropinquaverunt persecutores mei sceleri et a lege tua procul facti sunt
151 Thou art near, O Lord: and all thy ways are truth. 151 prope es tu Domine et omnia mandata tua veritas
152 I have known from the beginning concerning thy testimonies: that thou hast founded them for ever. 152 a principio novi de testimoniis tuis quod in aeternum fundaveris ea
153 See my humiliation and deliver me for I have not forgotten thy law. 153 res vide adflictionem meam et eripe me quia legis tuae non sum oblitus
154 Judge my judgment and redeem me: quicken thou me for thy word's sake. 154 iudica causam meam et redime me sermone tuo vivifica me
155 Salvation is far from sinners; because they have not sought thy justifications. 155 longe ab impiis salus quia praecepta tua non quaesierunt
156 Many, O Lord, are thy mercies: quicken me according to thy judgment. 156 misericordiae tuae multae Domine iuxta iudicia tua vivifica me
157 Many are they that persecute me and afflict me; but I have not declined from thy testimonies. 157 multi qui persequuntur me et adfligunt me a testimoniis tuis non declinavi
158 I beheld the transgressors, and pined away; because they kept not thy word. 158 vidi praevaricatores tuos et maerebam qui verbum tuum non custodierunt
159 Behold I have loved thy commandments, O Lord; quicken me thou in thy mercy. 159 vide quoniam praecepta tua dilexi Domine iuxta misericordiam tuam vivifica me
160 The beginning of thy words is truth: all the judgments of thy justice are for ever. 160 caput verborum tuorum veritas et sempiternum omne iudicium iustitiae tuae
161 Princes have persecuted me without cause: and my heart hath been in awe of thy words. 161 sen principes persecuti sunt me sine causa verba autem tua timuit cor meum
162 I will rejoice at thy words, as one that hath found great spoil. 162 gaudens ego sum in eloquio tuo sicut qui invenit spolia multa
163 I have hated and abhorred iniquity; but I have loved thy law. 163 mendacium odio habui et detestatus sum legem autem tuam dilexi
164 Seven times a day I have given praise to thee, for the judgments of thy justice. 164 septies in die laudavi te super iudiciis iustitiae tuae
165 Much peace have they that love thy law, and to them there is no stumbling. block. 165 pax multa diligentibus legem tuam et non est illis scandalum
166 I looked for thy salvation, O Lord: and I loved thy commandments. 166 expectavi salutare tuum Domine et mandata tua feci
167 My soul hath kept thy testimonies and hath loved them exceedingly. 167 custodivit anima mea testimonia tua et dilexi ea nimis
168 I have kept thy commandments and thy testimonies: because all my ways are in thy sight. 168 custodivi praecepta tua et testimonia tua quia omnes viae meae in conspectu tuo
169 Let my supplication, O Lord, come near in thy sight: give me understanding according to thy word. 169 thau ingrediatur laus mea coram te Domine secundum verbum tuum doce me
170 Let my request come in before thee; deliver thou me according to thy word. 170 veniat deprecatio mea ante vultum tuum secundum eloquium tuum libera me
171 My lips shall utter a hymn, when thou shalt teach me thy justifications. 171 fundant labia mea hymnum docebis enim me praecepta tua
172 My tongue shall pronounce thy word: because all thy commandments are justice. 172 loquetur lingua mea sermonem tuum quia omnia mandata tua iusta
173 Let thy hand be with me to save me; for I have chosen thy precepts. 173 sit manus tua auxiliatrix mea quia praecepta tua elegi
174 I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my meditation. 174 desideravi salutare tuum Domine et lex tua voluntas mea
175 My soul shall live and shall praise thee: and thy judgments shall help me. 175 vivet anima mea et laudabit te et iudicia tua auxiliabuntur mihi
176 I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost: seek thy servant, because I have not forgotten thy commandments. 176 erravi quasi ovis perdita quaere servum tuum quia mandatorum tuorum non sum oblitus

Chapter 119

Ad Dominum. A prayer in tribulation. A gradual canticle. A gradual canticle. . .The following psalms, in number fifteen, are called gradual psalms, or canticles, from the word gradus, signifying steps, ascensions, or degrees: either because they were appointed to be sung on the fifteen steps, by which the people ascended to the temple: or, that in the singing of them the voice was to be raised by certain steps or ascensions: or, that they were to be sung by the people returning from their captivity and ascending to Jerusalem, which was seated amon gst mountains. The holy fathers, in a mystical sense, understand these steps, or ascensions, of the degrees by which Christians spiritually ascend to virtue and perfection; and to the true temple of God in the heavenly Jerusalem.

1 In my trouble I cried to the Lord: and he heard me. 1 canticum graduum ad Dominum in tribulatione mea clamavi et exaudivit me
2 O Lord, deliver my soul from wicked lips, and a deceitful tongue. 2 Domine libera animam meam a labio mendacii a lingua dolosa
3 What shall be given to thee, or what shall be added to thee, to a deceitful tongue? 3 quid detur tibi aut quid adponatur tibi ad linguam dolosam
4 The sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals that lay waste. 4 sagittae potentis acutae cum carbonibus iuniperorum
5 Woe is me, that my sojourning is prolonged! I have dwelt with the inhabitants of Cedar: 5 heu mihi quia peregrinatio mea prolongata est habitavi cum tabernaculis Cedar
6 My soul hath been long a sojourner. 6 multum peregrinata est anima mea
7 With them that hated peace I was peaceable: when I spoke to them they fought against me without cause. 7 cum odientibus pacem ego pacifica loquebar et illi bellantia

Chapter 120

Levavi oculos. God is the keeper of his servants. A gradual canticle.

1 I have lifted up my eyes to the mountains, from whence help shall come to me. 1 canticum graduum levavi oculos meos in montes unde veniet auxilium meum
2 My help is from the Lord, who made heaven and earth. 2 auxilium meum a Domino factore caeli et terrae
3 May he not suffer thy foot to be moved: neither let him slumber that keepeth thee. 3 non det in commotionem pedem tuum nec dormitet qui custodit te
4 Behold he shall neither slumber nor sleep, that keepeth Israel. 4 ecce non dormitabit neque dormiet qui custodiet Israhel
5 The Lord is thy keeper, the Lord is thy protection upon thy right hand. 5 Dominus custodiet te Dominus protectio tua super manum dexteram tuam
6 The sun shall not burn thee by day: nor the moon by night. 6 per diem sol non percutiet te neque luna per noctem
7 The Lord keepeth thee from all evil: may the Lord keep thy soul. 7 Dominus custodiet te ab omni malo custodiat animam tuam
8 May the Lord keep thy coming in and thy going out; from henceforth now and for ever. 8 Dominus custodiat exitum tuum et introitum tuum amodo et usque in aeternum

Chapter 121

Laetatus sum in his. The desire and hope of the just for the coming of the kingdom of God, and the peace of his church.

1 A gradual canticle. 1 canticum graduum David laetatus sum eo quod dixerint mihi in domum Domini ibimus
2 Our feet were standing in thy courts, O Jerusalem. 2 stantes erant pedes nostri in portis tuis Hierusalem
3 Jerusalem, which is built as a city, which is compact together. 3 Hierusalem quae aedificaris ut civitas cuius participatio eius simul
4 For thither did the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord: the testimony of Israel, to praise the name of the Lord. 4 quia ibi ascenderunt tribus tribus Domini testimonium Israhel ad confitendum nomini Domini
5 Because their seats have sat in judgment, seats upon the house of David. 5 quia ibi sederunt sedes in iudicio sedes domui David
6 Pray ye for the things that are for the peace of Jerusalem: and abundance for them that love thee. 6 rogate pacem Hierusalem sit bene his qui diligunt te
7 Let peace be in thy strength: and abundance in thy towers. 7 sit pax in muris tuis abundantia in domibus tuis
8 For the sake of my brethren, and of my neighbours, I spoke peace of thee. 8 propter fratres meos et amicos meos loquar pacem tibi
9 Because of the house of the Lord our God, I have sought good things for thee. 9 propter domum Domini Dei nostri quaeram bona tibi

Chapter 122

Ad te levavi. A prayer in affliction, with confidence in God. A gradual canticle.

1 To thee have I lifted up my eyes, who dwellest in heaven. 1 canticum graduum ad te levavi oculos meos qui habitas in caelis
2 Behold as the eyes of servants are on the hands of their masters, As the eyes of the handmaid are on the hands of her mistress: so are our eyes unto the Lord our God, until he have mercy on us. 2 ecce sicut oculi servorum ad manum dominorum suorum sicut oculi ancillae ad manum dominae suae sic oculi nostri ad Dominum Deum nostrum donec misereatur nostri
3 Have mercy on us, O Lord, have mercy on us: for we are greatly filled with contempt. 3 miserere nostri Domine miserere nostri quoniam multum repleti sumus despectione
4 For our soul is greatly filled: we are a reproach to the rich, and contempt to the proud. 4 multum repleta est anima nostra obprobrii abundantium et despectionis superborum

Chapter 123

Nisi quia Domini. The church giveth glory to God for her deliverance, from the hands of her enemies.

1 A gradual canticle. If it had not been that the Lord was with us, let Israel now say: 1 canticum graduum David nisi Dominus fuisset in nobis dicat nunc Israhel
2 If it had not been that the Lord was with us, When men rose up against us, 2 nisi Dominus fuisset in nobis cum exsurgerent super nos homines
3 Perhaps they had swallowed us up alive. When their fury was enkindled against us, 3 forsitan vivos absorbuissent nos cum irasceretur furor eorum super nos
4 Perhaps the waters had swallowed us up. 4 forsitan aquae circumdedissent nos
5 Our soul hath passed through a torrent: perhaps our soul had passed through a water insupportable. 5 torrens transisset super animam nostram forsitan transissent super animam nostram aquae superbae
6 Blessed be the Lord, who hath not given us to be a prey to their teeth. 6 benedictus Dominus qui non dedit nos in praedam dentibus eorum
7 Our soul hath been delivered as a sparrow out of the snare of the fowlers. The snare is broken, and we are delivered. 7 anima nostra quasi avis erepta est de laqueo venantium laqueus contritus est et nos liberati sumus
8 Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth. 8 auxilium nostrum in nomine Domini qui fecit caelum et terram

Chapter 124

Qui confidunt. The just are always under God's protection.

1 A gradual canticle. They that trust in the Lord shall be as mount Sion: he shall not be moved for ever that dwelleth 1 canticum graduum qui confidunt in Domino quasi mons Sion inmobilis in aeternum habitabilis
2 In Jerusalem. Mountains are round about it: so the Lord is round about his people from henceforth now and for ever. 2 Hierusalem montes in circuitu eius et Dominus in circuitu populi sui amodo et usque in aeternum
3 For the Lord will not leave the rod of sinners upon the lot of the just: that the just may not stretch forth their hands to iniquity. 3 quia non requiescet virga impietatis super sortem iustorum ut non mittant iusti in iniquitatem manus suas
4 Do good, O Lord, to those that are good, and to the upright of heart. 4 benefac Domine bonis et rectis corde
5 But such as turn aside into bonds, the Lord shall lead out with the workers of iniquity: peace upon Israel. 5 qui autem declinant ad pravitates suas deducet eos Dominus cum his qui operantur iniquitatem pax super Israhel

Chapter 125

In convertendo. The people of God rejoice at their delivery from captivity.

1 A gradual canticle. When the Lord brought back the captivity of Sion, we became like men comforted. 1 canticum graduum cum converteret Dominus captivitatem Sion facti sumus quasi somniantes
