2 Then was our mouth filled with gladness; and our tongue with joy. Then shall they say among the Gentiles: The Lord hath done great things for them. 2 tunc implebitur risu os nostrum et lingua nostra laude tunc dicent in gentibus magnificavit Dominus facere cum istis
3 The Lord hath done great things for us: we are become joyful. 3 magnificavit Dominus facere nobiscum facti sumus laetantes
4 Turn again our captivity, O Lord, as a stream in the south. 4 converte Domine captivitatem nostram sicut rivum in austro
5 They that sow in tears shall reap in joy. 5 qui seminant in lacrimis in exultatione metent
6 Going they went and wept, casting their seeds. 6 qui ambulans ibat et flebat portans ad seminandum sementem veniens veniet in exultatione portans manipulos suos
7 But coming they shall come with joyfulness, carrying their sheaves. .

Chapter 126

Nisi Dominus. Nothing can be done without God's grace and blessing.

1 A gradual canticle of Solomon. Unless the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it. Unless the Lord keep the city, he watcheth in vain that keepeth it. 1 canticum graduum Salomonis nisi Dominus aedificaverit domum in vanum laboraverunt qui aedificant eam nisi Dominus custodierit civitatem frustra vigilat qui custodit eam
2 It is vain for you to rise before light, rise ye after you have sitten, you that eat the bread of sorrow. When he shall give sleep to his beloved, 2 frustra vobis est de mane consurgere postquam sederitis qui manducatis panem idolorum sic dabit diligentibus se somnum
3 Behold the inheritance of the Lord are children: the reward, the fruit of the womb. 3 ecce hereditas Domini filii mercis fructus ventris
4 As arrows in the hand of the mighty, so the children of them that have been shaken. 4 sicut sagittae in manu potentis ita filii iuventutis
5 Blessed is the man that hath filled the desire with them; he shall not be confounded when he shall speak to his enemies in the gate. 5 beatus vir qui implevit faretram suam ex ipsis non confundentur cum loquentur inimicis in porta

Chapter 127

Beati omnes. The fear of God is the way to happiness.

1 A gradual canticle. Blessed are all they that fear the Lord: that walk in his ways. 1 canticum graduum beatus omnis qui timet Dominum qui ambulat in viis eius
2 For thou shalt eat the labours of thy hands: blessed art thou, and it shall be well with thee. 2 laborem manuum tuarum cum comederis beatus tu et bene tibi erit
3 Thy wife as a fruitful vine, on the sides of thy house. Thy children as olive plants, round about thy table. 3 uxor tua sicut vitis fructifera in penetrabilibus domus tuae filii tui sicut germina olivarum in circuitu mensae tuae
4 Behold, thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord. 4 ecce sic benedicetur viro qui timet Dominum
5 May the Lord bless thee out of Sion: and mayst thou see the good things of Jerusalem all the days of thy life. 5 benedicat tibi Dominus ex Sion et videas bona Hierusalem omnibus diebus vitae tuae
6 And mayst thou see thy children's children, peace upon Israel. 6 et videas filios filiorum tuorum pacem super Israhel

Chapter 128

Saepe expugnaverunt. The church of God is invincible : her persecutors come to nothing.

1 A gradual canticle. Often have they fought against me from my youth, let Israel now say. 1 canticum graduum saepe expugnaverunt me ab adulescentia mea dicat nunc Israhel
2 Often have they fought against me from my youth: but they could not prevail over me. 2 saepe expugnaverunt me ab adulescentia mea sed non potuerunt mihi
3 The wicked have wrought upon my back: they have lengthened their iniquity. 3 super cervicem meam arabant arantes prolongaverunt sulcum suum
4 The Lord who is just will cut the necks of sinners: 4 Dominus iustus concidet laqueos impiorum
5 Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Sion. 5 confundantur et revertantur retrorsum omnes qui oderunt Sion
6 Let them be as grass upon the tops of houses: which withereth before it be plucked up: 6 fiant sicut faenum tectorum quod statim ut viruerit arescet
7 Who with the mower filleth not his hand: nor he that gathereth sheaves his bosom. 7 de quo non implebit manum suam messor et sinum suum manipulos faciens
8 And they that passed by have not said: The blessing of the Lord be upon you: we have blessed you in the name of the Lord. 8 de quo non dixerunt transeuntes benedictio Domini super vos benediximus vobis in nomine Domini

Chapter 129

De profundis. A prayer of a sinner, trusting in the mercies of God. The sixth penitential psalm.

1 A gradual canticle. Out of the depths I have cried to thee, O Lord: 1 canticum graduum de profundis clamavi ad te Domine
2 Lord, hear my voice. Let thy ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication. 2 Domine exaudi vocem meam fiant aures tuae intendentes ad vocem deprecationis meae
3 If thou, O Lord, wilt mark iniquities: Lord, who shall stand it. 3 si iniquitates observabis Domine Domine quis sustinebit
4 For with thee there is merciful forgiveness: and by reason of thy law, I have waited for thee, O Lord. My soul hath relied on his word: 4 quia tecum est propitiatio cum terribilis sis sustinui Dominum sustinuit anima mea et verbum eius expectavi
5 my soul hath hoped in the Lord. 5 anima mea ad Dominum
6 From the morning watch even until night, let Israel hope in the Lord. 6 a vigilia matutina usque ad vigiliam matutinam expectet Israhel Dominum
7 Because with the Lord there is mercy: and with him plentiful redemption. 7 quia apud Dominum misericordia et multa apud eum redemptio
8 And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities. 8 et ipse redimet Israhel ex omnibus iniquitatibus eius

Chapter 130

Domine, none est. The prophet's humility.

1 A gradual canticle of David. Lord, my heart is not exalted: nor are my eyes lofty. Neither have I walked in great matters, nor in wonderful things above me. 1 canticum graduum Domine non est exaltatum cor meum neque elati sunt oculi mei et non ambulavi in magnis et in mirabilibus super me
2 If I was not humbly minded, but exalted my soul: As a child that is weaned is towards his mother, so reward in my soul. 2 si non proposui et silere feci animam meam sicut ablactatus ad matrem suam ita ablactata ad me anima mea
3 Let Israel hope in the Lord, from henceforth now and for ever. 3 expecta Israhel Dominum amodo et usque in aeternum

Chapter 131

Memento, Domine. A prayer for the fulfilling of the promise made to David.

1 A gradual canticle. O Lord, remember David, and all his meekness. 1 canticum graduum memento Domine David et omnis adflictionis eius
2 How he swore to the Lord, he vowed a vow to the God of Jacob: 2 qui iuravit Domino votum vovit Deo Iacob
3 If I shall enter into the tabernacle of my house: if I shall go up into the bed wherein I lie: 3 si intravero in tabernaculum domus meae si adsedero super lectum straminis mei
4 If I shall give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids, 4 si dedero somnum oculis meis et palpebris dormitationem
5 Or rest to my temples: until I find out a place for the Lord, a tabernacle for the God of Jacob. 5 donec inveniam locum Domino tabernacula Deo Iacob
6 Behold we have heard of it in Ephrata: we have found it in the fields of the wood. 6 ecce audivimus illum in Ephrata invenimus illum in regione saltus
7 We will go into his tabernacle: we will adore in the place where his feet stood. 7 intremus in tabernacula eius adoremus scabillum pedum eius
8 Arise, O Lord, into thy resting place: thou and the ark, which thou hast sanctified. 8 surge Domine in requiem tuam tu et arca fortitudinis tuae
9 Let thy priests be clothed with justice: and let thy saints rejoice. 9 sacerdotes tui induantur iustitia et sancti tui laudent
10 For thy servant David's sake, turn not away the face of thy anointed. 10 propter David servum tuum ne avertas faciem christi tui
11 The Lord hath sworn truth to David, and he will not make it void: of the fruit of thy womb I will set upon thy throne. 11 iuravit Dominus David veritatem non avertetur ab ea de fructu ventris tui ponam super sedem tuam
12 If thy children will keep my covenant, and these my testimonies which I shall teach them: Their children also for evermore shall sit upon thy throne. 12 si custodierint filii tui pactum meum et testificationem meam quam docuero eos et filii eorum usque in aeternum sedebunt super thronum tuum
13 For the Lord hath chosen Sion: he hath chosen it for his dwelling. 13 quia elegit Dominus Sion desideravit eam in habitaculum suum
14 This is my rest for ever and ever: here will I dwell, for I have chosen it. 14 haec est requies mea in sempiternum hic habitabo quia desideravi eam
15 Blessing I will bless her widow: I will satisfy her poor with bread. 15 venationem eius benedicens benedicam pauperes eius saturabo pane
16 I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints shall rejoice with exceeding great joy. 16 sacerdotes eius induam salutari et sancti eius laude laudabunt
17 There will I bring forth a horn to David: I have prepared a lamp for my anointed. 17 ibi oriri faciam cornu David paravi lucernam christo meo
18 His enemies I will clothe with confusion: but upon him shall my sanctification flourish. 18 inimicos eius induam confusione super ipsum autem florebit sanctificatio eius

Chapter 132

Ecce quam bonum. The happiness of brotherly love and concord.

1 A gradual canticle of David. Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity: 1 canticum graduum David ecce quam bonum et quam decorum habitare fratres in uno
2 Like the precious ointment on the head, that ran down upon the beard, the beard of Aaron, Which ran down to the skirt of his garment: 2 sicut unguentum optimum in capite quod descendit in barbam barbam Aaron quod descendit super oram vestimentorum eius
3 As the dew of Hermon, which descendeth upon mount Sion. For there the Lord hath commanded blessing, and life for evermore. 3 sicut ros Hermon qui descendit super montana Sion quoniam ibi mandavit Dominus benedictionem vitam usque in aeternum

Chapter 133

Ecce nunc benedicite. An exhortation to praise God continually.

1 A gradual canticle. Behold now bless ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord: Who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God. 1 canticum graduum ecce benedicite Domino omnes servi Domini qui statis in domo Domini
2 In the nights lift up your hands to the holy places, and bless ye the Lord. 2 in noctibus levate manus vestras ad sanctum et benedicite Domino
3 May the Lord out of Sion bless thee, he that made heaven and earth. 3 benedicat tibi Dominus ex Sion factor caeli et terrae

Chapter 134

Laudate nomen. An exhortation to praise God: the vanity of idols.

1 Alleluia. Praise ye the name of the Lord: O you his servants, praise the Lord: 1 alleluia laudate nomen Domini laudate servi Dominum
2 You that stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God. 2 qui statis in domo Domini in atriis domus Dei nostri
3 Praise ye the Lord, for the Lord is good: sing ye to his name, for it is sweet. 3 laudate Dominum quoniam bonus Dominus cantate nomini eius quoniam decens
4 For the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself: Israel for his own possession. 4 quia Iacob elegit sibi Dominus Israhel in peculium suum
5 For I have known that the Lord is great, and our God is above all gods. 5 quia ego scio quod magnus Dominus et Dominus noster prae omnibus diis
6 Whatsoever the Lord pleased he hath done, in heaven, in earth, in the sea, and in all the deeps. 6 omnia quae voluit Dominus fecit in caelo et in terra in mari et in cunctis abyssis
7 He bringeth up clouds from the end of the earth: he hath made lightnings for the rain. He bringeth forth winds out of his stores: 7 levans nubes de summitatibus terrae fulgura in pluviam fecit educens ventos de thesauris suis
8 He slew the firstborn of Egypt from man even unto beast. 8 qui percussit primitiva Aegypti ab homine usque ad pecus
9 He sent forth signs and wonders in the midst of thee, O Egypt: upon Pharao, and upon all his servants. 9 misit signa et portenta in medio tui Aegypte in Pharao et in cunctos servos eius
10 He smote many nations, and slew mighty kings: 10 qui percussit gentes multas et occidit reges fortes
11 Sehon king of the Amorrhites, and Og king of Basan, and all the kingdoms of Chanaan. 11 Seon regem Amorreorum et Og regem Basan et omnia regna Chanaan
12 And gave their land for an inheritance, for an inheritance to his people Israel. 12 et dedit terram eorum hereditatem hereditatem Israhel populo suo
13 Thy name, O Lord, is for ever: thy memorial, O Lord, unto all generations. 13 Domine nomen tuum in aeternum Domine memoriale tuum in generatione et generatione
14 For the Lord will judge his people, and will be entreated in favour of his servants. 14 quia iudicabit Dominus populum suum et in servos suos erit placabilis
15 The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the works of men's hands. 15 idola gentium argentum et aurum opera manuum hominum
16 They have a mouth, but they speak not: they have eyes, but they see not. 16 os habent et non loquentur oculos habent et non videbunt
17 They have ears, but they hear not: neither is there any breath in their mouths. 17 aures habent et non audient sed nec spiritus in ore eorum
18 Let them that make them be like to them: and every one that trusteth in them. 18 similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea omnis qui confidit in eis
19 Bless the Lord, O house of Israel: bless the Lord, O house of Aaron. 19 domus Israhel benedicite Domino domus Aaron benedicite Domino
20 Bless the Lord, O house of Levi: you that fear the Lord, bless the Lord. 20 domus Levi benedicite Domino timentes Dominum benedicite Domino
21 Blessed be the Lord out of Sion, who dwelleth in Jerusalem. 21 benedictus Dominus ex Sion qui habitat in Hierusalem alleluia

Chapter 135

Confitemini Domino. God is to be praised for his wonderful works.

1 Alleluia. Praise the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. 1 confitemini Domino quoniam bonus quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
2 Praise ye the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever. 2 confitemini Deo deorum quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
3 Praise ye the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever. 3 confitemini Domino dominorum quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
4 Who alone doth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever. 4 qui facit mirabilia magna solus quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
5 Who made the heavens in understanding: for his mercy endureth for ever. 5 qui fecit caelos in sapientia quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
6 Who established the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever. 6 qui firmavit terram super aquas quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
7 Who made the great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever. 7 qui fecit luminaria magna quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
8 The sun to rule the day: for his mercy endureth for ever. 8 solem in potestatem diei quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
9 The moon and the stars to rule the night: for his mercy endureth for ever. 9 lunam et stellas in potestatem noctis quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
10 Who smote Egypt with their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever. 10 qui percussit Aegyptum cum primitivis suis quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
11 Who brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever. 11 et eduxit Israhel de medio eorum quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
12 With a mighty hand and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever. 12 in manu valida et in brachio extento quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
13 Who divided the Red Sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever. 13 qui divisit mare Rubrum in divisiones quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
14 And brought out Israel through the midst thereof: for his mercy endureth for ever. 14 et eduxit Israhel in medio eius quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
15 And overthrew Pharao and his host in the Red Sea: for his mercy endureth for ever. 15 et convolvit Pharao et exercitum eius in mari Rubro quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
16 Who led his people through the desert: for his mercy endureth for ever. 16 qui duxit populum suum per desertum quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
17 Who smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever. 17 qui percussit reges magnos quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
18 And slew strong kings: for his mercy endureth for ever. 18 et occidit reges magnificos quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
19 Sehon king of the Amorrhites: for his mercy endureth for ever. 19 Seon regem Amorreorum quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
20 And Og king of Basan: for his mercy endureth for ever. 20 et Og regem Basan quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
21 And he gave their land for an inheritance: for his mercy endureth for ever. 21 et dedit terram eorum in hereditatem quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
22 For an inheritance to his servant Israel: for his mercy endureth for ever. 22 hereditatem Israhel servo suo quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
23 For he was mindful of us in our affliction: for his mercy endureth for ever. 23 quia in humilitate nostra memor fuit nostri quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
24 And he redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever. 24 et redemit nos de hostibus nostris quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
25 Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever. 25 qui dat panem omni carni quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
26 Give glory to the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever. 26 confitemini Deo caeli quoniam in aeternum misericordia eius
27 Give glory to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever. .

Chapter 136

Super flumina. The lamentation of the people of God in their captivity in Babylon. A psalm of David, for Jeremias. For Jeremias. . .For the time of Jeremias, and the captivity of Babylon.

1 Upon the rivers of Babylon, there we sat and wept: when we remembered Sion: 1 super flumina Babylonis ibi sedimus et flevimus cum recordaremur Sion
2 On the willows in the midst thereof we hung up our instruments. 2 super salices in medio eius suspendimus citharas nostras
3 For there they that led us into captivity required of us the words of songs. And they that carried us away, said: Sing ye to us a hymn of the songs of Sion. 3 quoniam ibi interrogaverunt nos qui captivos duxerunt nos verba carminis et qui adfligebant nos laeti canite nobis de canticis Sion
4 How shall we sing the song of the Lord in a strange land? 4 quomodo cantabimus canticum Domini in terra aliena
5 If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand be forgotten. 5 si oblitus fuero tui Hierusalem in oblivione sit dextera mea
6 Let my tongue cleave to my jaws, if I do not remember thee: If I make not Jerusalem the beginning of my joy. 6 adhereat lingua mea gutturi meo si non recordatus fuero tui si non praeposuero Hierusalem in principio laetitiae meae
7 Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom, in the day of Jerusalem: Who say: Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof. 7 memento Domine filiorum Edom in diem Hierusalem dicentium evacuate evacuate usque ad fundamentum eius
8 O daughter of Babylon, miserable: blessed shall he be who shall repay thee thy payment which thou hast paid us. 8 filia Babylon vastata beatus qui retribuet tibi vicissitudinem tuam quam retribuisti nobis
9 Blessed be he that shall take and dash thy little ones against the rock. 9 beatus qui tenebit et adlidet parvulos tuos ad petram

Chapter 137

Confitebor tibi. Thanksgiving to God for his benefits.

1 For David himself. I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart: for thou hast heard the words of my mouth. I will sing praise to thee in the sight of the angels: 1 David confitebor tibi in toto corde meo in conspectu deorum cantabo tibi
2 I will worship towards thy holy temple, and I will give glory to thy name. For thy mercy, and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy holy name above all. 2 adorabo in templo sancto tuo et confitebor nomini tuo super misericordia tua et super veritate tua quia magnificasti super omne nomen tuum eloquium tuum
3 In what day soever I shall call upon thee, hear me: thou shalt multiply strength in my soul. 3 in die invocabo et exaudies me dilatabis animae meae fortitudinem
4 May all the kings of the earth give glory to thee: for they have heard all the words of thy mouth. 4 confiteantur tibi Domine omnes reges terrae quoniam audierunt eloquia oris tui
5 And let them sing in the ways of the Lord: for great is the glory of the Lord. 5 et cantent in viis Domini quoniam magna gloria Domini
6 For the Lord is high, and looketh on the low: and the high he knoweth afar off. 6 quoniam excelsus Dominus et humilem respicit et excelsa de longe cognoscit
7 If I shall walk in the midst of tribulation, thou wilt quicken me: and thou hast stretched forth thy hand against the wrath of my enemies: and thy right hand hath saved me. 7 si ambulavero in medio tribulationis vivificabis me super furorem inimicorum meorum mittes manum tuam et salvabit me dextera tua
8 The Lord will repay for me: thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever: O despise not the works of thy hands. 8 Dominus operabitur pro me Domine misericordia tua in aeternum opera manuum tuarum ne dimittas

Chapter 138

Domine, probasti. God's special providence over his servants.

1 Unto the end, a psalm of David. Lord, thou hast proved me, and known me: 1 pro victoria David canticum Domine investigasti me et cognovisti
2 Thou hast known my sitting down, and my rising up. 2 tu cognovisti sessionem meam et surrectionem meam
3 Thou hast understood my thoughts afar off: my path and my line thou hast searched out. 3 intellexisti malum meum de longe semitam meam et accubitionem meam eventilasti
4 And thou hast foreseen all my ways: for there is no speech in my tongue. 4 et omnes vias meas intellexisti quia non est eloquium in lingua mea
5 Behold, O Lord, thou hast known all things, the last and those of old: thou hast formed me, and hast laid thy hand upon me. 5 ecce Domine nosti omnia retrorsum et ante formasti me et posuisti super me manum tuam
6 Thy knowledge is become wonderful to me: it is high, and I cannot reach to it. 6 super me est scientia et excelsior est non potero ad eam
7 Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy face? 7 quo ibo ab spiritu tuo et quo a facie tua fugiam
8 If I ascend into heaven, thou art there: if I descend into hell, thou art present. 8 si ascendero in caelum ibi es tu si iacuero in inferno ades
9 If I take my wings early in the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea: 9 si sumpsero pinnas diluculo habitavero in novissimo maris
10 Even there also shall thy hand lead me: and thy right hand shall hold me. 10 etiam ibi manus tua deducet me et tenebit me dextera tua
11 And I said: Perhaps darkness shall cover me: and night shall be my light in my pleasures. 11 si dixero forte tenebrae operient me nox quoque lux erit circa me
12 But darkness shall not be dark to thee, and night shall be light all the day: the darkness thereof, and the light thereof are alike to thee. 12 nec tenebrae habent tenebras apud te et nox quasi dies lucet similes sunt tenebrae et lux
13 For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast protected me from my mother's womb. 13 quoniam tu possedisti renes meos orsusque es me in utero matris meae
14 I will praise thee, for thou art fearfully magnified: wonderful are thy works, and my soul knoweth right well. 14 confitebor tibi quoniam terribiliter magnificasti me mirabilia opera tua et anima mea novit nimis
15 My bone is not hidden from thee, which thou hast made in secret: and my substance in the lower parts of the earth. 15 non sunt operta ossa mea a te quibus factus sum in abscondito imaginatus sum in novissimis terrae
16 Thy eyes did see my imperfect being, and in thy book all shall be written: days shall be formed, and no one in them. 16 informem adhuc me viderunt oculi tui et in libro tuo omnes scribentur dies formatae sunt et non est una in eis
17 But to me thy friends, O God, are made exceedingly honourable: their principality is exceedingly strengthened. 17 mihi autem quam honorabiles facti sunt amici tui Deus quam fortes pauperes eorum
18 I will number them, and they shall be multiplied above the sand, I rose up and am still with thee. 18 dinumerabo eos et harena plures erunt evigilavi et adhuc sum tecum
19 If thou wilt kill the wicked, O God: ye men of blood, depart from me: 19 si occideris Deus impium viri sanguinum declinate a me
20 Because you say in thought: They shall receive thy cities in vain. 20 qui contradicent tibi scelerate elati sunt frustra adversarii tui
21 Have I not hated them, O Lord, that hated thee: and pined away because of thy enemies? 21 nonne odientes te Domine odivi et contra adversarios tuos distabui
22 I have hated them with a perfect hatred: and they are become enemies to me. 22 perfecto odio oderam illos inimici facti sunt mihi
23 Prove me, O God, and know my heart: examine me, and know my paths. 23 scrutare me Deus et cognosce cor meum proba me et scito cogitationes meas
24 And see if there be in me the way of iniquity: and lead me in the eternal way. 24 et vide si via idoli in me est et deduc me in via aeterna

Chapter 139

Eripe me, Domine. A prayer to be delivered from the wicked.

1 Unto the end, a psalm of David. 1 pro victoria canticum David
2 Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: rescue me from the unjust man. 2 erue me Domine ab homine malo a viris iniquis serva me
3 Who have devised iniquities in their hearts: all the day long they designed battles. 3 qui cogitaverunt malitias in corde tota die versati sunt in proeliis
4 They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent: the venom of asps is under their lips. 4 exacuerunt linguam suam quasi serpens venenum aspidis sub labiis eorum semper
5 Keep me, O Lord, from the hand of the wicked: and from unjust men deliver me. Who have proposed to supplant my steps: 5 custodi me Domine de manu impii a viro iniquitatum serva me qui cogitaverunt subplantare gressus meos
6 The proud have hidden a net for me. And they have stretched out cords for a snare: they have laid for me a stumblingblock by the wayside. 6 absconderunt superbi laqueum mihi et funibus extenderunt rete iuxta semitam offendiculum posuerunt mihi semper
7 I said to the Lord: Thou art my God: hear, O Lord, the voice of my supplication. 7 dixi Domino Deus meus tu audi Domine vocem deprecationis meae
8 O Lord, Lord, the strength of my salvation: thou hast overshadowed my head in the day of battle. 8 Domine Deus fortitudo salutis meae protexisti caput meum in die belli
9 Give me not up, O Lord, from my desire to the wicked: they have plotted against me; do not thou forsake me, lest they should triumph. 9 ne des Domine desideria impii scelera eius ne effundantur et eleventur semper
10 The head of them compassing me about: the labour of their lips shall overwhelm them. 10 amaritudo convivarum meorum labor labiorum eorum operiat eos
11 Burning coals shall fall upon them; thou wilt cast them down into the fire: in miseries they shall not be able to stand. 11 cadent super eos carbones ignis deicies eos in foveas ut non consurgant
12 A man full of tongue shall not be established in the earth: evil shall catch the unjust man unto destruction. 12 vir linguosus non dirigetur in terra virum iniquum mala capient in interitu
13 I know that the Lord will do justice to the needy, and will revenge the poor. 13 scio quod faciet Dominus causam inopis iudicia pauperum
14 But as for the just, they shall give glory to thy name: and the upright shall dwell with thy countenance. 14 attamen iusti confitebuntur nomini tuo habitabunt recti cum vultu tuo

Chapter 140

Domine, clamavi. A prayer against sinful words, and deceitful flatterers. A psalm of David.

1 I have cried to thee, O Lord, hear me: hearken to my voice, when I cry to thee. 1 canticum David Domine clamavi ad te festina mihi exaudi vocem meam clamantis ad te
2 Let my prayer be directed as incense in thy sight; the lifting up of my hands, as evening sacrifice. 2 dirigatur oratio mea sicut incensum in conspectu tuo elevatio manuum mearum sacrificium vespertinum
3 Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth: and a door round about my lips. 3 pone Domine custodem ori meo serva paupertatem labiorum meorum
4 Incline not my heart to evil words; to make excuses in sins. With men that work iniquity: and I will not communicate with the choicest of them. 4 ne declines cor meum in verbum malum volvere cogitationes impias cum viris operantibus iniquitatem neque comedere in deliciis eorum
5 The just man shall correct me in mercy, and shall reprove me: but let not the oil of the sinner fatten my head. For my prayer shall still be against the things with which they are well pleased: 5 corripiat me iustus in misericordia et arguat me oleum amaritudinis non inpinguet caput meum quia adhuc et oratio mea pro malitiis eorum
6 Their judges falling upon the rock have been swallowed up. They shall hear my words, for they have prevailed: 6 sublati sunt iuxta petram iudices eorum et audient verba mea quoniam decora sunt
7 As when the thickness of the earth is broken up upon the ground: Our bones are scattered by the side of hell. 7 sicut agricola cum scindit terram sic dissipata sunt ossa nostra in ore inferi
8 But to thee, O Lord, Lord, are my eyes: in thee have I put my trust, take not away my soul. 8 quia ad te Domine Deus oculi mei in te speravi ne evacues animam meam
9 Keep me from the snare, which they have laid for me, and from the stumblingblocks of them that work iniquity. 9 custodi me de manibus laquei quod posuerunt mihi et de offendiculis operantium iniquitatem
10 The wicked shall fall in his net: I am alone until I pass. 10 incident in rete eius impii simul ego autem transibo

Chapter 141

Voce mea. A prayer of David in extremity of danger.

1 Of understanding for David, A prayer when he was in the cave. [1 Kings 24.] 1 eruditio David cum esset in spelunca oratio
2 I cried to the Lord with my voice: with my voice I made supplication to the Lord. 2 voce mea ad Dominum clamavi voce mea ad Dominum deprecatus sum
3 In his sight I pour out my prayer, and before him I declare my trouble: 3 effundam in conspectu eius eloquium meum tribulationem meam coram illo adnuntiabo
4 When my spirit failed me, then thou knewest my paths. In this way wherein I walked, they have hidden a snare for me. 4 cum anxius in me fuerit spiritus meus tu enim nosti semitam meam in via hac qua ambulabo absconderunt laqueum mihi
5 I looked on my right hand, and beheld, and there was no one that would know me. Flight hath failed me: and there is no one that hath regard to my soul. 5 respice ad dexteram et vide quia non sit qui cognoscat me periit fuga a me non est qui quaerat animam meam
6 I cried to thee, O Lord: I said: Thou art my hope, my portion in the land of the living. 6 clamavi ad te Domine dixi tu spes mea pars mea in terra viventium
7 Attend to my supplication: for I am brought very low. Deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I. 7 ausculta deprecationem meam quoniam infirmatus sum nimis libera me a persecutoribus quoniam confortati sunt super me
8 Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the just wait for me, until thou reward me. 8 educ de carcere animam meam ut confiteatur nomini tuo me expectant iusti cum retribueris mihi

Chapter 142

Domine, exaudi. The psalmist in tribulation calleth upon God for his delivery. The seventh penitential psalm.

1 A psalm of David, when his son Absalom pursued him. [2 Kings 17.] Hear, O Lord, my prayer: give ear to my supplication in thy truth: hear me in thy justice. 1 canticum David Domine exaudi orationem meam ausculta deprecationem meam in veritate tua exaudi me in iustitia tua
2 And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight no man living shall be justified. 2 et non venias ad iudicandum cum servo tuo quia non iustificabitur in conspectu tuo omnis vivens
3 For the enemy hath persecuted my soul: he hath brought down my life to the earth. He hath made me to dwell in darkness as those that have been dead of old: 3 persecutus est enim inimicus animam meam confregit in terra vitam meam posuit me in tenebris quasi mortuos antiquos
4 And my spirit is in anguish within me: my heart within me is troubled. 4 et anxius fuit in me spiritus meus in medio mei sollicitum fuit cor meum
5 I remembered the days of old, I meditated on all thy works: I meditated upon the works of thy hands. 5 recordabar dierum antiquorum meditabar omnia opera tua facta manuum tuarum loquebar
6 I stretched forth my hands to thee: my soul is as earth without water unto thee. 6 expandi manus meas ad te anima mea quasi terra sitiens ad te semper
7 Hear me speedily, O Lord: my spirit hath fainted away. Turn not away thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit. 7 cito exaudi me Domine defecit spiritus meus ne abscondas faciem tuam a me et conparabor descendentibus in lacum
8 Cause me to hear thy mercy in the morning; for in thee have I hoped. Make the way known to me, wherein I should walk: for I have lifted up my soul to thee. 8 fac me audire mane misericordiam tuam quoniam in te confido notam fac mihi viam in qua ambulo quoniam ad te levavi animam meam
9 Deliver me from my enemies, O Lord, to thee have I fled: 9 libera me de inimicis meis Domine a te protectus sum
10 Teach me to do thy will, for thou art my God. Thy good spirit shall lead me into the right land: 10 doce me ut faciam voluntatem tuam quia tu Deus meus spiritus tuus bonus deducet me in terra recta
11 for thy name's sake, O Lord, thou wilt quicken me in thy justice. Thou wilt bring my soul out of trouble: 11 propter nomen tuum Domine vivificabis me in iustitia tua educes de angustia animam meam
12 And in thy mercy thou wilt destroy my enemies. And thou wilt cut off all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant. 12 et in misericordia tua dissipabis inimicos meos et perdes omnes ligantes animam meam ego enim sum servus tuus

Chapter 143

Benedictus Dominus. The prophet praiseth God, and prayeth to be delivered from his enemies. No worldly happiness is to be compared with that of serving God. A psalm of David against Goliath.

1 Blessed be the Lord my God, who teacheth my hands to fight, and my fingers to war. 1 David benedictus Dominus fortis meus qui docet manus meas ad proelium digitos meos ad bellum
2 My mercy, and my refuge: my support, and my deliverer: My protector, and I have hoped in him: who subdueth my people under me. 2 misericordia mea et fortitudo mea auxiliator meus et salvator meus scutum meum et in ipso speravi qui subiecit populos mihi
3 Lord, what is man, that thou art made known to him? or the son of man, that thou makest account of him? 3 Domine quid est homo quia cognoscis eum filius hominis quia conputas eum
4 Man is like to vanity: his days pass away like a shadow. 4 homo vanitati adsimilatus est dies eius quasi umbra pertransiens
5 Lord, bow down thy heavens and descend: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke. 5 Domine inclina caelos tuos et descende tange montes et fumigabunt
6 Send forth lightning, and thou shalt scatter them: shoot out thy arrows, and thou shalt trouble them. 6 mica fulmine et dissipa eos mitte sagittam tuam et interfice illos
7 Put forth thy hand from on high, take me out, and deliver me from many waters: from the hand of strange children: 7 extende manum tuam de excelso libera me et erue me de aquis multis de manu filiorum alienorum
8 Whose mouth hath spoken vanity: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity. 8 quorum os locutum est vanitatem et dextera eorum dextera mendacii
9 To thee, O God, I will sing a new canticle: on the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises to thee. 9 Deus canticum novum cantabo tibi in psalterio decacordo psallam tibi
10 Who givest salvation to kings: who hast redeemed thy servant David from the malicious sword: 10 qui dat salutem regibus qui eruit David servum suum de gladio pessimo
11 Deliver me, And rescue me out of the hand of strange children; whose mouth hath spoken vanity: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity: 11 libera me et erue me de manu filiorum alienorum quorum os locutum est vanitatem et dextera eorum dextera mendacii
12 Whose sons are as new plants in their youth: Their daughters decked out, adorned round about after the similitude of a temple: 12 ut sint filii nostri quasi plantatio crescens in adulescentia sua filiae nostrae quasi anguli ornati ad similitudinem templi
13 Their storehouses full, flowing out of this into that. Their sheep fruitful in young, abounding in their goings forth: 13 promptuaria nostra plena et supereffundentia ex hoc in illud pecora nostra in milibus et innumerabilia in conpitis nostris
14 Their oxen fat. There is no breach of wall, nor passage, nor crying out in their streets. 14 tauri nostri pingues non est interruptio et non est egressus et non est ululatus in plateis nostris
15 They have called the people happy, that hath these things: but happy is that people whose God is the Lord. 15 beatus populus cuius talia sunt beatus populus cuius Dominus Deus suus

Chapter 144

Exaltabo te, Deus. A psalm of praise, to the infinite majesty of God.

1 Praise, for David himself. I will extol thee, O God my king: and I will bless thy name for ever; yea, for ever and ever. 1 hymnus David aleph exaltabo te Deus meus rex et benedicam nomini tuo in aeternum et ultra
2 Every day will I bless thee: and I will praise thy name for ever; yea, for ever and ever. 2 beth in omni die benedicam tibi et laudabo nomen tuum in sempiternum iugiter
3 Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised: and of his greatness there is no end. 3 gimel magnus Deus et laudabilis nimis et magnificentiae eius non est inventio
4 Generation and generation shall praise thy works: and they shall declare thy power. 4 deleth generatio ad generationem laudabit opera tua et fortitudines tuas adnuntiabunt
5 They shall speak of the magnificence of the glory of thy holiness: and shall tell thy wondrous works. 5 he decorem gloriae magnitudinis tuae et verba mirabilium tuorum loquar
6 And they shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and shall declare thy greatness. 6 vav et fortitudinem horribilium tuorum loquentur et magnitudines tuas narrabo
7 They shall publish the memory of the abundance of thy sweetness: and shall rejoice in thy justice. 7 zai memoriam multae bonitatis tuae loquentur et iustitias tuas laudabunt
8 The Lord is gracious and merciful: patient and plenteous in mercy. 8 heth clemens et misericors Dominus patiens et multae miserationis
9 The Lord is sweet to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works. 9 teth bonus Dominus omnibus et misericordiae eius in universa opera eius
10 Let all thy works, O lord, praise thee: and let thy saints bless thee. 10 ioth confiteantur tibi Domine omnia opera tua et sancti tui benedicant tibi
11 They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom: and shall tell of thy power: 11 caph gloriam regni tui dicent et fortitudines tuas loquentur
12 To make thy might known to the sons of men: and the glory of the magnificence of thy kingdom. 12 lameth ut ostendant filiis hominum fortitudines eius et gloriam decoris regni eius
13 Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages: and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations. The Lord is faithful in all his words: and holy in all his works. 13 mem regnum tuum regnum omnium saeculorum et potestas tua in omni generatione et generatione
14 The Lord lifteth up all that fall: and setteth up all that are cast down. 14 samech sustentat Dominus omnes corruentes et erigit universos iacentes
15 The eyes of all hope in thee, O Lord: and thou givest them meat in due season. 15 ain oculi eorum in te sperant et tu das eis escam suam in tempore suo
16 Thou openest thy hand, and fillest with blessing every living creature. 16 fe aperis manus tuas et imples omne animal refectione
17 The Lord is just in all his ways: and holy in all his works. 17 sade iustus Dominus in omnibus viis suis et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis
18 The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him: to all that call upon him in truth. 18 coph iuxta est Dominus omnibus qui invocant eum omnibus qui invocant eum in veritate
19 He will do the will of them that fear him: and he will hear their prayer, and save them. 19 res placitum timentium se faciet et clamorem eorum audiet et salvabit eos
20 The Lord keepeth all them that love him; but all the wicked he will destroy. 20 sen custodit Dominus omnes diligentes se et universos impios conteret
21 My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord: and let all flesh bless his holy name forever; yea, for ever and ever. 21 thau laudem Domini loquetur os meum et benedicet omnis caro nomini sancto eius in aeternum et iugiter

Chapter 145

Lauda, anima. We are not to trust in men, but in God alone.

1 Alleluia, of Aggeus and Zacharias. 1 alleluia
2 Praise the Lord, O my soul, in my life I will praise the Lord: I will sing to my God as long as I shall be. Put not your trust in princes: 2 lauda anima mea Dominum laudabo Dominum in vita mea cantabo Deo meo quamdiu sum nolite confidere in principibus
3 In the children of men, in whom there is no salvation. 3 in filio hominis cui non est salus
4 His spirit shall go forth, and he shall return into his earth: in that day all their thoughts shall perish. 4 egredietur spiritus eius et revertetur in humum suam in die illa peribunt cogitationes eius
5 Blessed is he who hath the God of Jacob for his helper, whose hope is in the Lord his God: 5 beatus cuius Deus Iacob auxiliator eius spes eius in Domino Deo suo
6 Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all things that are in them. 6 qui fecit caelos et terram mare et omnia quae in eis sunt
7 Who keepeth truth for ever: who executeth judgment for them that suffer wrong: who giveth food to the hungry. The Lord looseth them that are fettered: 7 et custodit veritatem in sempiternum qui facit iudicium calumniam sustinentibus et dat panem esurientibus Dominus solvit vinctos
8 The Lord enlighteneth the blind. The Lord lifteth up them that are cast down: the Lord loveth the just. 8 Dominus inluminat caecos Dominus erigit adlisos Dominus diligit iustos
9 The Lord keepeth the strangers, he will support the fatherless and the widow: and the ways of sinners he will destroy. 9 Dominus custodit advenas pupillum et viduam suscipiet et viam impiorum conteret
10 The Lord shall reign for ever: thy God, O Sion, unto generation and generation. 10 regnabit Dominus in aeternum Deus tuus Sion in generationem et generationem

Chapter 146

Laudate Dominum. An exhortation to praise God for his benefits.

1 Alleluia. Praise ye the Lord, because psalm is good: to our God be joyful and comely praise. 1 alleluia laudate Dominum quoniam bonum est canticum Dei nostri quoniam decorum est pulchra laudatio
2 The Lord buildeth up Jerusalem: he will gather together the dispersed of Israel. 2 aedificabit Hierusalem Dominus eiectos Israhel congregabit
3 Who healeth the broken of heart, and bindeth up their bruises. 3 qui sanat contritos corde et alligat plagas eorum
4 Who telleth the number of the stars: and calleth them all by their names. 4 qui numerat multitudinem stellarum et omnes nomine suo vocat
5 Great is our Lord, and great is his power: and of his wisdom there is no number. 5 magnus Dominus noster et multus fortitudine prudentiae eius non est numerus
6 The Lord lifteth up the meek, and bringeth the wicked down even to the ground. 6 suscipiens mansuetos Dominus humilians impios usque ad terram
7 Sing ye to the Lord with praise: sing to our God upon the harp. 7 canite Domino in confessione canite Deo nostro in cithara
8 Who covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth. Who maketh grass to grow on the mountains, and herbs for the service of men. 8 qui operit caelos nubibus et praebet terrae pluviam et oriri facit in montibus germen
9 Who giveth to beasts their food: and to the young ravens that call upon him. 9 qui dat iumentis panem suum filiis corvi clamantibus
10 He shall not delight in the strength of the horse: nor take pleasure in the legs of a man. 10 non est in fortitudine equi voluntas eius neque in tibiis viri placetur ei
11 The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear him: and in them that hope in his mercy. 11 placetur Domino in his qui timent eum et expectant misericordiam eius

Chapter 147

Lauda, Jerusalem. The church is called upon to praise God for his peculiar graces and favours to his people. In the Hebrew, this psalm is joined to the foregoing. Alleluia.

12 Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem: praise thy God, O Sion. 12 lauda Hierusalem Dominum cane Deum tuum Sion
13 Because he hath strengthened the bolts of thy gates, he hath blessed thy children within thee. 13 quia confortavit vectes portarum tuarum benedixit filiis tuis in medio tui
14 Who hath placed peace in thy borders: and filleth thee with the fat of corn. 14 qui posuit terminum tuum pacem adipe frumenti saturavit te
15 Who sendeth forth his speech to the earth: his word runneth swiftly. 15 qui emittit eloquium suum terrae velociter curret verbum eius
16 Who giveth snow like wool: scattereth mists like ashes. 16 qui dat nivem quasi lanam pruinas quasi cinerem spargit
17 He sendeth his crystal like morsels: who shall stand before the face of his cold? 17 proicit glaciem suam quasi buccellas ante faciem frigoris eius quis stabit
18 He shall send out his word, and shall melt them: his wind shall blow, and the waters shall run. 18 mittet verbum suum et solvet illa spirabit spiritu suo et fluent aquae
19 Who declareth his word to Jacob: his justices and his judgments to Israel. 19 qui adnuntiat verbum suum Iacob praecepta sua et iudicia sua Israhel
20 He hath not done in like manner to every nation: and his judgments he hath not made manifest to them. Alleluia. 20 non fecit similiter omni genti et iudicia eius non cognoscent alleluia

Chapter 148

Laudate Dominum de caelis. All creatures are invited to praise their Creator. Alleluia.

1 Praise ye the Lord from the heavens: praise ye him in the high places. 1 alleluia laudate Dominum de caelis laudate eum in excelsis
2 Praise ye him, all his angels, praise ye him, all his hosts. 2 laudate eum omnes angeli eius laudate eum omnes exercitus eius
3 Praise ye him, O sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars and light. 3 laudate eum sol et luna laudate eum omnes stellae luminis
4 Praise him, ye heavens of heavens: and let all the waters that are above the heavens 4 laudate eum caeli caelorum et aquae quae super caelos sunt
5 Praise the name of the Lord. For he spoke, and they were made: he commanded, and they were created. 5 laudent nomen Domini quoniam ipse mandavit et creata sunt
6 He hath established them for ever, and for ages of ages: he hath made a decree, and it shall not pass away. 6 et statuit ea in saeculum et in saeculum praeceptum dedit et non praeteribit
7 Praise the Lord from the earth, ye dragons, and all ye deeps: 7 laudate Dominum de terra dracones et omnes abyssi
8 Fire, hail, snow, ice, stormy winds, which fulfil his word: 8 ignis et grando nix et glacies ventus turbo quae facitis sermonem eius
9 Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars: 9 montes et omnes colles lignum fructiferum et universae cedri
10 Beasts and all cattle: serpents and feathered fowls: 10 bestiae et omnia iumenta reptilia et aves volantes
11 Kings of the earth and all people: princes and all judges of the earth: 11 reges terrae et omnes populi principes et universi iudices terrae
12 Young men and maidens: let the old with the younger, praise the name of the Lord: 12 iuvenes et virgines senes cum pueris laudent nomen Domini
13 For his name alone is exalted. 13 quoniam sublime nomen eius solius
14 The praise of him is above heaven and earth: and he hath exalted the horn of his people. A hymn to all his saints to the children of Israel, a people approaching to him. Alleluia. 14 gloria eius in caelo et in terra et exaltavit cornu populi sui laus omnibus sanctis eius filiis Israhel populo adpropinquanti sibi alleluia

Chapter 149

Cantate Domino. The church is particularly bound to praise God. Alleluia.

1 Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: let his praise be in the church of the saints. 1 alleluia cantate Domino canticum novum laus eius in congregatione sanctorum
2 Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: and let the children of Sion be joyful in their king. 2 laetetur Israhel in factore suo filii Sion exultent in rege suo
3 Let them praise his name in choir: let them sing to him with the timbrel and the psaltery. 3 laudent nomen eius in choro in tympano et cithara cantent ei
4 For the Lord is well pleased with his people: and he will exalt the meek unto salvation. 4 quia conplacet sibi Dominus in populo suo exaltabit mansuetos in Iesu
5 The saints shall rejoice in glory: they shall be joyful in their beds. 5 exultabunt sancti in gloria laudabunt in cubilibus suis
6 The high praises of God shall be in their mouth: and two-edged swords in their hands: 6 exaltationes Dei in gutture eorum et gladii ancipites in manibus eorum
7 To execute vengeance upon the nations, chastisements among the people: 7 ad faciendam vindictam in gentibus increpationes in populis
8 To bind their kings with fetters, and their nobles with manacles of iron. 8 ut alligent reges eorum catenis et inclitos eorum conpedibus ferreis
9 To execute upon them the judgment that is written: this glory is to all his saints. Alleluia. 9 ut faciant in eis iudicium scriptum decor est omnium sanctorum eius alleluia

Chapter 150

Laudate Dominum in sanctis. An exhortation to praise God with all sorts of instruments. Alleluia.

1 Praise ye the Lord in his holy places: praise ye him in the firmament of his power. 1 alleluia laudate Deum in sancto eius laudate eum in fortitudine potentiae eius
2 Praise ye him for his mighty acts: praise ye him according to the multitude of his greatness. 2 laudate eum in fortitudinibus eius laudate eum iuxta multitudinem magnificentiae suae
3 Praise him with the sound of trumpet: praise him with psaltery and harp. 3 laudate eum in clangore bucinae laudate eum in psalterio et cithara
4 Praise him with timbrel and choir: praise him with strings and organs. 4 laudate eum in tympano et choro laudate eum in cordis et organo
5 Praise him on high sounding cymbals: praise him on cymbals of joy: let every spirit praise the Lord. Alleluia. 5 laudate eum in cymbalis sonantibus laudate eum in cymbalis tinnientibus
. . 6 omne quod spirat laudet Dominum alleluia
